story:
The 43 Lions Clubs of central and southern Virginia have formed The Virginia Lions District 24-B Mobile Health Unit Committee, Inc.  The mission of this organization is to provide free vision and hearing screenings to children and adults in our region.

Why do we need a Mobile Health Unit?

  • 25% of children have some type of vision problem
  • Some eye disorders, if left untreated can cause loss of vision in the effected eye
  • Eye charts that are typically used in schools and doctor's offices are best for detecting near-sightedness.  They often fail to detect other eye disorders. 
  • 70% of juvenile delinquents have an undiagnosed vision problem
  • Undiagnosed vision problems cause children to have trouble learning to read, they subsequently fall behind in school and this often leads to behavioral problems and even criminal activity. 
  • Central and Southern Virginia have a high rate of uninsured people, poverty and unemployment.  Therefore families are less likely to visit eye doctors than families in other regions. 
  • There are currently 4 mobile health units operated by Lions Clubs in Virginia.  These vehicles are on the road approximately 200 days per year and they screen over 30,000 people annually!

What does it cost to get this vehicle on the road?

  • The total cost of a brand new fully customized bus with all of the vision and hearing testing equipment is $120,000.
  • Our organization has raised $15,000 so far and our goal for this campaign is $15,000.
  • Once we reach our goal, we will be apply to get matching grants from the Lions of Virginia Foundation, the Lions Clubs International Foundation and other foundations. 
  • Therefore the money that you give is really being matched twice, effectively tripling your donation.
  • The Virginia Lions District 24-B Mobile Health Unit Committee, Inc. is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and all donations to our organization are tax-deductible.

story:
Who Are We?

My name is Grahame Russell, for over 20 years director of Rights Action.  As part of this work, I have worked extensively in Mayan Q’eqchi’ communities of eastern Guatemala that, for decades, have suffered repression and violent evictions caused by Canadian mining companies: INCO, Skye Resources and Hudbay Minerals.

This campaign is to raise funds for the on-going health and wheelchair needs of a young Q’eqchi’ man, German Chub.

German Chub Choc, Victim of Hudbay Minerals

Of all the victims of Hudbay Minerals’ violent attempt (2008-2011) to operate a nickel mine in the Q’eqchi’ territories of eastern Guatemala, the on-going health situation of German Chub – paralyzed from the chest down; loss of use of one lung; wheel-chair bound; a bullet still in his body, close to his spinal column – is the most pressing.

On September 27, 2009, German Chub, a young man and father of one, was shot by Mynor Padilla, a former Colonel in the Guatemalan Army and head of security for Hudbay Minerals in Guatemala.  That same day, Mynor Padilla was also responsible for the murder of Adolfo Ich, a community leader, father of five and teacher.

Since that time, German – along with other victims – has been involved in struggles for justice, in a criminal case in Guatemala against Mynor Padilla, and in civil lawsuits in Canada against Hudbay Minerals. (More information about lawsuits in Canada: www.chocversushudbay.com; about criminal trial in Guatemala: info@rightsaction.org)

Defensora: Please view this film to learn more about the struggles of German and the Mayan Q’eqchi’ people for their lands and justice. (Trailer: www.defensorathefilm.com)

Since being shot, and left for dead, German struggles mightily, on a daily-weekly basis, to survive and provide for his child and aging parents.  The bullet that left German paralyzed from the chest down, also pierced and damaged one of his lungs and remains lodged precariously close to his spinal column.

Given his now permanently vulnerable condition, German regularly falls very ill; he has constant expenses to buy supplies (catheters, gloves, pills, etc) just to get through a healthy day; he has regular expenses to buy replacement parts for his wheelchair, living as he does in an utterly non-wheelchair friendly environment; he needs regular medical check-ups to xray his spinal column to see if the position of the bullet is shifting.

As German continues with his struggle for justice in Canada and Guatemala, and fair compensation, please help Rights Action raise $7,500 that will provide one year’s worth of health supplies and spare parts for his wheelchair.

This support will not resolve German’s underlying life-long challenges, now that he is wheelchair bound, but it will enable him to get on with his life, with son, wife and parents, while we continue with the broader struggles for justice and proper compensation.

For more information about this, and other mining-related struggles, contact Grahame at Rights Action.  We are involved in half-a-dozen mining related struggles, and there have been many killings, gang-rapes, forced evictions, and other repression.  I would gladly send you more information about all this.

At this point in time, because of the nature of his injuries and condition, German’s needs are the most pressing.

Other Ways You Can Help

• Please spread the word about this campaign, and the broader mining injustice related struggles that it is a part of.

• Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank-you.

Grahame Russell, director info@rightsaction.org, www.rightsaction.org, www.facebook.com/rightsaction.org, https://twitter.com/RightsAction

story:
Thank you so much everyone who has donated so far!! We are about half way to our target!!

It's very exciting times in the studio, the building has begun.  We have used the funds from our first campaign to pay for the following:

- Levelled flooring

- patched up leaks and holes

- put walls put up

We are off to a flying start!!! We still have a few more things to go to make this the best community performance space possible.

- Chairs

- Carpet 

- Sound system

- Lighting

We have added some new perks for local businesses... check them out and share them with your friends!!!


Again we want to say a huge thank you to everyone who has contributed so far, we are so proud to be apart of such an awesome community!

story:
Flawless Skin Care:

I have a dream. A dream to open my own spa. That dream takes baby steps and I've already begun that journey. I am currently renting a spa space from a friend in an office building with 5 other people. I would love to expand this dream and rent out the space caddy corner to this current location. It would be absolutely perfect for estheticians. My own space to come and go as I please around my own schedule. The rent for the place is $450/month and if I can raise enough funds to rent for the next year, then I can worry only about income for my home and building clientele. I can't currently afford my home + bills with my career needing rent as well. I have been an esthetician for 8 years and after the sudden and unexpected loss of my job, I feel like now is the perfect time to branch out on my own. As a single mother raising a little girl, it is very important to me to have a flexible schedule. I love being able to work my job around my family life and not family life around my job. I have dreams bigger than this space but I need to begin somewhere. I have already invested in new waxing supplies, facial product for my back bar, among other things needed to run a spa. I am looking at getting a better facial machine, hot towel cabby, table, and more product for a better variety. This all takes money and at the moment, that is running thin. If given this financial help, I'll be able to get Flawless Skin Care up and running, providing another small business to my community, and helping other estheticians to branch out on their own as well. This would secure the future of my business for the next year. No fear in not coming up with the rent to continue as it will be paid in full. The best thing about this campaign is that you're donating and getting something in return. The majority of the options here provide you with a relaxing service of your own. Come and see what we're all about! Tell your friends. Spread the word. Donate to a great cause and enjoy an awesome spa service.

How Much I Need

I am looking to raise $5,000. I want the lease to match that of the massage space that is currently paid through October. So, $4,950 is needed to pay the rent in full and the other $50 would be used to put a door up to divide the space. If I don't reach that goal than any money received will go directly into the spa. Whether it be providing more product or updating our machinery. It will all go towards making the space that much better for you; our client and supporter. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Pray. Pray for me and my business. I believe with my whole heart that I am doing what I was called to do. 

Tell. Tell your friends about my campaign and about my business. Tell everyone you know!

Share. Share me for Christmas as a gift or for someone's birthday. Let's get those people through my door! Share me on social media. 

Give. Give me ratings to boost my business. Give even a $1 as every amount will count.

Love. Love me and support me through encouraging words. 


I thank you for your time and your consideration for donation.

story:
Payam Data Recovery is a world leader in hard drive data recovery services - having been recovering data for over 17 years, it's heartbreaking when we have to tell our customers from all around the world but mostly in Australia and New Zealand that their hard drive was too badly damaged in very specific cases and that all of their data from their hard drive is gone forever!  

Most people are devastated if they have baby photos, holiday photos, home movies and other personal data they did not backup. We can fix 95% of problems but for the past 50 years, there has been no real solution that works that can fix deep scratches on hard drive platters while still allowing a data recovery company to recover the data.

Impossible is a word other people use when they can't do something, we aim to research and develop a world 1st method to fix severe damage on hard drive platters but we need your support. As a small company in a niche industry, we need your help to fund a dedicated research team and new lab with world leading experts in different science fields to join our team for this special project. We have limited by the resources and limitations of our own data recovery engineers and technicians - we are reaching out to some of the smartest minds in the world, the elite people with the highest IQ on the planet to join us for a 12 month research project to help solve this problem.

Each year we have clients who tell us their hard drive fell of a table or was knocked of a desk or something similar, as a result - the hard drive was damaged. We can normally fix 95% of these problems but if the platter is scratched, in most times the heads fail when we replace them/repair the drive - and no data can be read due to the deep scratch on the platters.

There is no company in the world that has a solution for this, the current providers who claim this only do so for marketing hype and we have tested their methods and they do not work. Some companies charge up to $50,000 US for a method we believe does not work. Our aim is to develop this new method to fix platters on hard drives then offer it at a fixed price of $500 US worldwide (when the normal price for data recovery is $1000-$3000 US for badly damaged drives).

We need your help to fund the cost of these world leading science experts to join our team for 12 months. We will find a solution and save thousands of peoples lost memories that are currently are lost forever.

story:
Short summary

Hi my name is Kristof. I am a Hungarian student. I study economics.

To cover my living expenses I started to work as a rickshaw driver. I like doing it. Anyway my hobby is cycling.

But what I like the most in it, is that I make people happy. They get on the rickshaw and smile.

Budapest is a lovely city in the heart of Europe. Very rich in history, architecture and culture. And people make it live, they shop in the market halls, sit around in cafes and restaurants, and go out to pubs and nightclubs. I like sharing this spirit with my clients. I tell them about the places, not only basic things, but stories that make the city what it is. And I'm happy they enjoy it.

At the moment I rent the rickshaw weekly. A weekly rental fee is about 80-100 USD (depends on season) that takes great part of what I earn away from me.
I wish I had my own rickshaw and did not have to pay these high expenses just to be able to work what I like.

I would politely ask you to contribute to my own rickshaw. With this generous deed you would not only help me to get rid of the disproportionately high rental expenses, but you would also make my dream come true.
To have my own rickshaw a thing that its owner can love as a cyclist loves his/her bike.
And with this, which is the most important, I would become independent and free.
I would be able to make a living by an activity

  • I like
  • the clients enjoy
  • fully flexible and compatible with my studies.

In return I offer free rickshaw rides, sightseeing tours, shopping afternoons and pub crawls.
Those, who cannot come to Budapest will receive a special rickshaw sightseeing video recorded in first person mode very similar to a real rickshaw experience.

Please support and enjoy the perks!

Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

1500$ is an approximate market price of a used, working rickshaw.
The funding is flexible. The quality of my own rickshaw depends on how much I receive.
I will keep you up to date with the process of buying and refurbishing or building my own rickshaw.
The perks are fully feasible without reaching the target, as I can take you on a ride with the current rented rickshaw as well. I hope I will with my own! :D

All my backers will receive a thank you letter.
Those, who contribute 10$ or more will receive the first person sightseeing video we will shoot in spring.
Do not hesitate to contribute more even if you cannot come to Budapest in the near future or at all. You will receive the video and the perk you buy is valid for years, any time you decide to come. You can also assign your perk to anyone. Even to local children or families. They will enjoy it! And you will receive a short video about their experience. We'll get in contact and discuss everything. :D

Risks & Challenges

One possible challenge is finding a suitable rickshaw and making it perfect. However, I have great help with this one since a close friend of mine is a skilled bike mechanic. I am sure that with his help we can make it happen by spring or even sooner.

Another risk that there might be some time I am not available for rickshaw driving. Get in contact in time will make sure that our schedule can meet.

In case of bad weather we can reschedule!


The Impact

To summarize the impact once more:

By contributing to my own rickshaw
  • you put the high rental expenses off my shoulder
  • you make my own entrepreneurship viable
  • you help me to work flexibly beside my studies
  • you support an environmentally friendly method of transportation
  • you make people smile, just as in the video
  • you can experience this as well
  • you can make it happen for your loved ones
  • or offer to indigents

You can make the world a bit more happy and smiley!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my campaign and tell others if you have positive opinion on me or the project. Thank you! :D

Please support and enjoy the perks!

Thank you.


Warmly,

Kristóf

story:
Premier livre d'astuces d'affaires d'Alexandre Vézina, ''Enfin les vraies affaires''

La lumière sur ces choses dont on ne vous parle habituellement pas

Alexandre Vézina ose expliquer des concepts, des astuces et des risques que la majorité des conseillers ou consultants ne vous disent pas en temps normal. Il aborde notamment le concept d'équivalence mental appliqué au monde des affaires, de l'échelle de confiance AV, de la stratégie du 1-2-3 et ces utilisations, divers syndromes de l'entrepreneur,  les vrais risques de l'entrepreneuriat, la valeur des produits et services, les cautions personnelles, la valeur de votre réseau de contacts, le grand ménage de vos clients et contacts... et beaucoup plus d'astuces!

Autant des conseils pour vous aider à optimiser votre entreprise, éviter des erreurs coûteuses que des outils pratico-pratiques pour vous simplifier la vie!

Un discours sans détour sur des sujets essentiels à votre réussite entrepreneuriale!

Un prix raisonnable pour beaucoup plus en valeur!!!

ATTENTION : Votre copie du livre sera livrée au mois de mai 2016!

Erratum

Le forfait à 40$ et 35$ sont semblables. Je ne peux malheureusement plus les modifiés. Celui à 40$ aura un cadeau surprise supplémentaire.

À propos de l'auteur

Alexandre Vézina est entrepreneur-conseil. Il possède quelques entreprises et accompagne d’autres propriétaires dans la croissance de leur entreprise.

Passionné de modèles d’affaires différents et d’idées innovantes, il est constamment à la recherche de nouvelles façons de faire croître les PME d’ici. Depuis plus de 9 ans, il partage sa passion et son savoir aux entrepreneurs québécois.

Tour à tour vice-président d’Entrepreneuriat Québec et président de la SADC Bellechasse-Etchemins, ses expériences antérieures lui ont permis de venir en aide à plus de 1 200 entrepreneurs qui ont ainsi connu un très haut taux de succès dans les années subséquentes.

Pourquoi une campagne de sociofinancement?

C'est simple! Faisant affaires avec une maison d'édition indépendante, elle a besoin d'avoir une idée du nombre de copie qui devront être imprimer!

Date de livraison

Les livres seront imprimés ce printemps et la livraison de ceux-ci est prévue pour la mi-mai 2016!

Les autres contreparties pourront être effective à partir du début du mois de mars 2016.

D'autres façons d'aider

N'hésitez pas à partager la page sur les médias sociaux! Des cadeaux surprises seront offerts parmi ceux qui partage le plus cette campagne!
story_txt:
Premier livre d'astuces d'affaires d'Alexandre Vézina, ''Enfin les vraies affaires''
La lumière sur ces choses dont on ne vous parle habituellement pas
Alexandre Vézina ose expliquer des concepts, des astuces et des risques que la majorité des conseillers ou consultants ne vous disent pas en temps normal. Il aborde notamment le concept d'équivalence mental appliqué au monde des affaires, de l'échelle de confiance AV, de la stratégie du 1-2-3 et ces utilisations, divers syndromes de l'entrepreneur,  les vrais risques de l'entrepreneuriat, la valeur des produits et services, les cautions personnelles, la valeur de votre réseau de contacts, le grand ménage de vos clients et contacts... et beaucoup plus d'astuces!
Autant des conseils pour vous aider à optimiser votre entreprise, éviter des erreurs coûteuses que des outils pratico-pratiques pour vous simplifier la vie!
Un discours sans détour sur des sujets essentiels à votre réussite entrepreneuriale!
Un prix raisonnable pour beaucoup plus en valeur!!!
ATTENTION : Votre copie du livre sera livrée au mois de mai 2016!

story:
Muffinmeow Cafe and Cat Lounge is excited to be the first cat cafe storefront in the DFW Metroplex!

This is Cornelius, and he will be your guide through this campaign.

Muffinmeow will be a space where you can enjoy a cup of coffee or tea in a beautiful, traditional cafe space with the added option of relaxing in our separate cat lounge: a room filled with adoptable cats and Japanese-inspired interior design elements. We will offer locally roasted coffee, several varieties of exotic teas, and locally sourced bakery goods for sale. 

We will operate in the same way cat cafés around the world do in that customers will pay a small hourly fee to spend time in the cat lounge. This fee includes one small drink of choice, which customers may choose to enjoy in the cat lounge. We ask that all customers sign a waiver before entering the cats' space. 

We will also serve as a space for several cat-themed events that we will host throughout the year for our patrons to enjoy. 

The Café Experience

We are currently looking to open in Richardson, Texas, close to the University of Texas at Dallas campus. 

Here is a preview of our potential floor plan. A beautiful cafe with stylish seating leads into the cat lounge through a double-doored hallway. The cat lounge features many windows, comfortable nooks, and decor with a Japanese flair. You can also watch the cats through the bar window in the café without entering the lounge!

What will it be like inside our store? First, imagine a bright and light-filled café filled with intimate seating and the delicious aroma of freshly roasted coffee beans. Then, imagine a haven of cat-filled bliss in which you relax with a cappuccino while cats snuggle up to you, play and climb, or completely ignore you at their convenience. Fun, right?

North Dallas has too few craft coffeehouses and we are proud to be working with local roasters and bakeries to bring you all a great craft coffee experience.

We are looking forward to serving you fresh and delicious espresso drinks such as velvety lattes, rich Americanos, and our signature catpuccino featuring a cloud of sweet milk foam. Exotic whole leaf teas, authentic matcha, and fresh, fragrant tisanes round out our beverage menu for those who prefer a calming cuppa.

To whet your appetite, we will offer an array of tempting muffin tin delicacies, like popovers, traditional sweet and savory muffins, and individual cheesecakes, freshly delivered from local bakeries. We will also offer vegan and gluten-free options for those with special dietary needs.

An example menu can be viewed here: http://www.muffinmeowcatcafe.com/menu/ We would love to hear your suggestions for menu items!

Events

Let's add even more fun to the mix! We can't wait to see you at our future events!

Here are some of the events we are already thinking of!

Cat Yoga: Feel your hamstrings screaming with cats in the background! (or foreground...)


Kittens And Mittens: Knit something easy and cute and have it covered in a thin layer of cat hair before you even get it home!

Fancy Schmancy Tea Party: We're so proper, hehe! Dress up and join us for a fancy tea service, complete with a kitten upsetting your delicate porcelain cup!

We would LOVE to hear your suggestions on what other events you'd like to see! Let's get creative together!


What We Need & What You Get

UPDATE: 12/22/15

We have an important happy holiday announcement!

We've decided that, in addition to a swanky pre-opening party, we would like to have an exclusive soft opening, only for backers!

ALL backers, regardless of pledge amount will be invited to participate and ONLY backers will be eligible to attend. Please note that this is not the same as our pre-opening party (which is going to be a hilarious legit party with free food and stuff).

If you have already backed our campaign, don't worry, you will be included, too!

So what does this soft opening mean for you? If you back our campaign before the January 14th cutoff, you will be able to enjoy exclusive access to the cafe before we officially open. Please note that you will still need to pay for drinks/food/entrance to the cat lounge at the soft opening.

We thank you for your support and hope that you are having a wonderful holiday season!


With your contributions, we will be able to open our Richardson, Texas storefront. The funds will be used to obtain a lease on our space, for needed build outs, furnishings, and for our initial inventory. 

We are all in at this point and can't wait to see this become a reality. We have already pumped all of our own personal savings in to add to the proceeds of this campaign. 

The more we receive from this campaign, the better space we can afford, and the fancier stuff we can provide for the cat lounge, such as awesome hammock seating and transparent cat bridges so you can enjoy that cat-on-glass view. It will also allow us to get more cats out of cages and into the homes of loving families. 

All Indiegogo reward levels detailed on the right include a Backers' Wall Image. After the campaign ends, we will ask all contributors to send us a square digital image that they would like to have included in a wall mosaic we are designing for a cafe space to immortalize our thanks to you for your support. The image can be anything you choose (your signature, your beauteous face, etc.) as long as it doesn't violate any trademarks and is PG rated, please.

Pendant/earrings are 1.8 cmx0.5 cm. Chain is 44 cm long.



The Impact

 We are proud to be an adoptable cat cafe! We are eager to support local shelters and animal rescue organizations which allow us to foster the cats residing in our store. We hope to raise awareness and support for the animal welfare issues North Texas faces while helping cats get out of cages. 

A free-roaming environment like our café makes for happier cats who are able to fully express their personalities to potential adopters, thus getting adopted more quickly.

Currently, we have relationships with several area shelters and foster networks, including Take Me Home Pet Rescue, Dallas Cat Lady, and Richardson Animal Shelter. We hope that we can help their cats and kittens quickly find loving homes and we believe that cat cafés represent the future of pet adoptions. We want to help DFW's homeless cats find new homes, and by extension, get more cats off the streets. US cities with cat cafés have rescued hundreds of cats over a very short period and we want to bring that to the Metroplex. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends and on your social media using the share tool! Every share helps us reach more area cat lovers and get you all excited for Muffinmeow's arrival in DFW!

story:
All my life i have worked within the hospitality and event industry. This has made extremely aware of how people want to be treated and what they expect from a hospitality service. Whether this be simple customer service within a hotel to making people happy and comfortable in an environment that may be new, different or even scary. When people believe and feel comfortable, their experience is often made memorable. This is always important to both a client and a business, making and creating a situation as comfortable as possible creates memorable experiences, which is just as important as the business making money. This being said, when people have an exciting experience or a memorable moment, this is often remembered which in my view, causes the the most important and valuable form  of advertisement to other prospective clients... word of mouth.

I got married a few years ago and although we didn't have all the money in the world, i tried my hardest to make it the most memorable day possible..... I want to help others achieve this no matter what their budget, making and creating 'Memorable entertainment for their memorable moments'. I want to offer products that will help people remember their experiences, whilst having as little to do in creating that experience as well as having a memorable experience for all the right reason.

The products i want to offer are all popular and have been around for a number of years, however i don't believe it is always about innovative ideas, but the way in which something is presented to make it personal to a particular person. Hence, all the products that are going to be offered, are going to be fully customisable to suit the needs of the client.

The products i want to initially invest in, are as already stated popular within the event entertainment industry, including a Photo Booth, Chocolate Fountain, Candy Cart and believe it or not..... a White Bouncy Castle.

The products that White Castle Events will initially supply on a professional rental basis are as follows:

  • A luxury Chocolate fountain (Customisable to comply with event theme/ colours)
  • Photo booth (Customisable to comply with event theme/ colours  and customisable packages available which relate to event)
  • Luxury Candy Cart (Customisable Packages available and customisable to comply with event theme/ colours)
  • Custom made (White) Bouncy Castle (Available for all weather and customisable to comply with event theme/ colours)

The products i want to have built on a custom basis, which will allow me to change and alter the products in a way they are customisable to specification with the use of lighting both internally and externally, as well as external decoration of the products to help give them the WOW factor.

Thank you taking the time to listen to my business proposal, if you require any further information in regards to my business plan, i will always be available to take any questions.

story:
South African Wine Farms

Did you know there's a difference between wineries in the United States and wine farms in South Africa? While wineries in America tend to be mass-mechanized production businesses, wine farms in South Africa are communities in which most employees and their families live and work together. Wine farm owners care for the well-being of those in their communities and often provide or contribute towards housing and education for the workers and their families. The wines they produce through traditional, hands-on methods, such as hand-picking and hand-sorting, are literally the production of a community. South African wines are some of the finest in the world, as proven by the many top awards given each year by international wine competitions.


Wine Farm Upliftment

Contributing to the demand for authentic South African wines increases production and funds for wine farms, and those additional funds go back into wine farm communities, sustaining a generations old way of life. Your contribution not only brings farm to table South African wines to the United States, but you'll have the satisfaction of providing unique support for wine farm communities in South Africa.


Continuing the Tradition

Mass-mechanized wine production threatens the wine farm way of life. But you can help! Contributing to SA Wines for Life enables Sovereign Selection to continue supporting SA wine farms with the importation of these amazing wines and creating awareness through education and events in the USA. These efforts lead to increased demand, which increases production, enabling South African wine farms to continue the tradition.


Your Contribution

In exchange for your contribution, you'll receive some of these superb wines, which make up most of our contributor levels. Some levels offer wine goodies, while most include top quality farm to table South African wines. You'll be able to taste the dedication of these wine farm communities for yourself. Your participation directly leads to the support of South African wine farm communities, their generations old way of life, and their traditional hands-on production methods.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Faith Bechtold, and thank you so much for your interest in What's This?, LLC.

Back in 1996, I started my first business, Spooky Bootique, my dream was to have a retail store for people like myself. A place to find the clothing I liked to wear, the jewelry I craved, the one of a kind items I wanted to have in my home; all at very affordable prices.  At the same time, I was giving artists and crafters an outlet for their work to be seen by people who appreciated it. For 12 years, I worked at markets and conventions with outstanding success and support, most notably from The Chiller Theatre Expo in New Jersey, to whom I am still very much indebted.

20 years and tons of retail and business experience later, I opened What's This? We have the same basic foundation, only now I have the experience to make it so much more successful.  

I have spent the last 12 years working for a national retail chain. I started at the bottom and by the time I left, I was running every location in the country.  Besides that, I have worked for one of the largest costume and entertainment companies in the northeast, and even owned and starred in my own sideshow.

This is not only my dream, but the feedback I have received from setting up at markets this summer has proved to me that a store like this is many people's dream.

With your contribution, you can make this dream come true for all of us.


***PLEASE NOTE THERE IS A TYPO AT THE $200 LEVEL! It should say "all $200 contributors", not $100, but Indiegogo won't let me fix it because there have already been contributors at that level.  Sorry about the inconvenience ***


What We Need & What You Get

The goal we have set for this campaign is not everything we need; but it sure would be a great start!  This would help us get the money for:

* the lease signing

* our insurance

* small renovations

*fixtures

We have quite a bit of stock already because we have been selling at markets, but we would love to get more. The great thing is that a lot of our stock will come from consigning, which means no up front costs for these items.

If by some chance we don't meet our goal, we are going to press forward.  We will use whatever funds we have and continue selling at markets and events,  But there is so much more we can do with our own space!


The Impact

This is important to all of us.  A space of our own to shop and even have our tarot cards read!  All in one spot.   No having to go to the mall and look through mass produced garbage, no paying shipping charges because we just can't find what we like anywhere close. A place where everyone is welcome.

Risks & Challenges

Are there risks? Of course there are! No more than for me. I have a special needs child who is counting on me to pay the bills,  That's how confident I am that I can make this work, though!  Trust me now? :-)

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are tough. I see it everyday around me and in my own life.  I pretty much gave up everything to do this.

If you can contribute, we thank you with every inch of our hearts.  And we have thank you gifts to show our appreciation.

If you can't contribute, please consider sharing the link and spreading the word of our campaign.

Thank you for your interest, your support, and your love.

story:
Making a dream come true...

After working in Athens and London as a graphic designer for more than a decade, I decided that I needed a change in life if I wanted to live as a happy person. Big city life was very stressful and the only thing making me forget my problems and feel relaxed was to attend yoga classes. So 2 years ago, I quit my job in London and returned to Corfu, my hometown, to find myself again.. and when Alice, my friend from London, came to visit me she loved the place so much that decided to quit her job and come to stay! 

For many years I had a dream in my head to create a place, in that earthly heaven called Corfu, for people to come and have the holidays of a lifetime while practicing yoga on the beach, in an open relaxing space, so they can forget everything and clean their minds and souls! Together with Alice we said it is now or never...and thats how it started...

We are now halfway to make our dream come true. We rented a big villa by the sea for the summer of 2016, Alice deals with the promotion and the teachers and my role is to redecorate the villa making everything from scratch (furniture, garden, interior decoration). But there are some things that we can't do by ourselves and that's where we need your help.. We need you to help us make the place a perfect yoga holiday destination for everyone who wants to  come and be part of our adventure!

What We Need & What You Get

What we need from you is to help us buy the equipment we need to make our guests feel comfortable while they practice their yoga. Specifically we need to build a 40 square meters wooden pergola for the rainy days and build, in same dimentions, a wooden deck on the beach. Additionally we need to buy 15 sunbeds with waterproof pillows, 10 big umbrellas to protect our guests from the Greek strong sun and 15 bicycles for everyone to enjoy the ride around the island!

In return you'll get yoga mats with our logo, amazing baskets full of Greek products like herbs from our own garden, a bottle of local olive oil, olive soap and a beeswax creme. Also you have the chance to get 1 week free holidays in a place you helped become unique!!!

If we don't meet our goal, we ll use the money to cover as much expenses as we can.. and if we exceed our goal we'll use the rest of the money for marketing, legal fees and buy more flowers for our huge garden.

Just Relax wants to create the perfect yoga holiday destination! Your contribution will help us make it an idylic relaxing place for everybody who wishes to come, stay with us and come together with other like minded people.

And if you can't contribute to our dream no worries we still love you all and send you a big warm hug! And don't forget, even if you can't, someone else might be able to help, so please share our dream with your friends!

Thank you all so much for spending time reading our story! You are all very important to us and we send our best wishes to all of you and your families to be healthy and happy in life!! ♡

story:
Short Summary

The average case of ammo costs $350 + shipping from a big box store. Archangel Armory can produce a case of ammo for an average of $240 with shipping included*, saving the average range shooter more than $1,200 dollars a year, and even more if you shoot more than a case per month.

By using state-of-the-art manufacturing methods, and only the finest quality components, we can reduce the cost of your range ammunition by a significant amount. Archangel Armory is family-owned and all our ammo is 100% Made-in-the-USA. We have our 06 FFL license secured and are ready to produce ammo as soon as we purchase a press.

Funding will go to the purchasing the presses, dies, additional equipment, start up inventory of components, advertising, and miscellaneous start up costs

* Free shipping is for the Continental United States only.  


What You Get

We are offering several perks for those who assist us in getting started.

$10 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 5% off your first  order. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$20 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 10% off your first 2 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$50 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 15% off your first 3 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$100 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 20% off your first 4 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$500 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 30% off your first 5 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks.

$1000 gets you One of a kind T-Shirt designed and available just for donors and 40% off your first 6 orders. After we have been in production for 2 weeks..

All donors will receive their items within 30 days of the end of the campaign.

All orders will be honored 2 weeks after the start of production.

The Impact

Donators will be able to purchase ammunition at roughly a third of the standard cost. Every dollar of your donation comes back to you in the form of gift certificates to purchase ammunition and a great T-shirt!

Archangel Armory LLC’s long-term goal is to move into an industrial building within one year, and, in 5 years, open a shooting range and retail storefront. We plan to employ veterans and support local business.

Together we can…

  • Provide gun range enthusiasts with affordable, reusable ammunition

  • Educate the public on gun safety and offer additional safety training

  • Reduce the waste of one-time range bullets by recycling the shells into new ammunition

 

Risks & Challenges

After appearing in front of the City Zoning Board of Appeals, we obtained our 06 FFL license, which allows us to produce the products out of our home.

We’ve also been working with the local newspaper and a local news channels doing interviews to raise awareness.

Other Ways You Can Help

 Share this link on your social media profiles to spread the word. Together we can reduce range ammunition costs and reduce range ammunition waste.

story:
Our Goal

La Peña is a vibrant community gathering place with a global vision that has promoted social justice, arts participation, and intercultural understanding since we opened our doors in 1975. Every day of the week we present concerts, classes, films, forums, art shows, or community events. We invite you to please #StandWithLaPena and help us raise $50,000 by January 1st, 2016 in order to continue our work. Your contribution will allow us to thrive for generations to come.


Where The Money Will Go

Our historic cultural center cannot survive without your help. Our programming is at stake. Annually La Peña serves over 26,000 people and presents over 300 events with emerging and established artists, hosts over 50 political and fundraising events, provides an arts education program for hundreds of children and adults, commissions and produces new work by local artists, presents internationally and nationally renowned musicians, sponsors a touring community chorus, and houses a gourmet Latin American restaurant, Los Cilantros. Due to the success of La Peña during the last 40 years, our building’s infrastructure and equipment is also in need of repairs. We are in the process of reshaping our building to create an arts and activist hub, more workshop and performance space, and more classrooms. We need to upgrade our sound system, replace broken equipment, buy new printers, repair flooring in two areas, and support staff technical assistance and operations. These changes will produce greater programming capacity that will require additional staff time. With your contributions, we aim to move forward for another 40 years. Please donate today and share this page.  We encourage you to use this hashtag #standwithlapena to share on social media. Thank you to all of our supporters.



What We Do

La Peña has thrived for 40 years serving youth and adults in Berkeley, Oakland, and surrounding cities, with roots arts and social justice programing.  La Peña was started by a group of Latin and North Americans as a response to the military coup in Chile that overthrew the elected government of Salvador Allende on September 11, 1973. We opened our doors in June 1975 and have been developing ever since. Today our focus is on supporting new 21st century cohorts of leaders in arts activism and social justice projects in one of the most diverse metropolitan areas in the United States. Our goals are to encourage creativity, promote community dialogue, share knowledge, and build capacity for social transformation. La Peña’s educational philosophy stems from the cultural and political traditions of its founding: interconnectedness among cultures, cooperative efforts, innovation of new arts expressions, and solidarity for the creation of a just society.  Our distinctive programming brings together community leaders, activists, and educators, as well as teaching artists, and professional and student musicians, dancers, poets and muralists to participate in indigenous roots art forms from the Americas and the African diaspora.  All of our work promotes egalitarian and collective practices. We were recently featured in San Francisco Chronicle Datebook.  Find out more about us at lapena.org.  

Roots Arts Education and Performance

A check of our calendar on any given day might reveal jazz, folk, nueva canción, flamenco, tango, rumba, son jarocho, capoeira angola, salsa, bomba, samba, forró, cajón Afro-Peruano, or hip-hop classes and performance. La Peña is a cultural homeplace where every week, toddlers, children, teens, and adults study the musical and performance traditions that have nourished struggles of resistance, sustained cultures, and contributed to the well-being of communities.  These roots performance traditions have managed to flourish despite long and complex histories linked to colonialism in the Americas that led to censorship and neglect. They have often been excluded from mainstream recognition by official histories, public radio, and school music curricula. Roots arts encourage us to think beyond consumer approaches to performance in order to become producers and creators of our own restorative culture. These inherited traditions have often thrived for centuries underground and as a result are absolutely modern and contemporary. They can also be revolutionary, thought-provoking, healing, and inspiring.


Public Dialogue and Leadership Development

At La Peña public dialogue is informed by people’s history, local voices, multiple cultural perspectives and ways of knowing, and a spirit of compañerismo.  Over the years our center has hosted hundreds of programs exploring structural violence and organizing efforts related to arts production, immigration, fair food, housing displacement, First Nations struggles, anti-war movements, racial injustice, environmental justice, militarization, women’s movements, and labor issues. We are intergenerational, often relying on accounts of historical witnesses to political, civil and human rights violence in the past, linking those histories with current conditions.  La Peña's dialogues are focused on innovation of new ideas and strategies to address pressing social justice issues in our communities, drawing on global examples, as well as local leaders and technologies.  We welcome all voices, reflections and experiences that contribute to collaborative efforts to improve our lives.  Our dialogues, like our performances, are often accompanied by shared meals in the tradition of peñas in Chile and Argentina.  Classes and programs for youth help build 21st century community leadership.Chilean Blues, Mixed Media Mural on Wood, by Stephanie Hooper, Thomas Jones, Peskador, Christian Munoz, Ximena Soza, Teodoro Saavedra, and Sarah Siskin


VISION

La Peña shares the utopian hopes of millions of people around the world who struggle for more just social arrangements. According to Kenyan Nobel Prize laureate Wangari Maathai, “In the course of history, there comes a time when humanity is called to shift to a new level of consciousness to reach a higher moral ground, a  time when we have to shed our fear and give hope to each other. That time is now.” Quechua speakers in Bolivia and Peru have articulated a goal of sustainable autonomous regions with functional communities that authorize their own local organization, education, culture, production, transport, and consumption. Their concept of Sumak Kawsay is a spiritual and environmental model of humans living in harmony and balance, interconnected with land, water, air, forests, plants, animals, ancestors, and descendants, in relationship to the whole life-force in the world of which we are a part. Rather than base their culture on the domination of nature and the exhaustion of resources, Sumak Kawsay reaches for an entire way of life based in solidarity, generosity, and reciprocity. These ideas grace our work at La Peña.

New Mapuche Mural in La Peña offices by, Teodoro Saavedra & Sarah Siskin


Other Ways You Can Help

1.  Please forward our Indiegogo campaign address to your friends and associates on email.

2.  Be a volunteer. We have survived because hundreds of community volunteers have helped maintain the center. Our small staff can’t do it alone. We need assistance with managing our theaters for evening concerts, organizing special events, painting and repairing our building, sharing office duties, and maintaining our technology.

story:
L'HISTOIRE/THE STORY


Loren est une gestionnaire accomplie avec plus de 10 ans d'expérience dans le commerce du détail. Elle raffole des interactions sociales et de l'entrepreneuriat. C'est donc avec confiance qu'elle réussit à mener les gens à atteindre leur potentiel dans leur milieu de travail et ce, en travaillant ensemble afin de rejoindre les objectifs de l'entreprise. Elle est passionnée par sa communauté et s'y investit régulièrement. Les valeurs de Loren listées ci-dessous sont la fondation du concept:

responsabilité écologique

promouvoir l'estime de soi

promouvoir des habitudes saines

soutenir des entreprises localEd

collaborer avec des organismes communautaires


Loren is an accomplished retail director with over 10 years experience in the industry. She craves social interaction and entrepreneurship, and is passionate about her community-- regularly investing her skills and ideas in various community-based projects. It is with confidence that she leads people to reach their potential in the workplace, working together to achieve business objectives. The businesses' values listed below form the foundation of the concept:

ecological responsibility
promotion of self-esteem
promotion of healthy habits
support of local businesses
collaboration with community organizations

LA/THE MISSION

Cette campagne de financement vous permet de faire partie de la phase d'agrandissement du magasin. Le nouveau local permet un espace pour les ateliers créatifs, un plus grand espace pour manger sur place, dans un voisinage plus accessible, et d'autres belles surprises qui seront dévoilées sous peu.
This fundraising campaign lets you be part of the stores' expansion phase. The new location provides space for creative workshops, a larger space to eat in, is situated in a more accessible neighborhood, and other exciting surprises to be unveiled shortly.

          

           LES BESOINS ET LES RÉCOMPENSES/ THE NEEDS AND THE PERKS


Il nous faut 7500$ divisé comme suit:

  • Nouveaux permis MAPAQ et d'occupation 
  • Écocertifcation de l'entreprise
  • Des rénovations (on continue avec l'esprit éco!)
  • Le déménagement
  • L'acquisition de nouveautés  (The Itsy-Bitsy Yarn Store, Gabriel cosmetics, Zuzu, Brow Gal, Lippy Girl, Zen, Rawesome et des cupcakes véganes!)
 $ 7,500 is divided as follows:
  •  New permits MAPAQ and occupancy
  • Renovations (continue with the eco spirit!)
  • The big move
  • The acquisition of new products (The Itsy Bitsy - Yarn Store, Gabriel cosmetics, Zuzu, Brow Gal, Lippy Girl Zen Rawesome and vegan cupcakes!)

L'idée est de faire une pré-vente de bons d'achats qui seront échangeables en magasin. Par exemple, si vous achetez pour 50$, vous recevrez un bon d'achat de 50$ applicable sur n'importe quel produit en boutique. Ainsi que des forfaits méli-mélos. Par exemple, si vous achetez pour 50$, vous recevez un bon d'achat de 25$ applicable sur n'importe quel produit en magasin et un laissez-passez pour un atelier créatif.


The idea is to pre-sell  gift card vouchers to be redeemed in store. For example, if you buy $50, you will receive a gift card voucher for $50 applicable on any item in store. And the mix'n'match packages would work like the following example: if you buy $50, you receive a gift card voucher for $25 applicable on any product in the store and a ticket for a creative workshop.


**LES ATELIERS CRÉATIFS/ THE CREATIVE WORKSHOPS:

  • Fabrication de masque capillaire, d' exfoliant pour le corps et de baume à lèvres. 
  • Creation of hair masks, body scrubs and lip balms.
  • Atelier inspiré Pintesrest (DIY)
  • Pinterest inspired workshop (DIY)
  • Séance d'intro au tricot (The Itsy-Bitsy Yarn Store)
  • Intro knitting class (The Itsy-Bitsy Yarn Store)
  • Session d'intro à l'aromathérapie
  • Intro to aromatherapy session 
  • Session d'intro aux huiles essentiellles
  • Essential oils intro session
  • Fabrication de savon
  • Soap making workshop

ET BEAUCOUP D'AUTRES!!!

AND MANY MORE!!!


Nous communiquerons la date de notre ouverture officielle et notre emplacement dans le quartier Notre-Dame-de-Grâce sur notre page Facebook et par courriel. Vous serez donc informés de tous les détails.

We will communicate the date of our Grand Opening and our new location in the Notre -Dame-de -Grâce neighbourhood  on our Facebook page and through email. You will be informed of all the details as we proceed.

   

  PRÉ-LANCEMENT POUR NOS CONTRIBUANTS/ PRE LAUNCH FOR OUR SUPPORTERS


Végétaliens ou non, nos clients ont démontré un enthousiasme de l'ouverture du  COMPTOIR URBAIN, nous montrant que ce concept est en forte demande ici à Notre-Dame-de-Grâce/Côte-des-Neiges. Le nouveau magasin concept sera situé en proximité de l'emplacement initial afin de rester proche de nos clients fidèles, Une soirée pré-lancement sera organisé afin de vous donner un avant-goût le 13 Novembre 2015.
Vegan or not, our customers showed enthusiasm for the opening of COMPTOIR URBAIN, showing us that this concept is in high demand here in Notre-Dame- de-Grâce / Côte- des-Neiges. The new concept store will be located in the vicinity of the original location in order to remain close to our loyal customers. A pre-launch event will be organized to give you a taste November 13, 2015 .


 PARTAGEZ LA NOUVELLE!/SPREAD THE WORD!

 Partagez notre page Indiegogo sur les réseaux sociaux (Facebook, Instagram et Twitter) et parlez-en à votre entourage afin de faire de nous un succès. Votre support est essentiel à ce projet et nous vous remercions infiniment!
 Share our  indiegogo page on social media (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter) and talk to your surroundings in order to make this a success. Your support is essential to this project and we thank you very much!

soutenir des entreprises localEd
collaborer avec des organismes communautaires
Loren is an accomplished retail director with over 10 years experience in the industry. She craves social interaction and entrepreneurship, and is passionate about her community-- regularly investing her skills and ideas in various community-based projects. It is with confidence that she leads people to reach their potential in the workplace, working together to achieve business objectives. The businesses' values listed below form the foundation of the concept:


ecological responsibility

promotion of self-esteem

promotion of healthy habits

support of local businesses

collaboration with community organizations

LA/THE MISSION
Cette campagne de financement vous permet de faire partie de la phase d'agrandissement du magasin. Le nouveau local permet un espace pour les ateliers créatifs, un plus grand espace pour manger sur place, dans un voisinage plus accessible, et d'autres belles surprises qui seront dévoilées sous peu.

This fundraising campaign lets you be part of the stores' expansion phase. The new location provides space for creative workshops, a larger space to eat in, is situated in a more accessible neighborhood, and other exciting surprises to be unveiled shortly.
             
           LES BESOINS ET LES RÉCOMPENSES/ THE NEEDS AND THE PERKS 
Il nous faut 7500$ divisé comme suit:



Nouveaux permis MAPAQ et d'occupation 

Écocertifcation de l'entreprise

Des rénovations (on continue avec l'esprit éco!)

Le déménagement

L'acquisition de nouveautés  (The Itsy-Bitsy Yarn Store, Gabriel cosmetics, Zuzu, Brow Gal, Lippy Girl, Zen, Rawesome et des cupcakes véganes!)



 $ 7,500 is divided as follows:



 New permits MAPAQ and occupancy


Renovations (continue with the eco spirit!)


The big move


The acquisition of new products (The Itsy Bitsy - Yarn Store, Gabriel cosmetics, Zuzu, Brow Gal, Lippy Girl Zen Rawesome and vegan cupcakes!)






L'idée est de faire une pré-vente de bons d'achats qui seront échangeables en magasin. Par exemple, si vous achetez pour 50$, vous recevrez un bon d'achat de 50$ applicable sur n'importe quel produit en boutique. Ainsi que des forfaits méli-mélos. Par exemple, si vous achetez pour 50$, vous recevez un bon d'achat de 25$ applicable sur n'importe quel produit en magasin et un laissez-passez pour un atelier créatif.

The idea is to pre-sell  gift card vouchers to be redeemed in store. For example, if you buy $50, you will receive a gift card voucher for $50 applicable on any item in store. And the mix'n'match packages would work like the following example: if you buy $50, you receive a gift card voucher for $25 applicable on any product in the store and a ticket for a creative workshop.

**LES ATELIERS CRÉATIFS/ THE CREATIVE WORKSHOPS:



Fabrication de masque capillaire, d' exfoliant pour le corps et de baume à lèvres. 


Creation of hair masks, body scrubs and lip balms.


Atelier inspiré Pintesrest (DIY)


Pinterest inspired workshop (DIY)


Séance d'intro au tricot (The Itsy-Bitsy Yarn Store)


Intro knitting class (The Itsy-Bitsy Yarn Store)


Session d'intro à l'aromathérapie


Intro to aromatherapy session 


Session d'intro aux huiles essentiellles


Essential oils intro session


Fabrication de savon


Soap making workshop


ET BEAUCOUP D'AUTRES!!!
AND MANY MORE!!!

Nous communiquerons la date de notre ouverture officielle et notre emplacement dans le quartier Notre-Dame-de-Grâce sur notre page Facebook et par courriel. Vous serez donc informés de tous les détails.
We will communicate the date of our Grand Opening and our new location in the Notre -Dame-de -Grâce neighbourhood  on our Facebook page and through email. You will be informed of all the details as we proceed.      
  PRÉ-LANCEMENT POUR NOS CONTRIBUANTS/ PRE LAUNCH FOR OUR SUPPORTERS

Végétaliens ou non, nos clients ont démontré un enthousiasme de l'ouverture du  COMPTOIR URBAIN, nous montrant que ce concept est en forte demande ici à Notre-Dame-de-Grâce/Côte-des-Neiges. Le nouveau magasin concept sera situé en proximité de l'emplacement initial afin de rester proche de nos clients fidèles, Une soirée pré-lancement sera organisé afin de vous donner un avant-goût le 13 Novembre 2015.


Vegan or not, our customers showed enthusiasm for the opening of COMPTOIR URBAIN, showing us that this concept is in high demand here in Notre-Dame- de-Grâce / Côte- des-Neiges. The new concept store will be located in the vicinity of the original location in order to remain close to our loyal customers. A pre-launch event will be organized to give you a taste November 13, 2015 .
 
   
 PARTAGEZ LA NOUVELLE!/SPREAD THE WORD!
 Partagez notre page Indiegogo sur les réseaux sociaux (Facebook, Instagram et Twitter) et parlez-en à votre entourage afin de faire de nous un succès. Votre support est essentiel à ce projet et nous vous remercions infiniment!


 Share our  indiegogo page on social media (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter) and talk to your surroundings in order to make this a success. Your support is essential to this project and we thank you very much!

story:
Le Projet 

Le Projet Hommage Aux Femmes, étroitement lié au 8-Mars, Journée internationale de la Femme, a pour but d'honorer, célébrer et valoriser les femmes de tous les horizons : des femmes entrepreneures, des travailleuses sociales et du milieu corporatif, des mères au foyer, qui marquent la société québécoise par leurs réalisations et leur dévouement.

2016 marquera la cinquième édition de cet événement qui se déroule sur deux jours. Le thème de cette année est : "Femmes : inclusion sociale, émancipation et gouvernance". Au programme : conférences, défilés de mode, soirée de gala avec remise de distinctions aux lauréates, collecte de sang en partenariat avec Hema Québec et bien d'autres surprises.

Des activités sont prévues avec les lauréates tout au long du projet (cocktail de réseautage, activités de découvertes, etc.)


Où iront les dons ?

Face à l'austérité qui entraîne de sévères coupures budgétaires, nous venons solliciter votre aide et votre soutien à travers la campagne de socio financement lancée par le Projet Hommage Aux Femmes. Les dons récoltés serviront a financer une partie des dépenses liées aux lauréates.

Nous nous sommes donnés pour mission de faire vivre tout au long du projet, une expérience unique à ces femmes d'exception à travers des activités, des visites aux élus locaux, des cadeaux, des trophées et une prise en charge pendant le projet. 

Nous aimerions offrir beaucoup plus à ces femmes qui changent le monde, dans l'ombre ou dans la lumière, et nous avons besoin de vous pour aider dans ce sens.

La campagne de financement participatif s'étendra du 06 décembre au 06 février 2016. L'objectif de collecte de fonds est de 8000$. Nous sommes persuadés qu'ensemble nous pouvons y arriver.

Pour vous remercier de votre soutien, et parce que tous les dons sont utiles, chaque donateur recevra un ou plusieurs cadeaux : parmi ceux-ci se trouvent des bracelets à l’effigie de Hommage Aux Femmes, des DVD, ainsi que d'autres prix mystères ! 


Impact

Le Projet Hommage Aux Femmes apporte un impact positif au sein de la société québécoise, canadienne et même mondiale. Nous favorisons une rencontre interculturelle et une intégration positive à tous les niveaux (artistique, social, professionnel) en faisant découvrir ou redécouvrir des femmes engagées et en donnant aux femmes la place qu'elles méritent. Le Projet s'associe aussi à de nombreuses causes qui touchent les femmes,  mais pas seulement. 


Défis

Les défis cette année sont de faire grandir le projet en augmentant sa notoriété afin que des femmes du monde entier continuent d'être valorisées. La journée du 8 mars n'est pas exploitée à son plein potentiel, et nous souhaitons y remédier car les femmes sont le cœur de la vie, nous devons leur rendre hommage. 

Vous pouvez aussi...

Tout le monde ne peut pas faire de don, mais il y a toujours d'autres façon de nous aider ! Aimez, partagez la page du projet, et invitez vos amis à faire de même ! Parlez-en autour, de vous ! Ensemble, nous sommes forts ! 


Nous soutenons le projet, et vous ?

story: Randy works at a hotel we frequently stay at in San Jose, Costa Rica. Randy always has a smile on his face no matter what and always goes the extra step to make things right for the hotel guests.  The most important thing to him is your experience and anyone who has ever stayed there knows this to be true.  On our last visit to the hotel, Randy was smiling as always and I asked him how he was.  He mentioned he had gotten robbed a couple days ago.  They stole his money, phone, passport and money he was going to pay for child support.   My heart hurt knowing that something like this could happen to such a wonderful person, I also felt like he was really impacted by the incident emotionally.  You can imagine what you start to think of the world and people when something like this happens to you.  Thankfully he is OK but struggling financially, without a phone and in the red for his kids child support.  He just had a baby girl.  Please help me restore this beautiful human beings spirit and heart.  I want to live in a world where we support one another.  I could have been one of the many people that said, hey I'm so sorry that happened and moved on.  But what if everyone in Randy's life donated something, even if it was $5.  That would really make a difference for him and it would create a world where we all have each others backs.  I've put together some perks for you too!

story:
WHO WE ARE

Our organization is SILOAM CHRISTIAN ORPHANAGE, an orphanage in the rural Kenya that help orphans and vulnerable.We started with the 2011 with just 2 orphans and we have grown to 97 orphans 2015.The poverty cycle must be broken! Educaton is the answer.Spiritual AND physical growth can break that poverty and bring hope to these little ones. we look for compassionate people to come along side and join us.Whether in the cities, or in "the bush" (rural), SILOAM ORPHANAGE is committed to go, encouraging and helping with all our resources.

What We Need

.Things that are on the horizon, things that the Lord is leading us to do:

* Finish building our new building that will house 250 orphans  by 2016 by furnishing,cementing and placing windows at a cost of $2000,

*Getting our kids food and shoes as a Christmas pack at a cost of $1500

*Pay Rent of our rented rooms 20 of them at a cost of $1500

*Thank you so much for both your prayers and financial support. May His Will be done

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Personally share our story-Please tell two people about this campaign and our work. Word of mouth and your endorsement is powerful. Thank you!
  • Use the share tools at the bottom of this page. Craft and email to send to friends. 
  • Like us on Facebook-siloam orphanage   Please share and comment on   our posts.
  • Invite us to speak to your church or school.

Volunteer with us we are fun!

  • We need experienced grant writers, film directors and script writers, social media mavens or masters, clever web designers, graphic designers, infographics experts and visual illustrators.

Call or email us:

I would love to speak with you to answer any questions and tell you more about the beautiful, delightful children.  evans +254703235790  or email us (siloamorphanage15@gmail.com)

story:
Our campaign runs until September 3, and it will be the last chance to obtain these  items at a discount. All items will be sent out on October 1, whether or not the full goal is reached.

Short Summary

Hi! I'm Chris Ross and I'm building Macomb County's first axe-throwing range, Total Axe. Axe-throwing has become increasingly popular lately and I want to bring this new sport to Clinton Township. I have nearly 10 years experience throwing axes and teaching others to throw. I want to make this activity more accessible, fun, innovative and safe for everyone involved. Total Axe will offer new games, new targets and a more dynamic experience.

About Total Axe

Total Axe is an indoor axe throwing facility. We have leased a 3,000 square-foot facility in Clinton Township. Doors will open by November 1 and the booking page is already open to reserve your party. During your 2-hour reservation, axe coaches will teach everyone about safety, teach everyone how to throw an axe, then facilitate a tournament for bragging rights! 

League nights are available Sunday-Thursday. Each league runs 8 weeks, culminating in a championship tournament. During the first 7 weeks, each player will get to warm up, then play 4 matches against other participants.

We don't serve food, but you are allowed to bring your own. You can even have catering brought in for your event.

Safety

At Total Axe, safety is the primary goal. For this reason, you must be over 18 to enter (with closed-toe shoes) and we do not serve alcohol. Anyone who appears intoxicated or acts in an unsafe manner will be asked to leave.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funding received will be put to use in the facility. We are building a batting-cage layout so that each thrower is enclosed by fencing, isolating axes from spectators as well as other participants to make the experience as safe as possible.

We need some additional funding for seating for spectators. Depending on your support, we would like to add other throwing games like darts and cornhole. Beyond that, additional supplies will be used to design new targets for games like Tic-Tac-Toe, Cricket, other dart games, and Sequence.

Small donations will receive a t-shirt or gift card on opening day. Larger donations will receive their donation plus a bonus as a gift card on opening day.

The Impact

Total Axe wants to bring this game to as many people as possible. We plan to be open six days a week, offering leagues four of those nights. We will offer team-building events tailored specifically to your group. When there is open space, walk-in throwing will be available to everyone over 18. Our goal is to offer more fun and more safety at a lower cost than other facilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute money, that doesn't mean you can't help. If you know anyone that might enjoy taking a look, please send them the link to our project.

story:
Short Summary

Bia Don Dia is Gaelic for 'Food for the God'. We are a postpartum meal delivery and placenta encapsulation service. Serving families in San Francisco and the surrounding Bay Area.

'Bia Don Dia was created for all birthing folk. It is here to play an important role in our community, supporting the birthing person & their family during the early weeks of postpartum, a time so magical yet very challenging.'

Once the baby is born the mother is extremely hypersensitive to the environment around them. Whilst your body heals, it is vital that you are properly nourished with warm healing foods, elixirs, and herbs to aid in your recovery. The level of care you receive during this time will impact your health and wellbeing for the rest of your life.

We have carefully put together traditional postpartum meals, elixirs and herbal teas packed with the nourishment & nutrition your body needs to heal during this period. The ingredients serve to replenish lost nutrients, aid in milk production, calm the nervous system, and restore energy and warmth to the body after your labour & delivery. We source organic, non-GMO and locally sourced fresh food. Prepared from the day you give birth and delivered right to your door. 

We simply wish to care for the new parent so they can care for their baby and enjoy the magical first weeks welcoming them into the world. Help us bring this vision to fruition. Your donation will allow us to expand our menu, broaden our delivery radius and help nourish & heal more and more families during this time of transition and growth. 

Visit https://www.biadondia.com for more information!

About the founder

Lisa Galvez is the founder of Bia Don Dia. Lisa grew up in a rural village in the south-east of Ireland and moved to California in 2015 where her journey as a birth-keeper and postpartum care provider began. Lisa is a labour & postpartum doula, and a placenta specialist; certified through Cornerstone doula training, San Francisco. Lisa is also currently studying Traditional Mexican Medicine within postpartum care. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3,000.

$1,000 for packaging expenses; it is very important to us that we produce as little wastes as possible and dispose of it responsibly. All food will be delivered in either recyclable or decomposable containers. Packed in a branded quality cooler bags for you to keep each delivery.

$1,000 covers catering fees & licenses.

$1,000 to broaden our menu; including more varieties of herbs & cultural dishes and expand our delivery radius, reaching more families!

We've opted to go with the flexible funding model, which means we'll still receive whatever our generous backers give. We are looking forward to creating an environment that will help the community connect.

Every donation is deeply appreciated and will be put to good use. With each donation, we will share with you a gift. 

The Impact

For many families today in modern society, they no longer live with or close by to extended family members. This can be challenging especially when you are welcoming a new baby into the world. In many cultures traditionally the mother was kept indoors and catered to intently for this sacred time. Allowing her to heal, recover, bond, and welcome her new child. Sadly today this level of support is viewed as a complete luxury. Bia Don Dia is here to plan an important role in our community. Supporting the person & their family during the early weeks of postpartum.

Risks & Challenges

If we don't meet our goal things could take a little longer to complete as we will have to get the funding elsewhere. ie August could become September. Either way, this is happening and we are very excited!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help! Help us get the word out. Tell your friends about Bia Don Dia and let them know they personally can help support families in San Francisco and the Bay Area. Also, feel free to share this around on social media!

Every donation is deeply appreciated and will be put to good use. With each donation, we will share with you a gift.
