story:
Resumen

 

Hola!! Mi nombre es Laura Campos, soy de Costa Rica. Vengo de una familia de actores. Y como buenos artistas tenemos la pasión en la sangre. 

Hace poco mas de 2 años mi papá decidió que nunca es tarde para ser un emprendedor, asi que abrió un teatro. Este fue un esfuerzo monumental, que fue apoyado por muchas personas. gente que creyó en este sueño y colaboró de muchísimas maneras. 

Mi papá y yo pintamos, pegamos, clavamos, guindamos y cortamos lo necesario para poder empezar. Casi siempre solo él y yo. Siempre he sido su asistente, desde pequeña. Así que juntos vimos nacer este espacio. 

Pero.. porque estoy creando una campaña?

- Bueno, tuve una idea!! cambiaría la experiencia del publico en nuestro espacio conviertiéndolo en algo único. 

Así que yo tomaría la administración del teatro. Pero eso solo es posible con amigos. Con apoyo. Yo sola no puedo. Necesito personas que compartan mi sueño. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Y bueno este es el punto decisivo... cuanto necesitamos?

Estamos buscando $30,000.

Esto se va a utilizar de la siguiente manera:

  • Los primeros $10,000 son para crear el restaurante
  • Los otros $14,000 son para la remodelación del espacio y compra de equipo como parlantes, proyector, letrero. 
  • Los últimos $6,000 son para mantener el local funcionando por al menos 3 meses hasta que el nuevo concepto se conozca lo suficiente para generar un movimiento de publico constante. 

RECOMPENSAS!!

Esto es un trabajo en equipo! y como equipo todos merecen su recompensa por haber colaborado. 

  1. Pin conmemorativo: Tenemos pines en 2 colores distintos para escoger.

     2. Calcomanías conmemorativas: tenemos 2 hermosos diseños en edición especial, únicos. 

    3. Entrada sencilla: Es una invitación especial, pues al estreno solo asistirán aquellas personas invitadas previamente.

    4. Entrada DOBLE: estas son de uso general que pueden ser utilizadas cuando el beneficiario decida. y pueden incluso ser obsequiadas. Estas entradas son de uso exclusivo para el estreno, o de uso general, dependiendo de la especificación dada en cada recompensa.

   5. Entradas DOBLES ilimitadas: Estas son tarjetas personales a nombre del beneficiario que funcionan sin fecha de expiración.  Para aquellos fuera de CR estas tarjetas pueden ser endosadas a 2 personas elegidas previamente.  

   6.  Almohadón conmemorativo: Tenemos almohadones en 3 hermosos colores de tamaño decorativo.                                                                                                                                                             ---

   7. Tour guiado: Estamos ofreciendo la oportunidad de realizar un tour guiado en el teatro, con la opción de conversar con el elenco.

   8. Entrada DOBLE VIP: Esta es una entrada premium donde se ofrece un espacio VIP el día del estreno. Este espacio incluye la opción de no hacer fila para entrar y además una persona encargada de llevar los productos de la cafetería hasta el asiento. 

   9. Acciones sobre porcentaje: Este es el segundo producto premium. A nuestros colaboradores de esta etapa queremos incluirlos en nuestro proyecto. Ser socios, amigos. Estamos ofreciendo el %0,5 de nuestras acciones sobre utilidades que será vigente a partir del 3 mes después de la reinauguración. El envío del capital va junto a la rendición de cuentas del mes a evaluar. Esta acción es una tarjeta física a nombre del beneficiario. En nuestro acuerdo estaríamos manejando como total de acciones solamente %100. 

 

  • Nuestras recompensas para quienes están fuera de CR se enviarán en el tiempo requerido por la entidad responsable, en este caso Correos de Costa Rica, hacia cualquier parte del mundo.
  • Las recompensas en Costa Rica son entregadas el día del estreno en el teatro.  

 

El impacto

 Estamos creando algo que esperamos tengo un impacto positivo en la comunidad y comparta arte para todos.

Hemos analizado como crear un espacio inclusivo:

  • Espacio para sillas de ruedas
  • Funciones con intérprete de lenguaje de señas
  • Comida vegana, vegetariana y libre de gluten.

Ademas de crear un lugar eco-amigable, con iluminación de bajo consumo, reciclaje de productos, servicios sanitarios de ahorro de agua y en el futuro paneles solares y un jardín aéreo. 

Pero aparte del espacio escénico, este teatro deseo que se convierta en un lugar de trabajo para generar un impacto social con población vulnerable. Como haríamos eso? Bueno estoy trabajando para crear una fundación que utiliza el teatro como medio de visibilización para población en exclusión. Actualmente trabajamos con mujeres ex-privadas de libertad y con chicas tránsgenero. Queremos ayudar a mas... y para esto el teatro seria una plataforma donde este tipo de población puede encontrar un refugio y sentirse libre. 

Tengo muchas expectativas sobre lo grande que puede ser este espacio, no en tamaño sino en impacto. Podría dar trabajo a muchas personas, hacer algo en lo que creo y tener la oportunidad de ofrecer un aporte a población vulnerable. Creo en el proyecto y en ustedes. 

 

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Todo tiene riesgos y desafíos. Esta aventura no es diferente. Pero lo que cuesta al final siempre vale la pena. 

En este proyecto tenemos un obstáculo principal:

  • Estamos contratiempo para conservar el espacio actual.

Desafíos:

  • Si no logramos el total de lo recaudado la remodelación no podría completarse. Así que tendríamos que empezar sin las características suficientes para crear la experiencia correcta. 

Como superaremos estos obstáculos?

  •  La esperanza es lo ultimo que se pierde. Y uno no deja de luchar hasta el ultimo momento. Estoy trabajando con un equipo de personas talentosas que me van a ayudar a que este proyecto llegue a buen puerto. A un lugar estable. 
  • Si no se pudiera recaudar el total por medio del Crowdfounding digital pensamos realizar campañas presenciales para recaudar fondos. Es decir actividades de recaudación a la vieja escuela. 
  • Las ideas están aquí. Solo ocupamos su apoyo. Yo trabajaré dia y noche para lograr que este projecto se cumpla!
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Algunas personas no pueden colaborar, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar:

  •  Si tal vez no tenés los fondos para colaborar en la parte del dinero, no es problema!! Es de mucha ayuda que pudieras compartir esta campaña en tus redes sociales, contarle a tus amigos y familiares. Postear en paginas de interés sobre esta propuesta. 
  • Recordá que Indigogo te ofrece herramientas para compartir.

Todos podemos apoyar!!

 

Y eso es todo.

Muchas gracias por haber leido hasta aqui!!! Se que puede ser tedioso... asi que lo agradezco de verdad. Te enviaría un abrazo si se pudiera. 

Laura

story:
My name is Dave Theimer

The reason I am attempting this is because I am passionate about motorcycles and even more passionate about my sister, but on a fixed income I can't afford the first motorcycle, much less to start a business. I can do in house financing and help people with the same passion ride.  Of course I will demand full insurance, a good down payment, and never let a bike leave before it's paid for itself.  Fortunately I have my son here to help me iron out the details.  He's owned his own business for several years now and been very successful himself.

This also gives me a chance to do something along the way of cerebral palsey.  When I  was a teen, and my sister passed, I told myself that I would do something to help.  What I am doing may not be much but it will be something.  With the help of you good people I can accomplish it.  There are so many things here that ask for money, but I would appreciate whatever you can afford. 

Thank you for the time in reading this and God bless.
story_txt:
My name is Dave Theimer
The reason I am attempting this is because I am passionate about motorcycles and even more passionate about my sister, but on a fixed income I can't afford the first motorcycle, much less to start a business. I can do in house financing and help people with the same passion ride.  Of course I will demand full insurance, a good down payment, and never let a bike leave before it's paid for itself.  Fortunately I have my son here to help me iron out the details.  He's owned his own business for several years now and been very successful himself.
This also gives me a chance to do something along the way of cerebral palsey.  When I  was a teen, and my sister passed, I told myself that I would do something to help.  What I am doing may not be much but it will be something.  With the help of you good people I can accomplish it.  There are so many things here that ask for money, but I would appreciate whatever you can afford. 
Thank you for the time in reading this and God bless.

story:
First, A Thank You. 

Before getting into this thing, Kettle River wants to extend its deepest and most heartfelt thanks to all the family, friends and the Okanagan craft crowd for their continued support and encouragement. They could not have made it this far without you. They love you.

----

So, What's The Deal With Kettle River?

Kettle River Brewing Co. is a nano brewery located in the North End of Kelowna in British Columbia. They do very, very small runs of beer and can proudly say they’ve brewed over 200 batches since they opened in July 2016. They are a small operation (there's 4 of them), they are independent (it’s their own business), they have a strong DIY-ethos (they've built everything themselves—for better or for worse) and they have big ambitions (to make some top beer).

But for them to continue to grow and keep up with demand they need your help!
 

What Will Growth At Kettle River Look Like 
& What Will The Funds Raised Go Towards? 

#1: Upgrading The Brewhouse
This is the big forthcoming change and what has motivated Kettle River to create this fundraiser. They currently operate on a tiny handmade 1bbl brewhouse made out of used tea tree oil tins and dairy parts. It is not sufficient for their current growth rate and it is exhausting with the quantity of beer being brewed. They have paid for half a new 5bbl brewhouse (this means 5x the beer!) but still need to pay the remaining half, along with all installation costs to get it operational. Cost: ~ $20,000

*Extremely stylish fish decals not included 
 

#2: Getting A Lounge Endorsement With Licensed Patio
Do you want to drink more than one sample size glass when you visit Kettle River? And would you like to be able to have those additional glasses while sitting out in the beautiful Okanagan sun? Of course you would! Obviously. 

They’re working though the process of getting a licensed patio out front of the brewery along with a lounge endorsement for the tasting area itself. This means snacks, this means entertainment and this means more beer! It will take some building upgrades and re-zoning which does not come cheap, but it'll be totally worth it. Cost: ~ $10,000


 

Are There Rewards For Contributing?
Yes. Heck yes.

Kettle River has several options for rewards in return for your generous contributions. They offer everything from branded merchandise to experiential rewards and will even barter with you for a reward of your liking if the ones they've created do not satisfy your desires. 

Check out the 'Perks' section for more details!

  

  

  

   

  

  

  

 

The Kettle River Brewing Team

Chris Dedinsky: Brand Manager
He makes sure everything is seafoam colour and handles the whimsy. 

Russ Higgs: Operations Manager
He makes sure nothing blows up and we can afford hops. 

Brad Tomlinson: Head Brewer
He makes sure everything tastes delicious and bubbly.  

Cass Bowes: Tasting Room Manager
She makes sure you have the best tasting experience and is our favourite Aussie. 

Share. Share. Share!

Help Kettle River spread the word by sharing this link: https://igg.me/at/krbc
And for the most recent news and updates follow them on Facebook, Instagram & Twitter.  

If you have any questions or concerns please feel reach to reach out to: info@kettleriverbrewing.ca

FAQ

Why Should You Care About Kettle River Brewing?
KRBC is a community minded business dedicated to making Kelowna and the surrounding area a better place one beer at a time. By helping them succeed and flourish, you are not only supporting a small business in your Okanagan community, but also indirectly impacting local social incentives and environmental causes. At Kettle River, they believe in giving back, and by helping them prosper, you'll enable them to do just that.

What's In It For You?
Aside from the satisfaction of supporting local small business, each level of contribution comes with its own reward, check out Perks for details!

When Will You Get Your Super Cool Rewards?
Each perk has a conservative estimate of when they will be delivered, but as soon as they are ready you'll receive them. Promise.

Where Is Kettle River Beer Carried?
Click here for a list of liquor store locations that are currently carrying their brew, or come on down to the brewery to try what's fresh. 

How Will The Money Be Spent If The Goal Isn't Met?
If Kettle River is only able to raise half their goal, they will head on down to Lake City Casino and put it all on black. Just kidding... Whatever is raised will go directly towards the goals set out and they will make up the difference as quickly as possible to get that brewhouse up and running.

 

<3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3  <3

story:
THE OLD BOOKSHOP / GAMLA BÓKABÚÐIN

The Project

The Old Bookshop is rising anew for its 120 years old anniversary.

The Old Bookshop is a nest of creativity in the heart of Seyðisfjörður, Iceland. In the winter artists will come and retreat to focus and develop their creative work and in the summer travelers will stay over to experience the extreme coziness of the fjord and its beautiful community.

   

Wether they are travelers or artists we want our guests to experience a cultural immersion. Upstairs the fully equipped apartment floor is designed for cocooning and aims at becoming an artists den, a place to retreat, develop and create. Downstairs, the studio gallery is a lively floor, a melting pot of creation open to the public to stimulate exchange with the visitors and locals of Seyðisfjörður, and to exhibit and retail the artists' works.

The curation and open calls for residency at The Old Bookshop will be refined every year as the studio gallery evolves and gets shaped through time. As a traditional place of book we will encourage the artists residents to leave a printed trace of their work and and contribute to develop a collection "made in Seyðisfjörður".

Currently the studio gallery is hosting work and projects by :

- ESUALC

- The Scent Bank

- Laura Tack

- Berglind Águstdóttir

 

The house

It was built in 1898 and was first a residential house before becoming a book and toy shop in the mid 1950's. It is built on two floors, currently downstairs is a studio gallery and upstairs will be a 2 bedrooms fully furnished residency apartment.

In the beginning of the years 2000 the Old Bookshop (Gamla Bókabúðin in Icelandic) became a project space ran by Skaftfell, the Center for Visual Art of East Iceland.

An additional part was built in 1989 and will soon open as a coffee house that will offer more possibilities for exhibitions and pop-up events.

Despite the major repairs to make the old house has a high potential to thrive anew. There is also 900m² of land that will be transformed by a landscaper in the years to come.

Today the house is in a very bad shape and needs major repairs :

- the roof is heavily damaged and needs to be replaced and insulated asap 

- there is no hot water system in the house and the electricity needs to be replaced

- the staircase needs to be changed 

- a drainage system around the house needs to be set up

- all the windows upstairs need to be replaced

 -the corrugated iron walls need to be replaced  they need to be fit the aesthetics standards of the time it was built. 

- the apartment needs to be fully furnished

Estimated costs for renovation material and labour :

- Roof replacement and insulation : 15.000USD

- Hot water system and plumbery : 15.000USD

- Electricity : 3.000USD

- Windows : 8.000USD

- Drainage system : 2.000USD

- Corrugated iron walls and insulation : 10.000USD

- Staircase : 2.000USD

- Furnishing : 20.000USD

Total : 75.000USD

 

 

Why fundraising?

Today, the project needs funds in order to get launched. A solid business plan was elaborated in 2017, the interior has been designed and the construction team ready for action. All the money invested to buy the house came from my wool craft and I have literally "crocheted "  the house. Now in order to get another loan from the bank and start renovating I need your support to kick off the project. 20.000USD are needed obtain the loan and start This is a place of creation, it is very much community oriented and its first mission will be to promote the "made in Seyðisfjörður".

 

Your rewards

Your support is the key to the success of this project and for that you deserve the best I can offer.

Whatever amount you contribute will give you access to the fjord. You will love your reward 100% made in Seyðisfjörður.

All the products offered are manufactured in the studio gallery of the Old Bookshop. You can choose to get love crystals, scarves or shawls from my crocheted woolen collection, essential waters made from local plants, two nights stay over in the house, a week of cultural immersion with crochet and olfactive workshops or a month of artist residency in the house.

Elsku Seyðisfirðingar! Ég er með sérstak tilbóð fyrir ykkur <3

 

About Seyðisfjörður

The house is located in the fjord of Seyðisfjörður in the picturesque Austurland region of Iceland. It is a fishing village of 665 inhabitants with a very vibrant art community including, art festivals (LungA, List í Ljósi), art residencies (Skaftfell, Heima), artists groups (RoShamBo, Skálar), and an art school (LungA School).

All the facilities can be found at a 2 minutes walking distance from the house. 

Seyðisfjörður is accessible by road, air (Egilsstaðir domestic airport 25km) and sea (ferry terminal for Smiryl Line connecting Denmark and the Faroese Islands).

During the summer you can enjoy several outdoor activities such as kayaking in the fjord, hiking the seven peaks, playing golf, observing whales and puffins on the cliffs of Skálanes.

Seyðisfjörður is also becoming a culinary destination with probably the best sushi restaurant in Iceland.

 

Me, mYself & I

My name is Philippe Clause, I am a French multidisciplinary artist based in Iceland since 2006 with a singing and acting education. Being in Iceland awakened my artistic sensitivity and through the years I taught myself to craft my creativity and I explored different artistic fields such as designing and performing. Today my main activity is my work with wool with my label ESUALC and recently I have started an olfactive venture called the Scent Bank.

In 2013 I transformed my previous house as a creative lab with a shop corner. There I welcomed artists with various backgrounds and exhibited or retailed their works whether it was paintings, prints, sculptures, nature art, ceramics. I also welcomed bunch of volunteers and travelers who wanted to have a different type of experience in Iceland.

In 2016 I had saved up enough money to get a loan at the bank and get the Old Bookshop on an auction sale. Since March 2017 I have setup my artistic activities on the studio gallery floor of the house and there I work and retail the products I am creating along the artwork of fellow artists,

 

The Old Bookshop will only rise again thanks to you and I will be crafting your rewards with all my heart.

FOLLOW THE JOURNEY ON FACEBOOK AND INSTAGRAM

!!! THANK YOU !!!

story:
Brittany:  The Cake Faerie

Baker, Caker, and Delicious Dessert Maker

 

Brittany's Homemade Heaven is Moving to the Divide

For the past 7 years I have been successfully operating Brittany’s Homemade Heaven as a cottage bakery.  As my clientele and service demand have increased substantially I am ready for a full blown bakery.  Your support means so much, not only to me, but also to my three beautiful daughters. 

 

The Funding Needs of The Cake Faerie

After careful research and calculations, I am hoping to raise $30,000.00 to successfully start my new storefront under my new business name, The Cake Faerie.  The funding will cover industry standard appliances.  This includes a commercial freezer, commercial refrigerator, commercial oven, refrigerated display case, commercial mixer, and other bakery requirements.  

 

The Perks

 

Social Shout Outs

I will be posting daily shout-outs to supporters who pick this option.  Watch The Cake Faerie's Facebook and Instagram pages for your shout out!

 

B2B Shout Outs

Business to business support means so very much!  I will make a shout out to your business on Facebook, Instagram, and on The Cake Faerie website.  The website shout out will contain a link to your business website, Facebook page, and Instagram page.  

 

Gift Certificates

Gift Certificates are available for $25, $50, or $100.  Buy for yourself, a family member, a friend, or a co-worker!  Each gift certificate through this campaign will also receive an automatic 10% discount!  When placing your order be sure to mention you purchased a gift certificate through the Indiegogo Campaign.  All orders must be picked up in Garden Valley at The Cake Faerie.

Gift Certificate Perks through the Indiegogo Campaign are valid from November 1, 2020 through May 1, 2022.  Gift Certificates are redeemable on a limited basis each week, specifically 5 per week.  If you have a special event for which you plan to use your gift certificate I encourage you to email me as soon as possible to fully book your order.  Email:  brittany@cakefaerie.com

I will fulfill up to 5 Gift Certificate orders weekly (Nov 1, 20-May 1, 22).  Available days and dates are as follows:  Wednesday through Sunday pick-ups between 9AM-4PM.  Pick up is not available on the following holidays: Fourth of July, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, New Years Eve, or New Years Day.  Holiday orders may be picked up prior to the holiday itself. 

 

Thanksgiving Pies

The Cake Faerie Thanksgiving Pies will be ready for pick up Monday November 23, 2020-Wednesday November 25, 2020 with pick up times between 9:00AM-4:00PM.

Your choice of Apple or Peach pie, each pie is $35.00.  Receive a $5.00 discount when you choose one of each!

 

Semi-Naked Wedding Cakes

The Cake Faerie's Semi-Naked Wedding cakes are currently the top trending cakes.  These beautiful and elegant cakes are available in your choice of 3 flavors: Chocolate, Vanilla, or Lemon.  You also have the 2 filling options: Strawberry or Raspberry.  

Semi-Naked Wedding Cakes require a minimum of 4 weeks advance ordering.  

This perk also includes basic floral accents, please contact Brittany for additional details.

 

Cake Faerie's Flexible Crowdfunding Campaign

I have opted to use the "Flexible Crowdfunding Campaign", this means that even if my total goal is not met, I will still receive the funds raised through this campaign.  

All funds raised will go toward the purchase of the appliances and additional needs of The Cake Faerie bakery, all perks purchased will be honored.

 

The Cake Faerie's Impact

Operating as Brittany's Homemade Heaven has given me a strong connection to community.  I am regularly meeting new people in my service areas, building friendships and business relationships.  Those who know me know that I am very family and community oriented.  

Bringing The Cake Faerie to The Divide will give me an opportunity to meet more community members, offer delicious treats, and make a difference in the community.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Although risks and challenges face us all, particularly in times like these, I am well prepared to face many potential challenges head on.

I have secured a business location which does not put a large financial burden on my business while I start up this new location.  I have carefully determined my finances for the year and am well prepared to operate and fulfill perks, while keeping cleanliness, and safe serving as my highest priority.  

Realizing that Covid-19 is still a potential challenge, particularly for the food service industry, I have plans to provide baking lessons online, both live and pre-recorded.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate all forms of help!  

If you are able to support me by choosing one or more perks that's terrific and the support is deeply appreciated!

If you aren't able to support this campaign financially please share this campaign with family and friends!  Every bit helps and all shows of support are appreciated!

 

Thanks for reading!  Thanks for supporting!

Brittany's Homemade Heaven has given me a strong connection to community.  I am regularly meeting new people in my service areas, building friendships and business relationships.  Those who know me know that I am very family and community oriented.  Bringing The Cake Faerie to The Divide will give me an opportunity to meet more community members, offer delicious treats, and make a difference in the community.   Risks & ChallengesAlthough risks and challenges face us all, particularly in times like these, I am well prepared to face many potential challenges head on.I have secured a business location which does not put a large financial burden on my business while I start up this new location.  I have carefully determined my finances for the year and am well prepared to operate and fulfill perks, while keeping cleanliness, and safe serving as my highest priority.  Realizing that Covid-19 is still a potential challenge, particularly for the food service industry, I have plans to provide baking lessons online, both live and pre-recorded.   Other Ways You Can HelpI appreciate all forms of help!  If you are able to support me by choosing one or more perks that's terrific and the support is deeply appreciated!If you aren't able to support this campaign financially please share this campaign with family and friends!  Every bit helps and all shows of support are appreciated! Thanks for reading!  Thanks for supporting!

story:
What is No Carne?

 

No Carne LIFESTYLE – Vegan Lifestyle & Media Company

No Carne LIFESTYLE is a Vegan Lifestyle and Media Company based in The Bronx, NY. Our mission is to help raise awareness of what it means to be vegan, by creating and sharing plant-based lifestyle content, experiences and more—for everyone, while building relationships with our vastly growing community. We are first and foremost a digital media company with a focus on plant-based food and lifestyle content. We also create and share animal rights and climate related content to help raise awareness on those issues.

As a media company, we create visual, audio and written content in the form of food photography, lifestyle memes, video content, a soon-to-launch IGTV series & podcast, written articles, blogs and much more. Most of our content is derived from our own No Carne BODEGA food, our No Carne MARKET events and events we vend at or we attend. We also create and share a lot of content like vegan food photos and videos from restaurants and other establishments we visit. Often we'll share climate related content from other creators and platforms as we get ready to launch our own No Carne COMMUNITY project.

With this campaign we hope to establish and grow our Media Team and continue to create even more informative and consumable content to keep raising awareness of all the benefits of a plant-based lifestyle. Together we can fund this project and write the next chapter of what will one day be a globally recognized brand.

 

No Carne BODEGA – Vegan Deli & Grocery

In early 2019, we launched No Carne BODEGA, our Online Vegan Deli & Grocery Store on UberEats, Postmates, DoorDash, Mercato and on our website NoCarneBODEGA.com. We're in the process of renovating our space so that we can open to the public and accept pick-up orders as well. Part of the funds raised in this campaign will go towards growing the No Carne BODEGA brand, and opening up a location in the Belmont section of The Bronx.

 

No Carne MARKET – Vegan Night Market Series

This past November, on Small Business Saturday, we launched No Carne MARKET, our Vegan Night Market Series throughout NYC. As of now, we have our monthly Uptown No Carne MARKET in Inwood, Manhattan, and our Bushwick No Carne MARKET in Brooklyn. Part of the funds raised in this campaign will go towards expanding No Carne MARKET and bringing our vegan night market series to The Bronx, Queens, Staten Island and beyond!

 

No Carne STREET – Ethical Streetwear Brand

One of the first things we've always wanted to do was create an ethical streetwear brand that represented the fashion and culture of our home: The Bronx. Our first few t-shirts and hats were a hit at our pop-up events and online on social media. People from all over have been asking: "When will they launch on your website?" With all the buzz, we decided to step back and plan the relaunch of our apparel division. We've even rebranded it as No Carne STREET, and we have a lot of plans for the brand for 2020! Part of the funds raised in this campaign will go towards growing No Carne STREET at scale, and launching our online apparel store and making our apparel available to everyone anywhere.

 

No Carne COMMUNITY – Non-Profit Community Org.

This year we want to launch the most important project of our lives: No Carne COMMUNITY. This idea for a non-profit community organization is actually what lead to the idea for No Carne LIFESTYLE. We quickly realized the best way for us to eventually launch a non-profit organization was to first build an online community and then establish a business that can lead to ongoing funding for our non-profit.

Why did we take this approach? Because we believe there are many ways to get people engaged for a good cause, and the way we prefer to go about it is to create food, products, content and experiences that people enjoy and would like to buy and consume, and then put a significant part of the proceeds from those sales towards funding No Carne COMMUNITY. The vision for our Indiegogo Campaign is to raise funds to grow the business, to then have the business fund the non-profit. We strongly believe with your help we can make this vision a reality.

 

#Not62 Campaign – The Bronx, NY

This past year The Bronx has once again been ranked LAST (#62) on the list of unhealthiest counties in New York State. Ironically, just across the river, Manhattan (NY County) is ranked as one of the healthiest in the state. Our fundamental goal with No Carne BODEGA and No Carne MARKET is to make healthy, plant-based food more accessible in our borough and throughout the under-served communities in our city. We hope to contribute to the efforts of the #Not62 Campaign.

Not only do we plan on launching our Bronx No Carne MARKET very soon, but we're also working on a community program that we can implement immediately to help introduce (or reintroduce) people to plant-based foods and create a healthy, supportive network where we can all contribute to the efforts of building a healthier Bronx.

Now all that sounds great, but we need to get the word out. That's where we rely on the media capabilities of No Carne LIFESTYLE. Our job is to do the work we do, help make things better and then document and capture those moments, convert them to consumable digital content to continue to raise awareness. We know this approach will work, and if we can get you onboard to help us make it happen, we guarantee that it will work, it's just a matter of time. Let's make this happen now!

 

This Is Bigger Than Us

We understand that we're just a small part of a bigger movement. Many people and many organizations in The Bronx, and in the world, have already been doing good in so many ways. This campaign, and essentially our entire company exists just so that we can contribute to the ongoing efforts of so many who are leading the fight for a better future.

Another great benefit from the success of this crowdfunding campaign and our business is the fact that we'll have access to capital that can be contributed and donated to various charities and non-profit organizations, such as climate action groups, community health programs, informational and educational groups, animal sanctuaries and more. We should all support each others movements in some capacity, and we look forward to doing our part in working with or contributing to other organizations who are making a difference.

Although we are currently operating at a loss, we've already committed to donating 15% of No Carne BODEGA's profits. This campaign will help us achieve profitability and be able to make those donations happen. The main reason we haven't turned a profit is because we went all in on marketing and building brand. We gave away free food, snacks, beverages, groceries, everything. We ran Facebook and Instagram ads and they paid off. We made some things happen, we got exposure, and here we are now, ready to take this to the next level!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's  the breakdown:

  • We're looking to raise $25,000 to grow No Carne LIFESTYLE, expand No Carne BODEGA, launch more No Carne MARKETs and relaunch No Carne STREET all of which will lead to No Carne COMMUNITY, our non-profit community organization. The vision for our Indiegogo Campaign is to raise funds to grow the company, to then have these businesses fund the non-profit. We strongly believe with your help we can make this vision a reality!

 

  • You can get some of the "Perks" as soon as you contribute since we're already in business! "Perks" are what you get for contributing to our campaign and helping us fund this project. We have a variety of things available immediately after contributing, such as pins, hats and t-shirts, and groceries/food products for those that live in or near The Bronx, NYC. We also have more intangible "Perks" like instant discounts on our website, instant discounts for VENDORS on Vending FEEs for No Carne MARKET in NYC, discounts and exclusive access to our Social Media Strategy services client list (upon launch) and many more. Check out our full list of Perks for more info!

 

  • We intend to reach our goal, but if for any reason we don't get the full $25K, we'll use the funds strategically to help grow the business and help us eventually launch our non-profit. We aim to be as transparent as possible. You can count on us to keep you up-to-date when it comes to this campaign and the funds we raise.

 

The Impact

Although this is a Local Business campaign, this is truly a community project. And although we're looking to help and give back to our local community in The Bronx, we also want to continue to establish ourselves as a reputable brand in the global community. Our dream is to be able to help people and have a positive impact on a global scale.

  • No Carne LIFESTYLE's mission is to raise awareness of the benefits of a plant-based lifestyle on human health, for the animals, and on the effects of climate change. The success of our campaign will only help us make an impact on our world for the better.

 

  • They say money makes things happen, and although we believe that to be true, we also believe in working with what you have in order to do what you can. Our team consists of just 2 people, and you've seen what we've been able to do with very little: we built an online community, launched a vegan deli & grocery brand and a night market series in NYC. You can trust us to strategically use these funds not only to do what's right for the business, but most importantly to do what's right for everyone.

 

  • #Not62 The Bronx – We hope to raise awareness of the #Not62 campaign and to contribute to the movement towards building a healthier Bronx. We'll be announcing a community project we're working on very soon. We need to act now and set up the foundation for what needs to be done moving forward.

 

Risks & Challenges

We don't believe there's any risk in choosing to contribute to this campaign. We're already a legally established company and we're already in business. We have brand awareness both online and in real life, thanks to all the great people we've connected with on social media and at events and pop-ups like our No Carne MARKET. There's virtually no risk in trying to help us help people.

We're essentially already making things happen, just on a smaller scale. The biggest challenge would be to reach enough people to make a huge impact on our world! And that's a challenge we're willing to face. Adversity has been a part of every step in this journey, and we're not going to give up now. What are we going to do if we don't reach our $25,000 goal? KEEP GOING!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute any amount of money, and we truly understand that. We've been there ourselves, way too often. But that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • The best way to help is to get the word out! Share this campaign with your friends, your family, or with literally everyone! Maybe you can't support financially, but you can inspire others who can to do so. Helping us spread the word will help us tremendously and we'll be forever grateful for that! Indiegogo has links and tools built in to help you share this campaign. Thanks in advance to those of you who share our project!

 

  • For those of you who are able to contribute, first of all, THANK YOU for even considering it, and second: you can still share this campaign! :)

 

Final Thoughts

We really appreciate all of you who read up until the end of this pitch. Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our project and for considering making a contribution to our campaign. We hope you're able to see that this isn't just "some business thing" and you're able to realize that we are deeply passionate about what it is were doing with No Carne. We are truly grateful for the opportunity to serve our communities and help make a difference in our world. Thank you so much for being the most important part of our story.

story:
Our story

We are facing constraints in everyday shopping, where we have no other choice but to select from what is available in the market.

But what if we can create more options for ourselves? What if we can actively participate in what we buy from creative standpoint? We are no longer bounded by the limited options, and most of all we are given a chance to be more creative in our everyday life!

To materialize this idea, we decided to create new online platform named "CRESTY."   

About CRESTY

CRESTY = CREate + STYle is the first mall-type online shopping site that carries ONLY CUSTOMIZABLE luxurious goods from all around the world. 



We believe that CRESTY not only free us from boredom and constrains in everyday shopping, but it also stems and fosters creativity in our daily life. 
We envision the world where people become more creative on a cultural level, and lead happier life through creating what they want, instead of forcibly purchase what is available.

Features

1. Unique products with a highest quality 

We only carry relatively UNKNOWN BRANDS, but with the highest quality possible, sophisticated design, and unique background stories.

Our brands boast a manufacturing process that is as close as it gets to handmade (IN ITALY, for our initial lineup). This adds higher value to the products and vastly increase the quality level.

2. Intuitive user interface with many customize options

UI is very straight forward and intuitively playable.

There are 17 variations in leather per customizable parts, 4  colors in metal components, 12 options in jewelry, and 16 colors for crystal. In rough estimation there are 832 to 49,051,392 patterns for the customizing.

(materials are procured from the finest tannery and fabricator in Italy)

3. Reasonable pricing

A lot of customizing option, MTO (made-to-order), handmade in Italy; these three factors are what make product luxurious and therefore, very expensive. But in CRESTY, you will see that the price points are very reasonable.


Current status and ongoing challenges

We are international team of business professionals, web designers, creators, brand owners, and manufacturers united under the same vision.

We've come as far as developing 3 brands (manufacturers) from Italy, and constructed functioning sample-webpage for customizing (for 1 brand).
But to move forward and complete the platform, there are critical challenges to overcome. It is imperative that we overcome these challenges for starting off the service!

1. Improving the quality of pictures : the current resolution level is acceptable, but we still feel the need to improve the quality of product images in the customizing page.
2. Website development : at this point we only have functioning webpage for customizing. We still need to develop an actual EC site for officially releasing the service.
3. Adding more brands and product lineup : so far we've managed to create functioning webpage for customizing, but only for 1 brand and 1 category (handbag), while 2 brands are already in line. We need to construct customizing page for more brands and products!
4. Interactive functions : CRESTY already has unique features not only from conceptual, but also from functional standpoint. Regardless, we have some great ideas to make CRESTY more enjoyable and user-friendly. These additional functions require extra development.
5. Incorporation :  we don't intend to keep CRESTY as project. We want to make CRESTY as legitimate and sustainable business so that we can pursue our vision to spread and stem creative life on a global scale. But the incorporation calls for setting up a necessary team to maintain stable operation on a daily basis.
6. Setting up a space in the shop : we would like to try out O2O (offline to online) approach using the space in the shop. One of our partnered brands agreed to let us use a part of their shop in Italy with a minor renovation!
7. Boost marketing activities : we are planning to exhibit CRESTY in various fashion & technology related events in different countries. This is to expose the service to wider audience, while conveying our message to change the world for good!

Stretch goal

(*any amount less than $30K will be used for keeping the project alive.)

We will unlock more PERKS as the campaign progresses to the next phase!


Development plan

The plan aligns with the stretch goal. Therefore, we will constantly update you with the plan as the campaign progresses!


Perks


1. Customized items

You get to have your own customized items through experiencing CRESTY in first-hand and at LOWER THAN OUR ESTIMATED RETAIL PRICE!l
Here is how it works (PLEASE REFER TO THE FOLLOWING SLIDE SHOW).
We apologize for such tedious process...but the EC site will be on the way with your support!

Lineup :

Cassandra
H:20cm(body only) 29cm(width handle) W:28cm D:9cm

http://www.crestyplatform.com/products/detail.php?product_id=4&Body=CEMENT&Handle=ROYAL&Piping=ROCCIA&Handring=SILVER&Trimming=ROYAL 

Virginia
H:20cm(body only) 36cm(with handle) W:38cm D:15cm

http://www.crestyplatform.com/products/detail.php?product_id=8&Body=AZZURO&Handle=BLUETTE&Piping=WEFTY-ATLANTICO&Handring=SILVER&Trimming=ROYAL&Centerpiece=1_COPPER&Crystal=TURQUOISE

Lucrezia
H:18cm W:25cm D:9cm
http://www.crestyplatform.com/products/detail.php?product_id=5&Body=ROSA-ANTICO&Piping=WEFTY-GREY-USA&Handring=SILVER&Centerpiece=2_SILVER&Crystal=LIGHT-PEACH&Futa=AQUAMARINA&Strap=AQUAMARINA

Luana
H:26cm(body only) 33cm(with handle) W:30cm D:21cm

http://www.crestyplatform.com/products/detail.php?product_id=7&Body=POLVERE&Handle=STAMPA-MARINA-ORO-BLUE&Handring=YELLOW-GOLD&Trimming=STAMPA-MARINA-ORO-BLUE&Centerpiece=1_YELLOW-GOLD&Crystal=MONTANA-BLUE

Bubbles

http://www.crestyplatform.com/products/detail.php?product_id=9&Body=CEMENT&Crystal=LIGHT-SAPPHIRE&Buckle=GOLD
*for Bubbles, we will ask you to indicate the size (length) in the order form.

Sample images :



2. Limited and exclusive items

Monnaluna developed a limited and exclusive collection entitled "Fiorini Florentia" only for this campaign!

"Fiorini Florentia" -- As a brand heavily laced with Florentine aesthetic, Monnaluna looks into design archive and history of Florence. There, they found numbers of iconic designs but the emblem engraved on the currency (coin) and the angel caught their special attention.  While the emblem symbolizes the flourishing economy and prosperity of Florence during the Renaissance period, the angel symbolizes blessing and profuseness. And these symbols represent, in Monnaluna's vision, what used to be, and still connoted in Florence. 

The collection boasts antiquated texture with bold use of iconic Florentine symbols. But with the carefully selected and fabricated components, you will see that the total design of each item is contemporary. 


Necklace

Length: 60cm heart dimension 2cm x 2 cm (all others as above)

Bracelet
Length: 20cm round fiorino coin diameter 2 cm large angel wingspan 18 mm and 25mm tall small angel wingspan approx 18mm and height 15mm

Ring

Fiorino diameter 2 cm and open ended band


Earring-3


Earring-2


Earring-1

Do not miss the EARLY BIRD Jewelry set!


About the brand : 

                                       

http://www.monnaluna.com/ 

Monnaluna is jewelry and women's accessory brand owned by Giovanna Flavia Bruno. Monnaluna sets its shop in walking distance from the world famous Palazzo Pitti, where Giovanna runs business and fabricates her jewelry in the studio basement.

The street.

The entrance of the shop.

Inside the shop.

We would like to set up the space in this shop for CRESTY!

(Working studio is set in the basement of the shop. This is where the jewelry and accessories are fabricated by hand.)

Monnalua incorporates Florentine aesthetic that synthesize Baroque design and modern sensibility. Such aspect is evident in the intricate and finely tuned jewelry collection. But what is more, Monnaluna possesses an pellucid hint of personal experience. Which renders more intimate and unique engagement with audiences.

To ensure the highest quality possible, Monnaluna partners with one of the finest leather goods manufacturer, tannery, and metal component supplier in Tuscany. They are one of the enduring suppliers for the most famous brands in fashion industry, and you will enjoy the level of quality that these artisans produce on your behalf.


Delivery

  • You will be receiving the item within 2 MONTHS AFTER the completion of this campaign.
  • The items will be shipped directly from Italy to your home.
  • Delivery fee is included in each perk.
  • Comes in the Monnaluna box.


Risks & Challenges

 1. Consistency : we take pride in how the sample-webpage  for customizing turned out. And we are confident that the digital coloration and texture are very close to the  attributes of actual materials. Still, we acknowledge that we can continue to improve the consistency between the two. That being said, we would like you to accept that there may be a minor difference in color and texture between the digital images and the actual items.
As the nature of MTO (made-to-order) and handmade aspect of the manufacturing, there can be very minor inconsistencies between similar products. Again, we would like you to accept and understand that this is NOT manufacturing defect, but the inevitable result of our high value added process.
 2. Material : Italian artisans are very particular about the quality. This philosophy and stance result in using the best material possible. But the best material--specifically the best leather are not always wrinkle, stain, or scar free. While our products ensure the use of the best quality leather, you may see a minor wrinkle, stain, or scar. This is the result of the artisans' preference to use the best material as opposed to the "cleanest" with lower quality. 
Nevertheless, please be minded that our products are fully inspected based on our high quality control standard before the shipment. Therefore, what you are likely to see are limited to very minor wrinkle, stain, or scar.
 3. Delivery delay: while we do our very best to deliver the item within 2 months after the completion of this campaign, there can be an occurrence of unavoidable crisis causing the delay. In the face of such case, we will be sure to inform you the delivery status, provide revised delivery date, and complete the delivery.
4. Discount %:  as you can see from the perks, you can get our products at lower price than the estimated retail price in this campaign. However, we still have to consider variable factors (such as exchange rate) for finalizing the retail price. Therefore, please be aware that the articulated discount % in this campaign against the estimated retail price may fluctuate based on the possible change in the final retail price.


Other Ways You Can Help

Other than claiming the perks, here are some other ways you can help us out!

1. Spread the word!

Feel free to ask us for any pictures or images from CRESTY so that you can spread them through your facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc., for a viral effect.

(With a $ 1 donation, we will engrave your name or preferred alias/title upon our website, as shown in one of the perks!)

2. Write about CRESTY!

If you are a blogger or writer, please write an article about our campaign. If we can measure the referrals and verify that your article brought a lot of people to our campaign, we just might give you a SAMPLE PRODUCT FOR FREE!

↓

http://create-style-create-life-thank.kickoffpages.com/

3. Become our partner!

1) If you are brand owner, designer, or manufacturer in fashion or lifestyle goods industry and looking for an unique and innovative sales channel, please feel free to contact us for our future collaboration!
2) If you think CRESTY is a great idea and would like to be part of it somehow, please feel free to contact us. We'll try to find the best possible role for you in the project!

       

*Reminder : Only the Cresty entity is responsible towards the investors to deliver what is proposed through this crowdfunding campaign. Any discrepancies or unexecuted requests are under the sole liability of Cresty and no other party is responsible in fulfilling the requests undersigned through this crowdfunding platform.
story_txt:
Our story

We are facing constraints in everyday
shopping, where we have no other choice but to select from what is available in
the market.



But what if we can create more options for ourselves?
What if we can actively participate in what we buy from creative standpoint? We
are no longer bounded by the limited options, and most of all we are given a
chance to be more creative in our everyday life!





To materialize this idea, we decided to create new online platform named "CRESTY."   

About CRESTY

CRESTY = CREate + STYle is the first mall-type online shopping site that carries ONLY CUSTOMIZABLE luxurious goods from all around the world. We believe that CRESTY not only free us from boredom and constrains in everyday shopping, but it also stems and fosters creativity in our daily life. We envision the world where people become more creative on a cultural level, and lead happier life through creating what they want, instead of forcibly purchase what is available.

Features
1. Unique products with a highest quality We only carry relatively UNKNOWN BRANDS, but with the highest quality possible, sophisticated design, and unique background stories.




Our brands boast a manufacturing process that is as close as it gets to handmade (IN ITALY, for our initial lineup). This adds higher value to the products and vastly increase the quality level.2. Intuitive user interface with many customize optionsUI is very straight forward and intuitively playable.


There are 17 variations in leather per customizable parts, 4  colors in metal components, 12 options in jewelry, and 16 colors for crystal. In rough estimation there are 832 to 49,051,392 patterns for the customizing.

(materials are procured from the finest tannery and fabricator in Italy)3. Reasonable pricing
A lot of customizing option, MTO (made-to-order), handmade in Italy; these three factors are what make product luxurious and therefore, very expensive. But in CRESTY, you will see that the price points are very reasonable.
Current status and ongoing challengesWe are international team of business professionals, web designers, creators, brand owners, and manufacturers united under the same vision.


We've come as far as developing 3 brands (manufacturers) from Italy, and constructed functioning sample-webpage for customizing (for 1 brand).But to move forward and complete the platform, there are critical challenges to overcome. It is imperative that we overcome these challenges for starting off the service!




1. Improving the quality of pictures : the current resolution level is acceptable, but we still feel the need to improve the quality of product images in the customizing page.
2. Website development : at this point we only have functioning webpage for customizing. We still need to develop an actual EC site for officially releasing the service.
3. Adding more brands and product lineup : so far we've managed to create functioning webpage for customizing, but only for 1 brand and 1 category (handbag), while 2 brands are already in line. We need to construct customizing page for more brands and products!
4. Interactive functions : CRESTY already has unique features not only from conceptual, but also from functional standpoint. Regardless, we have some great ideas to make CRESTY more enjoyable and user-friendly. These additional functions require extra development.
5. Incorporation :  we don't intend to keep CRESTY as project. We want to make CRESTY as legitimate and sustainable business so that we can pursue our vision to spread and stem creative life on a global scale. But the incorporation calls for setting up a necessary team to maintain stable operation on a daily basis.
6. Setting up a space in the shop : we would like to try out O2O (offline to online) approach using the space in the shop. One of our partnered brands agreed to let us use a part of their shop in Italy with a minor renovation!
7. Boost marketing activities : we are planning to exhibit CRESTY in various fashion & technology related events in different countries. This is to expose the service to wider audience, while conveying our message to change the world for good! Stretch goal




(*any amount less than $30K will be used for keeping the project alive.)
We will unlock more PERKS as the campaign progresses to the next phase!


Development plan
The plan aligns with the stretch goal. Therefore, we will constantly update you with the plan as the campaign progresses!

Perks






1. Customized items

You get to have your own customized items through experiencing CRESTY in first-hand and at LOWER THAN OUR ESTIMATED RETAIL PRICE!l

Here is how it works (PLEASE REFER TO THE FOLLOWING SLIDE SHOW).

We apologize for such tedious process...but the EC site will be on the way with your support!

*for Bubbles, we will ask you to indicate the size (length) in the order form.

Sample images :




















2. Limited and exclusive items
Monnaluna developed a limited and exclusive collection entitled "Fiorini Florentia" only for this campaign!
"Fiorini Florentia" -- As a brand heavily laced with Florentine aesthetic, Monnaluna looks into design archive and history of Florence. There, they found numbers of iconic designs but the emblem engraved on the currency (coin) and the angel caught their special attention.  While the emblem symbolizes the flourishing economy and prosperity of Florence during the Renaissance period, the angel symbolizes blessing and profuseness. And these symbols represent, in Monnaluna's vision, what used to be, and still connoted in Florence. 
The collection boasts antiquated texture with bold use of iconic Florentine symbols. But with the carefully selected and fabricated components, you will see that the total design of each item is contemporary.

Bracelet

story:
It's difficult to find place in Claremont that truly focuses on specialty coffee defined by quality and taste. Not only do I miss well-crafted coffee, I also wish there were more awareness of the many factors, from bean to cup, that influence the taste of what we drink.

I love preparing coffee for other people as much as drinking it myself. Someone coming up to me and asking, “Hey Sarah, could you make me a cappuccino?” would make me very excited, and someone asking me "so how was this cappuccino prepared?" would absolutely make my day. Thus I’ve decided it’s about time for me to start an espresso bar at Harvey Mudd College: Espresso Manifesto.

The first goal of Espresso Manifesto will to provide my ass-busting Mudd peers with tasty and artful coffee at no cost. The second goal is to encourage discussion on what is in the cup, where it comes from, how it is roasted and what makes one coffee different from another.

To get this espresso bar started, I will need a little help from you, my fellow coffee lovers. The funds raised will help cover costs of initial supplies as well as purchasing weekly, freshly roasted coffee beans.

Let's create a space where we can enjoy thoughtfully made coffee and explore its wonderful possibilities!

story:
I’m Astrid, a 29-year-old post punker who happened to be born in Cali, the world's capital of salsa.

I'm currently starting as a DJ, throwing postpunk/new wave parties, working back to back with TROPICALIPSIS INFECCIOSA (a small organization for people particularly drawn to all things dark and unsettling), and I’ve been amazed with the results; we've had hundreds of people attending, and we’re always being asked when the next one is going to be, so I started to wonder… Why not have a steady place where we--the weirdos, the dissidents, the musical outcasts--can gather together and truly belong. 

Human beings have danced since prehistory. We dance to enjoy, to celebrate, to flirt, in some cultures they even dance to mourn, so why not a club?

Music is what brings people together and is the main feature of this subculture, so The Bunker will open its doors to all those who are not satisfied with the spectrum of the current cultural catalog of the city.

The Bunker will be more than just a dance floor and a place to drink in a unique ambiance; it will also run cinema projections and will furnish a space for lawbreaker artist to show their work.

So basically, we want to create an entire cultural movement in one place!

We're hoping to raise our bare minimun costs for building and opening the club.

- We'll have to do all the paperwork necessary to open a club, which will cost us around $500 USD

- We'll rent a place, which means we'll have to pay one month’s rent in advance. We plan to renovate the place ourselves in order to cut off expenses, so we're expecting it to take around 30 days.

- We'll buy the materials we need to build the club, along with the furniture and liquor.

- We’ll have to pay the second month’s rent in advance as well, since we'll spend the first month building the bar.

- We treat our contributors with awesome perks, as we open the best damn club this city’s ever seen!

We are optimistic about this project, but just in case we don't raise the entire amount of money we need to open the club as we are planning, we think you should know how we plan to spend your contributions:

> 10%

We will start to organize some thematic events at bars we know, and we’ll save the profits to keep the project going.

> 25%

With this amount, we'll be able to rent a space to organize thematic events every other week, which should help us raise more money to keep the project going.

> 50%

We will start to process the papers we need to open the club! And of course, we'll keep looking for ways to raise enough money to complete the project, and we’ll keep organizing events until we accomplish it!

> 75%

This will be enough to open a small place with a cultural space and some weekly events, but maybe without the awesome dancefloor... :(

We know that not everybody is fortunated enough to make a contribution, but for this project to work, we're also going to need a lot of noise! So remember, you can always share it with your friends and social networks, and spread the word around. :)

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, we are Luke Bentley and Lance Linderman founders of Driftwood Coffee Co.  We want to THANK YOU so much for visiting our IndieGoGo page and for supporting us.  Here is our story and what we are all about!

We love everything coffee, the unique brewing methods, different tastes, relaxing or working hard in our favorite coffee shops, but most importantly the way that coffee brings us together.  This is why we want to start Driftwood and we believe there is a unique opportunity to do this in Old Town Peoria. Our desire is to bring the craft style coffee that so many of you enjoy downtown to the west-side. Peoria is our home, it's our roots and yours too!  How awesome would it be to have a place on the west side that we can all be proud of and call our own, a place we can all use to create and dream?  The void for quality craft coffee is real in Peoria and we want to help fill that. Downtown Peoria is an old community with good architecture and is just waiting for someone to do something different. With your help we can easily make this happen and we want you to be involved. This is why we are doing this campaign. Thank you again for considering to be apart of this, we promise every cup will be worth it!

What We Need & What You Get

As you can imagine opening a coffee shop is no easy task, especially financially. We are in a unique position because we will be renting a space from Axiom Venue which plans to house everything from a coffee shop (US!) to local and national touring acts, business conferences and a church that will gather there on Sundays.  Having this wide variety of people coming through and a building to call home puts us in a great starting position. However there is still a lot to be done, like building out the space to fit who we are, equipping it with commercial grade equipment, securing an architect, start up product, a website, licensing and so much more. Driftwood wants to be a place that you can meet your friends or coworkers at, see local art and musicians, and most of all deliver a quality cup of coffee that feeds your addiction. In order to do this we need 25,000 dollars. This might seem like a lot however this is just over half of the money we need to be fully operational and just enough to begin. If you look at the brief summary below you can see our desired outcome is $45,000.  The money you give will go straight to the shop, with it we will buy things like tables, espresso machines, lights, and comfy seats that don’t hurt your butt after 15 min of sitting in. If you look at the donation packaging options you will see some really cool stuff too! We are offering things like Cold Brew, t-shirts, Driftwood koozies, and even original artwork by our good friend D. Roy Brubaker! For donating you will also receive an invitation to our soft opening party!! We believe that it is in our best interest to engage you the community and ask for your help. If you believe in Old Town Peoria and the potential it has to bring will you consider helping us?

The Impact

Your contribution is so valuable to us and will help us get in the building faster. Not only do you get the sweet packages we have prepared but you also get to know that you helped us accomplish something that is so necessary for Peoria. Think about the conversations you’ve had with your friends over a cup of coffee. I know for us there have been amazing positive conversations and even terribly awkward breakups that have happened over a cup of delicious coffee. At Driftwood we would love to be a part of those stories.

We know we are new to the coffee shop ownership world but we have help. Our main source of wisdom comes from Kris Robison who is our primary consultant and has a vast amount of experience and knowledge in this field having managed and consulted some of the best Cartel, Jobots & Morning Moonshine.  Christoph Kaiser our architect has designed Changing Hands at the Newton, Welcome Diner and much more.  Lance has ran his own design and print company for many years and with great success. Although Luke has never run a business he has worked in the coffee industry for years and has successfully campaigned a T-shirt Kickstarter company. We are all in, and we want you to be a part of the history of Driftwood.

Risks & Challenges

Owning any business is a huge risk. Yet there is a great amount of reward that can come with it. Although we are new to this kind of business model and scale, we know we have outside support  who have talented gifts that we can utilize. One risk is the area we are preparing to move into. It is mostly abandoned and it’s a part of town that has been forgotten by most entrepreneurs. Our goal is to bring life into this area but that can only happen if people are willing to venture down and see us. There has been a huge support already, and we aren’t the first business to go into this area. There is a new distillery down there called Lucidis, and we will be right next to the Peoria government buildings. With a strong marketing campaign and a little help from our friends we will be able to make the business profitable. Another challenge we face is the finances of this operation. We don’t personally have the full amount to invest into this operation on our own, but we have invested a lot of time and are working hard to find ways to come up with more. As silly as it sounds we have done things like sell our apple watches just so we can pay for the expenses that come with even starting a business and hiring a consultant. Anything short of our goal we will have to seek through other means via a business loan or through personal investors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn’t the only way you can help, but every dollar is helpful! Even sharing our project with your friends can increase awareness so that others can know about our desire for a craft coffee shop in Peoria. There are sharing tools on our page so every post to Facebook or Instagram means A LOT! We hope you are just as excited as we are to be open and we are always humbled by our friends and family’s generosity. THANKS!

Here is a preview of some of the items in our packages!!!

We are in a unique position because we will be renting a space from Axiom Venue which plans to house everything from a coffee shop (US!) to local and national touring acts, business conferences and a church that will gather there on Sundays.  Having this wide variety of people coming through and a building to call home puts us in a great starting position. However there is still a lot to be done, like building out the space to fit who we are, equipping it with commercial grade equipment, securing an architect, start up product, a website, licensing and so much more. Driftwood wants to be a place that you can meet your friends or coworkers at, see local art and musicians, and most of all deliver a quality cup of coffee that feeds your addiction. In order to do this we need 25,000 dollars. This might seem like a lot however this is just over half of the money we need to be fully operational and just enough to begin. If you look at the brief summary below you can see our desired outcome is $45,000.  The money you give will go straight to the shop, with it we will buy things like tables, espresso machines, lights, and comfy seats that don’t hurt your butt after 15 min of sitting in. If you look at the donation packaging options you will see some really cool stuff too! We are offering things like Cold Brew, t-shirts, Driftwood koozies, and even original artwork by our good friend D. Roy Brubaker! For donating you will also receive an invitation to our soft opening party!! We believe that it is in our best interest to engage you the community and ask for your help. If you believe in Old Town Peoria and the potential it has to bring will you consider helping us?

The Impact
Your contribution is so valuable to us and will help us get in the building faster. Not only do you get the sweet packages we have prepared but you also get to know that you helped us accomplish something that is so necessary for Peoria. Think about the conversations you’ve had with your friends over a cup of coffee. I know for us there have been amazing positive conversations and even terribly awkward breakups that have happened over a cup of delicious coffee. At Driftwood we would love to be a part of those stories.
We know we are new to the coffee shop ownership world but we have help. Our main source of wisdom comes from Kris Robison who is our primary consultant and has a vast amount of experience and knowledge in this field having managed and consulted some of the best Cartel, Jobots & Morning Moonshine.  Christoph Kaiser our architect has designed Changing Hands at the Newton, Welcome Diner and much more.  Lance has ran his own design and print company for many years and with great success. Although Luke has never run a business he has worked in the coffee industry for years and has successfully campaigned a T-shirt Kickstarter company. We are all in, and we want you to be a part of the history of Driftwood.

Risks & Challenges
Owning any business is a huge risk. Yet there is a great amount of reward that can come with it. Although we are new to this kind of business model and scale, we know we have outside support  who have talented gifts that we can utilize. One risk is the area we are preparing to move into. It is mostly abandoned and it’s a part of town that has been forgotten by most entrepreneurs. Our goal is to bring life into this area but that can only happen if people are willing to venture down and see us. There has been a huge support already, and we aren’t the first business to go into this area. There is a new distillery down there called Lucidis, and we will be right next to the Peoria government buildings. With a strong marketing campaign and a little help from our friends we will be able to make the business profitable. Another challenge we face is the finances of this operation. We don’t personally have the full amount to invest into this operation on our own, but we have invested a lot of time and are working hard to find ways to come up with more. As silly as it sounds we have done things like sell our apple watches just so we can pay for the expenses that come with even starting a business and hiring a consultant. Anything short of our goal we will have to seek through other means via a business loan or through personal investors. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Money isn’t the only way you can help, but every dollar is helpful! Even sharing our project with your friends can increase awareness so that others can know about our desire for a craft coffee shop in Peoria. There are sharing tools on our page so every post to Facebook or Instagram means A LOT! We hope you are just as excited as we are to be open and we are always humbled by our friends and family’s generosity. THANKS!
Here is a preview of some of the items in our packages!!!

story:
My name is Randy Vaughn I just turned 60 years old this past spring.

Something you need to know about me right up front is that I am a hardworking, honest and compassionate person. I live in a small town in the Midwest, Henderson, KY, where we still hold true the values that built this country.......where a man’s handshake is his bond.  

    Our community, like many others in small towns throughout this country, has been invaded by the large box stores such as Walmart, Lowes, K-Mart. The result of this influx has been the demise of local mom and pop small business owners. Only a few remain.

   Henderson is a beautiful town that sits on the banks of the Ohio River. The potential to create a thriving downtown district is unlimited. Sadly the local business community and Financial Institutions lack the vision, passion and courage it takes to turn things around.

   I have been a musician for 51 years. I started playing drums at the age of 9 and through the years learned piano, guitar and vocals.   But despite my passion for music I learned early in life that my primary responsibility was to support and care for my family. I was fortunate enough at an early age I learned I had to balance my life between what I loved to do ........and what I had to do.

   In the spring of 2011 I purchased, at an auction, a three story building located  in the downtown business district.  Sadly to say this was a local mom and pop Hardware Store that had been in business for 4 generations. The building originally was a manufacturing facility for John Deer Buggies and Carriages. Later after the introduction of the automobile it was converted into a furniture manufacturing plant by George Delker. Hence the name ……….” Delkers”

 My plans were to open a Music Venue/Eatery. A place of retirement where I could meet with friends , play music and enjoy what years I had left when and if  that retirement date came.

    Up to this point in my life I had worked since the age of 13. Yes I started playing drums in local Honky Tonks at an early age. Throughout the next 40 some odd years I was a salesman. Through various changes of employment I sold Audio Video products, Plumbing Supplies, Fasteners and cars. I eventually became a Industrial  Product Support Specialist ……..(fancy name for Salesman) This became my  means of support for my family up until the fall of 2014 when I injured  my  knee on a jobsite while employed with a very large corporation out of New Bremen,OH …….I was 58 at the time. Needless to say after my injury I was viewed by my employer as a liability and , as my attorney put it, it was just a matter of time before they found a way to dispose of me.  One thing you should know about my work history is that prior to my termination I was Salesman of the year in my division for 2012 , 2013 and in 2014 and I was in the running to win it for the third consecutive year. I was the top producer over other territories such as Cincinnati, Indianapolis, Louisville and Lexington that were two to three times the size of my territory. After having knee surgery I returned to work with light duty. I was put on display in the office and was assigned the degrading task of removing staples from documents , scanning them, and then refiling them. I did this for 8 weeks.  I was eventually allowed to return to my original position in outside sales. But with expectations and sales quota’s that the company and I both knew were unattainable.  Little did I know that over the next three months the company was monitoring my emails, text messages, voicemails, phone calls and tracking my location daily with GPS. After those three months I was called into a meeting and was put through a 2-hour inquisition by five different individuals in management and was terminated. I was terminated on small technicalities such as inaccuracies in my call reports and conflicting dates and times. They knew this was my weak point because I have ADHD. Previously I had stated that I was assigned sales quota’s that were looked upon as unreachable. Well the ironic thing about it is that at the time of this inquisition my sales numbers were 25% OVER quota and were on track to be 43% over the assigned goal at the end of the month. I brought this to the attention of my supervisor and I was told very bluntly “ We are not here to discuss your sales numbers.”

  At that point the Music Venue I had been working on went from being a retirement project to my only means of income. My wife had just retired from a position at the local newspaper after 34 years.

    Our personal investment to this point has been well over $250,000.00  I have since sold a custom  Harley Davidson Motorcycle, a Vintage 1963 Volkswagon Bus, rental property, various musical equipment and instruments  and have totally depleted our retirement fund.

    I have somehow survived the first two years but it has financially drained me to the point that I have been forced to seek outside assistance. Believe me when I say .....this is not an easy thing for me to do.  .

For me to have worked so hard and get this far just to have it all slip away would surely leave a permanent scar on me emotionally.

    I have followed my vision and plan to the tee and there is still much more to do. I have the strength, drive , determination and passion to succeed .............I just don't have the capital.

   You can read this and get a general idea of my situation but to truly understand my story you need to know me and the type of person I am.  Search on Facebook and find my personal page Randy Vaughn and my business page Delker's Bar & Music Venue ( Delkers has a 4.8 out of 5-star rating out of 78 reviews) and a second page (my sandwich shop) The Alley and you will discover through the words of my friends and the community that I have and continue to give it everything humanly possible. As the old saying goes ....." I am not asking for a handout......I'm asking for a leg up.

“ If I failed tomorrow I could walk away with my head held high knowing in my heart I had given it all I had …………or did I?”

Respectfully ,

Randal D Vaughn

  

    I have followed my vision and plan to the tee and there is still much more to do. I have the strength, drive , determination and passion to succeed .............I just don't have the capital.

   You can read this and get a general idea of my situation but to truly understand my story you need to know me and the type of person I am.  Search on Facebook and find my personal page Randy Vaughn and my business page Delker's Bar & Music Venue and a second page (my sandwich shop) The Alley and you will discover through the words of my friends and the community that I have and continue to give it every thing I have. As the old saying goes ....." I am not asking for a handout......I'm asking for a leg up.
