story:
It Started with a Conversation over Cocktails

*** Update 12/5:  in the 4 weeks since first production, MATE is now in 7 stores with deliveries to 2 more this week so far.  Progress! ***

Introducing MATE® Premium Cocktail Mixers.

 

And Continued with Research and Testing

Spurred on by the tremendous growth in the craft beer industry, which in turn has driven the current dramatic growth of the craft spirits industry, cocktail mixers are quickly gaining momentum based on flavor and product innovation. More people are paying attention to mixers today when ordering cocktails at bars and restaurants, and are willing to pay for quality. For social gatherings at home, many of us simply don’t have the time, access to ingredients, or knowledge required to make great cocktails. Instead, we end up buying juices or sodas for mixers…or give up and grab a bottle of wine.

Life is an amazing journey meant to be enjoyed. A conversation over cocktails is a great way to enjoy friendship. MATE® Premium Cocktail Mixers were created for mixing with your favorite spirits. And to bear that out, preliminary samples were taste-tested by over 100 people around the USA...friends, former colleagues, industry experts, and many other acquaintances. The overwhelming feedback was so positive that I knew it was time to step up the planning and move forward.

MATE® Your Spirit

The brand name: MATE®. The purpose: to enhance the cocktail experience. After many months (several years, really) of development, I am introducing a series of 6 cocktail mixers that contain unique flavor combinations using all natural ingredients….some familiar and some not so familiar but all sourced in the USA. No preservatives, and no artificial flavoring or coloring additives. Each mixer will be packaged in a 375ml bottle that will make about 25 drinks. Whether you enjoy gin, vodka, whiskey/bourbon, tequila or rum, there are one or more MATE® products that you will appreciate. In fact, most are interchangeable with more than one spirit. And on top of all that, most mix very nicely with wine to make outstanding spritzers if that’s your preference. Not to be left out, beer lovers can enjoy one of the MATE® products mixed with their favorite brew for a really edgy experience. You won’t find any other mixer on the market that can make these exciting claims.

View of the production run of the first 3 MATE® products!
 

Recipes are set, ingredients and bottles ordered, labels are at the printers, and trademark and licensing are all done. First production has been completed at a fantastic local co-packer in Golden, Colorado. I am still working out how to make MATE® available online in a way that minimizes shipping costs. Several local and national retailers are prepared to give MATE® a place on their shelves, and a number of local bars and restaurants are anxiously awaiting MATE® availability.

I launched this campaign because help is needed to raise funds to get the remaining products to market quickly. Here is what will be done next, and this is where I need your help. I will need to produce the other 3 MATE® products fairly soon based on expected demand. That will require additional ingredients, bottles, labels, and co-packing (~$2500 per product). In addition, I must quickly get materials designed and prepared that will be used for marketing and promotional swag (~$2000).

Please help me realize my dream of producing superior quality cocktail mixers that enhance spirits and conversations. Watch a new small business (family-owned!) capture the local market first, and then spread out to all other points You will not only have my sincere thanks, but you will also get one of the great rewards listed on the right.

Please share this with your friends! Don’t let the conversations be about bad cocktails!

Please Note

MATE® Premium Cocktail Mixers are NON-ALCOHOLIC, and will only be available in the Denver area at this time. As MATE® progresses, and I am able to ship outside the area without breaking the bank, I will be working hard to establish distribution points that will get MATE® into your local stores. Several of the reward levels will include personal delivery of MATE®. People anywhere can donate at any level!

For those of you who are curious about what is in the products, here are the 6 MATE® Premium Cocktail Mixers:

FRESH Hibiscus Tonic - Crafted from fine natural ingredients to MATE® with Gin or Vodka for a light body with citrus notes and a clean finish. An added hint of floral tones from Hibiscus makes an invigorating flavor profile. Primary ingredients are inverted cane sugar, quinine, orange extract, lime extract, hibiscus extract.

RADIANT Cranberry Orange - Crafted from fine natural ingredients to MATE® with Vodka, Gin, Whiskey or Tequila for a mellow body with crisp citrus zest and bright flavors. Primary ingredients are inverted cane sugar, cranberry juice, orange extract, lime extract.

GALLANT Black Currant Pecan - Crafted from fine natural ingredients to MATE® with Whiskey, Bourbon or Tequila for a full-bodied cassis flavor with a bold complexity of toasted pecan and oak. Primary ingredients are inverted cane sugar, pecan extract, black currant juice, American oak extract, angelica root extract.

CHARMING Grapefruit Lime - Crafted from fine natural ingredients to MATE® with Tequila, Vodka, Whiskey, or Gin for a refreshing citrus flavor with an elegant style. Added lime makes an engaging finish. Primary ingredients are inverted cane sugar, grapefruit juice, lime extract.

CAPTIVE Cherry Bark Spice - Crafted from fine natural ingredients to MATE® with Rum for an enchanting aroma of apple, cinnamon and cherry giving an edible-like character. Primary ingredients are inverted cane sugar, molasses, vanilla extract, apple juice, cinnamon extract, wild cherry bark extract.

SULTRY Rich Coffee Vanilla - Crafted from fine natural ingredients to MATE® with Vodka, Whiskey, Tequila or Rum showcasing gourmet coffee with vanilla and caramel opulence to make for an amorous finish. Primary ingredients are inverted cane sugar, Kona coffee concentrate, vanilla extract, molasses.

All MATE® products except CAPTIVE make great spritzers when mixed with wine. SULTRY is also outstanding when mixed with beer. Inverted cane sugar is simply cane sugar mixed with water and then heated to a point where there is no concern with crystallization of the liquid.

Moving Ahead

Thank you so much for your support. You will be proud. So go ahead. Have a conversation. MATE® your spirit.

 

Risks and challenges

The greatest challenge to my project is being able to produce enough MATE® to meet the early demand. Everything is in place to make this a successful brand. The risk to the business by not having enough product available and not having marketing materials ready to promote MATE® is very clear in terms of lost opportunity. I am creating interest and demand right now. With your help, I will deliver.

story: Our goal here at DCOMMA is to help people in their personal fitness and health journeys.  We want to help you feel confident in the body you're in! We specialize in weight loss, toning, muscular endurance and strength, flexibility, and over all health.  We provide a variety of cardio classes to keep you moving including Kickboxing, Boot Camps, High Interval Training, and Zumba. We also understand the need for restoration and relaxation with our Yoga classes. For more personalized and specific target needs, we offer Private Training sessions. We are also an MMA, Muay Thai, and Boxing school with classes for kids to learn self defense and proper technique. Our MMA fight team is skilled and active lead by Professional fighter "Big" Steve Paprocki.  We are family operated, welcoming to all ages and skill levels, and cannot wait for you to join our DCOMMA family!

story:
Local is best!

By helping to fund this kitchen, you'll be giving others the chance to produce amazing, good quality foods that can be sold in my store. As you probably know, there are many hurdles to selling food in this city, many of them legitimate reasons related to health and safety, others that are just pure red tape! However, as I've discovered, there are many of you out there who would love to share their culinary creations with the neighbourhood or just come in and take part in one of our healthy eating workshops run by certified holistic nutritionists or gourmet, artisan food seminars led by fellow foodies and local chefs. 

Additionally, the kitchen will allow me to make fresh baked goods in-store which, by an increase in revenue, will let me support other small-batch artisan food producers in Ontario.

What I need for this to become a reality is to invest a small amount of money to create a kitchen area that can pass City inspection. This includes:

  • A new tiled floor in that area
  • A fridge and stove
  • Display fridge to sell refrigerated items such as salads and fresh soups
  • 2 compartment sink plus handwashing sink
  • Various kitchen items including pots, pans, kitchen utensils

With your help this can become a real culinary hub in the Upper Beach!
story_txt:
Local is best!By helping to fund this kitchen, you'll be giving others the chance to produce amazing, good quality foods that can be sold in my store. As you probably know, there are many hurdles to selling food in this city, many of them legitimate reasons related to health and safety, others that are just pure red tape! However, as I've discovered, there are many of you out there who would love to share their culinary creations with the neighbourhood or just come in and take part in one of our healthy eating workshops run by certified holistic nutritionists or gourmet, artisan food seminars led by fellow foodies and local chefs. Additionally, the kitchen will allow me to make fresh baked goods in-store which, by an increase in revenue, will let me support other small-batch artisan food producers in Ontario.What I need for this to become a reality is to invest a small amount of money to create a kitchen area that can pass City inspection. This includes:
A new tiled floor in that area
A fridge and stove
Display fridge to sell refrigerated items such as salads and fresh soups
2 compartment sink plus handwashing sink
Various kitchen items including pots, pans, kitchen utensils
With your help this can become a real culinary hub in the Upper Beach!

story:
Why help me replace my camera equipment?

Some background first.

I am a good photographer, not great, but after 40 years of shooting I have the capability of creating some images that can tell a story.

 

When I came to Ecuador ( a long story) Photography was still my passion, but it didn't serve a purpose.  Then a met an amazing lady who runs a non profit foundation to help the people of Manabi ( a very poor province of Ecuador) who have vision problems.

In order to help I offered my services to do the one thing I am good at, creating photographs.

After the earthquake she also starting working on helping rehouse the visually impaired.  Through the resurgance campaign there are now enough funds to build 10 to 13 houses.  I am happy I was able to play a small part in this.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KhobmTwst1k

(The stills in this video I put together is from other sources the still images were shot by me.)

Unfortunately the used camera equipment I brought to Ecuador is starting to show signs of breaking down.  I have already worn out two cameras, and I have a lens that need to be repaired ( fell off a shelf during the earthquake).  If I am going to continue to volunteer I need to replace and repair my equipment.

Why Now?

I have a trip to Canada to visit family and i should be able to some decent used equipment while Ii am there.

 

Why this amount?

I had to put something down.  Frankly I will be surprised if I reach this amount, but anything i receive will be greatly appreciated.   I would really love to be able to pick up one of the used 1DX that Henrys has for sale in their used department ( weather seal is very important to me) a G5 or G7 would also be useful.

What can you do to help?

  • you can laugh at my feeble attempt to fundraise.
  • you could donate $10  really any little bit would help
  • you can share this with all the models and photographers I you know who may know me.
  • If you are in Toronto, and have some portable ( think having to carry for a couple of kilometers ) lighting equipment you would like to donate please contact me.

story:
What I'm Trying To Do:

AC&TC. is trying to get some righteous swag out there and I need your help!
My name is Avery. As you may or may not know, Austin Plug & Tunnel Co. is a one man operation I started here in Austin Tx. I design the plugs, make the plugs, and ship the plugs worldwide. 
People kept asking me if I had some shirts or stickers and I was a bit at a loss. So here we go, let's make this happen!

As of right now, I've already paid the artist for his work on this design out of my own pocket. So that part is out of the way. I'd like help making that money back and also generate funds to commission him to do several more to create a line of these cool *Modded Animal* t-shirts, stickers, etc.

Funds and where they are going:

1. $650 will help me break even for the art design and printing.

2. The next $250 will go to commission a second design from the artist. 

Stay tuned for stretch goals!
 

Risks & Challenges:

Oh you know. All the average stuff. I've already paid the artist so really, this Indiegogo is to pre-order a ready to print product. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Summary

Cider's popularity has been skyrocketing the last few years. While supermarket shelves are overflowing with options for sweet, inexpensive mid- to low-grade cider, real, dry cider made with the right kind of apples is still hard to come by. The most common complaint I still hear about cider is that it's too sweet. Well, we're making fully dry, wild fermented, barrel aged cider. Our emphasis is on the apples. You won't see an array of flavored ciders like cherry, hopped, or whatever coming from Lassen Traditional Cidery. When you use the right kind of apples, you don't have to add other flavors to it! The apples are amazing on their own! You wouldn't adulterate a fine wine by adding other flavors to it, so why do it to quality cider? So what do we mean by the "right" apples? Well, true bittersweet and bittersharp cider varieties are grown in France and England, but are extremely rare in the US. Historically, what we call heirloom apples are what were used for cider in the US. These are seedling apples that were discovered and selectively propagated and have a unique history in our country. These old-time varieties were once somewhat common, but apple diversity has slowly faded away and sales of homogeneous, mass produced common dessert apples have long taken over nationwide apples sales. We are focused on finding orchards growing these heirloom varieties for use in our cider. Some examples of the varieties we use include King David, Winesap, Newtown Pippin, Arkansas Black, and Jonathan. These apples don't necessarily have the high tannin levels present in the European cider apples, but they do have amazing aromatic flavors that result in delicious cider. Our cidermaking methods are reminiscent of how cider was made a hundred years ago, thus the reason for the word traditional appearing in our name. We do a wild fermentation in oak barrels, contributing a rustic complexity that is hard to find in most currently available ciders.

Lassen Traditional Cider was founded by Ben Nielsen. Ben's love of fermentation began when he started brewing beer in college. After brewing extensively for his adult life, around 2005 he began delving into cider in an effort to use the free fruit from a neighbor's backyard apples trees in Corvallis, OR. After a couple years, this morphed into an annual cider pressing party where all his friends would bring apples to press or just help out. So of course, the neighbor's apples weren't enough after a while. Unused trees in yards all over town, unseen apple trees in the ditch on the side of a country road, and long forgotten pioneer orchards were all sought out and utilized. A major revelation occurred when a batch of cider was produced from crab apples, and it ended up being the best he'd ever made. So, some apples that were so astringent as to be seemingly inedible actually made delicious cider. After this, an effort was undertaken to seek out varieties of apples that were good for cider instead of scavenging whatever was available. Finding Nick Botner's orchard in Yoncalla, OR, with over 4,000 apple varieties, was a godsend, allowing Ben to experiment with single varietal ciders made from unusual apples, from European bittersharps and bittersweets to an array of American heirlooms. Around 2012, when the cider craze was beginning to kick into high gear and Ben's satisfaction with his engineering job was waning in the opposite direction, he began to give more thought to starting his own cidery. A timely layoff in 2014 pushed him more in that direction. After spending a winter skiing and soul searching, the decision was solidified and the plan was put in place in mid 2015. Most of a year was spent finding a location and undertaking the permit process. Although he's still learning how to be a businessman, he has a lot of pride in his cider. Now here we are ready for you to enjoy the fruits of our labor.


What We Need

We need your help getting us off the ground! I've already invested $40,000 of my own money establishing the business. I've been going through the permit process for a painstaking 8 months and I'm almost legal. During the harvest season this year I'm planning on being ready to go to make a larger amount of cider to sell to the masses. To get there, I will need to spend another $24,000 in the next couple months. What I'm asking for in this campaign will hopefully raise enough money to cover the cost of some capital equipment. This includes:

  • 2, 290 jacketed stainless steel fermenters ($6600)
  • 14 used wine barrels with racks ($2100)
  • 1 bottle labeler ($1000)

My other expenses this fall will be:

  • Apples ($4000)
  • 750 mL bottles ($6000)
  • 50, 5 gal. kegs ($4000)

Additionally, the Indiegogo and bank fees will be $500-1000, and the cost of the rewards will be around $1500.

I have $12,000 of my own money to spend, but to be able to accomplish what I want to do this year I need your help!

The Impact

Your contribution will enable my business to become established and be able to move forward.

Risks & Challenges

If I'm unable to achieve my fundraising goal, I will still be able to continue, but I'll have to finance the remaining expenses on credit cards. This will set me back a year and make it more difficult to expand my business in subsequent years.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute at this time, there are other ways you can help. Please do what you can to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Come down to Chico and help press apples in October!

story:
Our dream began in 2011

Roshani and myself (Fletcher) began a catering company based out of Hunter's Point in 2011, and slowly worked toward our dream of owning our own restaurant. We worked for 3 years, serving corporate meals, events, boxed meals, street vending, pop ups, and everything in between. 
We eventually saved enough to move into our Bayview location, hired a crew of good people from the neighborhood, and have been open ever since! If you haven't been by to try our epic burgers, brunch, and hand crafted California bistro cuisine, you don't know what you are missing!

We love the neighborhood, and intend on making it our home!

However, we've incurred significant start up costs, and with foot traffic still fairly low on the third street corridor, we are finding it difficult to stay open as many hours as we would like.  We've recently closed on Monday and Tuesday, as well as Saturday nights, to save on payroll. We briefly decided to close weekday nights (Wed-Fri), but thanks to all your support and feedback we have reopened, and you will now find me working the line at night until 8pm, if you get a case of the munchies.

We are hoping to pay off the highest interest of our loans, the last of the equipment and vehicles we purchased, and have the ability to not only keep our doors open while we wait for the neighborhood traffic to catch up with us and our concept, but also the flexibility to offer increased hours and local *delivery service* as well!

The Impact

Your donation will help keep us open for service, employing many local residents, supporting local and organic farms, quality food purveyors, and the local merchants we purchase from. We would also like to expand our offerings to include espresso drinks and house made sausages, which require some new equipment. We like to think we brighten up a stretch of 3rd st. and bring a bit of fun, flavor, and good energy to the area, and we will do our best to continue to do so!

Risks & Challenges

Right now we are waiting for current construction and new businesses to bring a new clientele to our side of the city, who will surely fill our dining room in the proper time. Until then, we are supporting ourselves with catering across the Bay Area. Unfortunately, catering season (as well as restaurant business) is slowest after the holidays, and while we have many office and corporate type events each week, it's surely the slowest time of the year. However, we have weathered this "dry spell" for the past four years, and we know we can do it again. We have many new contracts lining up as we speak, and it looks like a busy spring is headed our way. We only ask you to help us get through this brief tough time and we may see many more years together!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, we totally understand! Times are tough all around. We would be forever grateful if you could help us spread the work of our catering program, where we serve anything from an office lunch for 12 to a wedding for 250. If you or a friend mention the code "IGG" we will offer a 25% discount for any catering through the month of February! In addition, please follow us on Facebook for up to date info on what's happening at CDXX:  https://www.facebook.com/cdxxsf

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Matt.  I have spent the last 15 years managing a pizza shop and know the ins and outs of getting what people want to them, how, where, and when they want or need it. 

I’m trying to start a food delivery business servicing Pittsburgh and the surrounding areas.  This is a much needed business in the Pittsburgh area that I anticipate will do very well.  Similar services are already offered in other cities. 

You're at home and hungry as hell, but you don’t have a car, or maybe you just don’t feel like leaving your home. Currently, your only options for meal delivery are pizza or Chinese food.  Don’t get me wrong, I’m not knocking pizza or Chinese food, but there are times (many times) when you just want all food options available, and that’s where my delivery service comes in. I would like to have my service to be like Uber but instead of picking up people from one place to another it will be food and to expand that to groceries and whatever else somebody may need from a store.

What We Need & What You Get


  • I need starting capital for a website website to store every menu in the Pittsburgh and Surrounding Pittsburgh Area and to have that site so the customer can order whatever they want from wherever they want. To do it right I would also need to have apps for all phone and tablet OS's.
  • On top of having the opportunity of helping launch this unique and much needed service to the Pittsburgh Area. I plan on sending investors Bring Me Grub Hoodies, T-Shirts, and Key Chains.
  • Even if funding falls short of our goal I plan on using what I get to go full speed ahead and make due with whatever people are generous enough to give.

The Impact

This service can revolutionize the restaurant and food industry.

  • There is no other service like this in the city so the sky is the limit and possibilities are endless and there is no competition in the area to content with.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when stepping out of your normal safe day to day life to take a chance on something new and daunting. My idea has very little risk and the biggest challenge will be man power and the interactive app with all the menus. 

  • I have a lot of experience in this industry and know what it takes to pull this off.
  • I am the one on the ground pounding the pavement and talking to the owners to get on board and gathering all of the information and cooperation I can get.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in the position to donate any money I only ask that you can spread the word of my service whether it be to get people to that could donate to this project or just to get the word of mouth out once the business launches.

story:
I am Nick Laister, the founder of Fairytale Farm, a sensory farm attraction in Oxfordshire.  We need help with our next phase of the development of Fairytale Farm.

Our Story

Fairytale Farm is the first mainstream visitor attraction where everything has been designed for children with disabilities - but that can be enjoyed by everybody - and where no pre-booking is required. The Farm was inspired by my family's experiences with our daughter, Olivia, who has cerebral palsy, and the Farm has become a great success in the (almost) three years since it opened. 

We have achieved a phenomenal amount since the Prime Minister, David Cameron, cut the ribbon in 2013, but there is a lot more to do and we need your help to achieve it. We are a very small group of staff and volunteers, passionate about what we are doing, and there is a huge amount still to achieve if we are going to complete our unique and pioneering vision.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £91,500 to complete a series of projects over the next two years, which will complete the original farm concept. There's more on the projects below.

In exchange for your support, we will be offering a range of rewards and incentives that are not available to anyone else. These include branded gifts, unique farm visits, animal keeper experiences, a VIP party, opportunities to immortalise yourself on the Enchanted Walk and lifetime passes with exciting perks. 

If we don't make it to our full goal, we will still complete as many of the projects listed below as we are able to do.

Funding

We are trying to raise £91,500 for the following projects, all of which we aim to implement over the next 24 months:

• Two new interactive themed areas based on fairies and dinosaurs;
• Upgrading our existing cafe to make it more appealing and to enable it to be used for a variety of functions;
• Installing new chairs and tables in the cafe;
• Hoist for disabled children;
• Installing an interactive sound system for the Sea Creatures and Party Poppers on our Enchanted Walk;
• Creating a unique, interactive 'Giant's Camera', which takes photos and instantly posts on Facebook;

• Activity panels with things that can be turned, touched, make noise, etc;
• Giant willow tunnel over light fountains, so that the lights can be used all day long to create a colourful, moving light show;

• Creating a raised sandpit for wheelchair users;
• Animal handling building to allow animal petting in adverse weather and shelter for school groups;

• New toilet block at bottom of site;
• Hay barn and feed store for the animal area;
• Automated water system for animals;
• Complete our new cafe building and party rooms, fit out and furnish;
• Create new enclosures/aviaries/buildings for small animal displays, e.g. birds, ferrets; 
• Extension to the Huff and Puff Adventure Playground to create a new toddlers playground to include new toddlers climbing equipment, special all-ability pedal tractor track and toddlers sandpit.

Why support us?

We are leading the way in making attractions more accessible. Nobody else is doing what we are doing, and because we are the first, almost everything we do is bespoke. This funding will allow our team to appoint external contractors to carry out the work and enable us to create a magical day out for families with disabled and non-disabled children. 

I have been involved in the development of visitor attractions for many years, but this project is personal. It is my own project and is close to my heart. I feel passionate about getting this project right and believe that crowdfunding is the best way to make this happen.

Risks & Challenges

As a construction project, there will always be risks. Projects can overrun or can go over budget. I have been involved in the development of attractions for over 20 years, and the small team at Fairytale Farm has already overcome numerous challenges. We are getting rather good at that! But we are not complacent, and will ensure that everybody who contributes to this campaign is updated every step of the way as each project reaches a milestone. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make as much noise as you can about your campaign. Tell your friends, your family and your colleagues. Tell the world! You can do that using the Indiegogo share tools; it'll only take a minute.

Thank you!
story_txt:
I am Nick Laister, the founder of Fairytale Farm, a sensory farm attraction in Oxfordshire.  We need help with our next phase of the development of Fairytale Farm.


Our Story
Fairytale Farm is the first mainstream visitor attraction where everything has been designed for children with disabilities - but that can be enjoyed by everybody - and where no pre-booking is required. The Farm was inspired by my family's experiences with our daughter, Olivia, who has cerebral palsy, and the Farm has become a great success in the (almost) three years since it opened. 
We have achieved a phenomenal amount since the Prime Minister, David Cameron, cut the ribbon in 2013, but there is a lot more to do and we need your help to achieve it. We are a very small group of staff and volunteers, passionate about what we are doing, and there is a huge amount still to achieve if we are going to complete our unique and pioneering vision.



What We Need & What You Get

We need £91,500 to complete a series of projects over the next two years, which will complete the original farm concept. There's more on the projects below.
In exchange for your support, we will be offering a range of rewards and incentives that are not available to anyone else. These include branded gifts, unique farm visits, animal keeper experiences, a VIP party, opportunities to immortalise yourself on the Enchanted Walk and lifetime passes with exciting perks. 
If we don't make it to our full goal, we will still complete as many of the projects listed below as we are able to do.


Funding
We are trying to raise £91,500 for the following projects, all of which we aim to implement over the next 24 months:
• Two new interactive themed areas based on fairies and dinosaurs;• Upgrading our existing cafe to make it more appealing and to enable it to be used for a variety of functions;• Installing new chairs and tables in the cafe;• Hoist for disabled children;• Installing an interactive sound system for the Sea Creatures and Party Poppers on our Enchanted Walk;• Creating a unique, interactive 'Giant's Camera', which takes photos and instantly posts on Facebook;


• Activity panels with things that can be turned, touched, make noise, etc;• Giant willow tunnel over light fountains, so that the lights can be used all day long to create a colourful, moving light show;• Creating a raised sandpit for wheelchair users;• Animal handling building to allow animal petting in adverse weather and shelter for school groups;

• New toilet block at bottom of site;• Hay barn and feed store for the animal area;• Automated water system for animals;• Complete our new cafe building and party rooms, fit out and furnish;• Create new enclosures/aviaries/buildings for small animal displays, e.g. birds, ferrets; • Extension to the Huff and Puff Adventure Playground to create a new toddlers playground to include new toddlers climbing equipment, special all-ability pedal tractor track and toddlers sandpit.


    Why support us? We are leading the way in making attractions more accessible. Nobody else is doing what we are doing, and because we are the first, almost everything we do is bespoke. This funding will allow our team to appoint external contractors to carry out the work and enable us to create a magical day out for families with disabled and non-disabled children. 
I have been involved in the development of visitor attractions for many years, but this project is personal. It is my own project and is close to my heart. I feel passionate about getting this project right and believe that crowdfunding is the best way to make this happen.   Risks & Challenges As a construction project, there will always be risks. Projects can overrun or can go over budget. I have been involved in the development of attractions for over 20 years, and the small team at Fairytale Farm has already overcome numerous challenges. We are getting rather good at that! But we are not complacent, and will ensure that everybody who contributes to this campaign is updated every step of the way as each project reaches a milestone. 
    Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make as much noise as you can about your campaign. Tell your friends, your family and your colleagues. Tell the world! You can do that using the Indiegogo share tools; it'll only take a minute.
  Thank you!

story:
Voici le portrait du Central Parc Skatepark

Nous sommes deux jeunes passionnés. Ayant, travaillés plusieurs années avec les adolescents et pratiquer la planche à roulette. Nous avons compris qu’il y avait un besoin à combler dans la région. Les jeunes réclament un skatepark intérieur depuis des années. Nous avons alors commencé à développer le projet. Actuellement, nous considérons que le projet a atteint sa maturité. Nous avons un local de 14 000 pieds carrés dans le Complexe Arts et Découvertes. Nous avons débuté les travaux de construction.

Nous offrirons un programme de sport étude ainsi qu’un camp de jour spécialisé. Nous soutiendrons la lutte contre le décrochage scolaire ainsi que la communauté à travers différents programmes. Nous nous engageons à offrir une bourse d’étude annuellement à un jeune, qui démontre par son attitude, sa volonté de réussir . Nous comptons également offrir quelques passes de saison et un accès au camp de jour à des jeunes qui démontrent de l’intérêt et dont les moyens financier familiaux sont restreints.

La mission du Central Parc est de permettre aux passionnés de sports sur roues de pratiquer dans un endroit encadré et sécuritaire tout en se développant globalement aux meilleurs de leurs capacités. Nous soutenons la lutte contre le décrochage scolaire en proposant des programmes axés sur l’activité physique, la valorisation par le sport et la créativité pour ainsi permettre à ceux et celles qui le désirent de faire partie de l’élite dans leurs disciplines respectives.

Nous voulons instaurer un climat détendu, accueillant et respectueux où les amateurs se sentiront à leur place.

Le skateboard est un sport qui est en voie d’être admis au Jeu Olympique. Des infrastructures de qualité et accessible sont nécessaires afin de propulser les adeptes aux sommets de leur sport.

Tous est en place pour que le Central Parc soit une réussite. Nous sollicitons votre aide pour que le dernier petit bout de chemin soit franchi. Nous avons besoin d'un minimum de 5 000$ pour atteindre le coût total de la construction des modules. Chaque don (achat) peu importe le montant sera un pas de plus vers la réussite. Nous croyons en la force de la communauté. Nous tenons à préciser que les campagnes sur Indiegogo sont sécuritaire.

Merci de faire parti de cette aventure et de permettre aux jeunes de s'épanouir!!!

Amicalement,                                                                                                                                           Marie-Joëlle Navert

story:
Hello, my name is Paul McMenemy. I edit a magazine called Lunar Poetry. I am looking to establish a dedicated poetry bookshop in London as there currently isn’t one. In fact, as far as I know there is only one poetry bookshop in the whole of the UK, in Hay-on-Wye. [Edit: I have now found out that there is also one in Glasgow: Tell It Slant - do check it out.] This is rather out of the way for most people, and I don’t think that poetry is something you should have to go on a special pilgrimage to experience, but something that should be easily accessible to as many people as possible.

Most new poetry in the UK is published by small presses whose work never makes into most bookshops; often it isn’t even very easy to find online, only being accessible through the publishers’ own websites. As there are hundreds of these (the Saison Poetry Library website lists over a hundred currently active small presses and around the same number of little magazines in Britain) there is no way, even for someone with an active interest in modern poetry, to keep track of all this stuff. And for someone who is looking to find their way into poetry for the first time, this confusion of tiny presses makes it almost impossible to do so.

I want a bookshop and website which gathers as much of this poetry together as possible in one place – a comfortable place you don’t feel like you need to have a special password to get into. The Free Verse poetry book fair has shown that if you can do this, people will come, and will buy poetry. But again, I don’t think poetry is something you should have to set aside a special fund for, in order to have an annual splurge – I think it ought to be something that, if you have a spare fiver or so in your pocket come payday, you ought to be able to pop in somewhere and pick up something on a whim.

I’klectik Art Lab in central London have agreed to let us have a space inside their venue in order to set up a shop of this kind. I’klectik is a gallery, café and performance space about ten minutes from Waterloo station, the Saison Poetry Library and the Poetry School. They currently host a monthly Spoken Word night, Silence Found a Tongue, and have previously held launch nights for Lunar Poetry.

We are looking for at least £5,000 to cover our initial rent, wages, furnishing costs and stock – this last item will account for the majority of the cash. In return, we are offering – as well as the chance to contribute to something I hope you feel is worthwhile – subscriptions to and copies of Lunar Poetry and various other forthcoming Lunar publications (including some special limited edition work), the opportunity to take part in workshops for both adults and children, free tickets to performances and other chances to be a part of the bookshop in one way or another. If you can’t help with cash just now, please spread the word and help us reach as many people as possible.

Poetry is often seen as irrelevant. This is not true. Poetry is, though, at the moment, invisible. Having a dedicated space where poetry can be treated, not as a special, delicate flower which has to be sheltered from the cruel world, but as something which can be bought, sold, experienced, handled, discussed and enjoyed just like anything else – where poetry is a real thing interacting with the real world – is a step towards making it visible. If you already have an interest in poetry, I hope you can see why this is worth doing. Even if you don’t much care for poetry, hopefully you’ll agree that anything which makes art in any form more widely available (and other artforms are currently far more easily accessed than poetry) contributes to the richness of our cultural life – and, you never know, the Lunar Poetry Bookshop might just be the thing to change your mind.

story:
Short Summary

Together, we can build a better Craig Hospital--a Craig Hospital that echoes our values of being patient-centered, family-oriented, and on the cusp of new technologies for patients with spinal cord and traumatic brain injury.  Today, we have the opportunity to collectively build a private consultation room in Craig Hospital's Outpatient Clinic.  Our expanded Outpatient Clinic will:

  • Double in size, increasing the capacity to serve our friends, family, neighbors,and colleagues.  More people will be able to access our specialized services for people with brain and spinal cord injury, allowing us to serve the community better.
  • Increase in quality of care as we build more private consultation and therapy spaces that allow for patients and families to rehabilitate together.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Today, your gift will be doubled, up to $50,000, thanks to a dollar-for-dollar match from an anonymous donor who is a recipient of Craig Hospital's Outpatient Clinic Services.

What We Need & What You Get

Last year, we served over 1,400 outpatients with spinal cord and brain injury, including people who were at one point inpatients at Craig Hospital and those who were new from the community.  Our wait list is growing, and we need to expand the clinic space in order to serve more patients and increase our quality of care.  We need your help to do this!  

  • We need $50,000 to help expand the clinic, funding one of many individual treatment rooms!  We're hoping to raise at least $25,000 through online donations, although we know you're a generous bunch and will push us over the top!  
  • Your donation will be matched dollar-for-dollar by a generous anonymous donor, which means that we'll really be providing two rooms to outpatients at Craig Hospital!  
  • Check out our donation levels on the side!  You don't want to miss out, you generous supporter, you!
  • We're aiming high, but we know that we can get to $50,000 with your help.  Donate today, and encourage your pals to do the same by sharing this site.  Every dollar, regardless of whether we reach our goal, will go to helping outpatients at Craig through the clinic expansion.

The Impact

Your gift makes a difference for the 1,400+ people with spinal cord and brain injuries that access the Outpatient Clinic, their families and the Craig Hospital staff!

  • We've been creative with our space to be able to increase our therapy hours in the outpatient clinic by 5,838 hours in the last year and averaging 74 more patients per month over the last three years. Your donation will ensure that we have the proper space to be able to meet each patient's needs.
  • "Grateful" doesn't even begin to express how we feel about our community of Craig Hospital supporters--those who have made gifts year after year to empower our patients and the many who have recently joined the ranks.  When you hear a need, you jump, and for that, we can't thank you enough.  Your gift will not only make a tangible and visual impact on Craig Hospital, but it will go far in helping the 161 outpatients who enter our clinic weekly.

You've Met Ashlee, Meet Zack, another Craig Outpatient Clinic Client!

Zack came to Craig Hospital after sustaining a traumatic brain injury in 2014 in an automobile accident.  While his journey started as an inpatient, where he learned to walk, talk, and eat, Zack transitioned to Outpatient Clinic Services, coming to the clinic for therapy weekly.  So far, he has regained 20/20 vision through sight exercises, gained strength by working out at the PEAK Wellness Center, improved his sensory reactions, started to work toward getting his driver's license, and collaborated with the Community Reintegration at Craig to become job-ready.

According to Zack, "rehabilitation is not as much about me but about how much I love my family.  I have the ability, with hard work, to be independent, and I strive daily to get there.  I'm thankful to Craig Hospital for understanding me and motivating me to be my best self."

Zack and his brother, Tony, share more about Zack's work with the Outpatient Clinic!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • We need your help spreading the word!  Please share this website and your personal story about why you give (and why others should too!) with your networks.  We cannot do this without you!  Together, we can build a room in the outpatient clinic at Craig Hospital!

story:
Short Summary

Hi.  My name is Tesea Dawson, ex-member of Tuatha Dea, still active as a promoter/manager for the band and now currently an event coordinator.  I have toured and lived in the festival scene for the last five years.  During that time I have become extremely familiar with the ins and outs of these types of events.  Back in April of 2015 I coordinated BEF Full Moon & Spring Celebration.  A small and intimate outdoor festival with success, i'm currently involved with coordinating and production of several other small fundraisers and events and am now seeking to take on larger endeavors.  Something I have noticed at these events is that they are targeted to one specific audience.  Well, I'm all about the idea of coexisting.  We are all unique in our own way and most of us are just plain weird.  I think we should celebrate that.  As requested I've set a date for April 2016.  Tentatively April 1-3 at The Hotel Preston in Nashville, TN.  
Being that this is a first time event we need a boost to get it off the ground.  I wanna bring everyone together.  No matter your race, creed, religions, sex, age, sexual orientation or status, I want to create a place we can all come together for one weekend and embrace each others differences.
ODD Con... Original, Diverse, Different.  
Given the world's current state it is extremely important to show the world that we can coexist.  It's time to let go of the stigmas placed on us.  In keeping with that ideal... ODD Con is setting the stage for something larger... A future project called The Humanity Experiment.  A documentary about civil rights and the problems humanity faces today.  It is the hope that it will raise awareness and show the world we need to change.  A wake up call.  
As a contributor to this campaign you will make this idea a reality.  Starting a revolution in the hearts and minds so to speak!  Bringing us all together under one roof for two days of acceptance!  And how will we celebrate our differences?  How bout The Weirdo's Ball featuring internationally touring band Tuatha Dea!  Or show us your favorite game, comic or anime character in the Cosplay Contest!  Into the living dead?  Then get all gored up and enter the Zombie Pin-Up Beauty Pageant!  Wanna just shop?  Check out our insane variety at vendors row.  Music freak?  Stick around for all the live acts.  How bout the Artists Spotlight Gallery for local artists and craftsmen?  We should always show support for local art!  Don't forget about many workshops, presenters and fan Q&A Panels with your favorite band, author or community leaders!  So much is being put into this and with the idea in mind of bringing everyone together!  Lastly, your contribution will go toward bringing awareness to the The Humanity Experiment and hopefully gain support and sponsorship for the project.

What We Need & What You Get

Truth is it's impossible to know the exact amount we will need.  But we want to be able to bring the best to you.  In order to do that we have to secure the location of the venue and take care of our performers and guests who are there to share their time with all of us.  The money you donate will help pay the travel expenses, boarding, feeding and make sure they don't walk away empty handed.  After all they're all artists too and this is how they make their living.  They are giving us a gift of their talents, knowledge and time to be there.  This ensures we can do that.
But you won't give something for nothing... Perks will include everything from ODD Con swag to private meet and greets with your fav band, author or presenter, Autographed photos, free tarot readings and birth charts and at higher levels will also get your tickets and front row seating at concerts and panels!  Just check em all out!
If we don't happen to reach our goal all funds donated will still be put towards the event.  Basically, the more funding we get the bigger the event.  So if we don't reach our goal then the event will just be downsized.  Either way, ODD Con will happen.  If we are lucky enough to reach our goal... well... you never know what will happen!

Risks & Challenges

Being a new event we face many challenges.  One being that there is no funding to begin with.  No previous years income to put towards this years event.  No sponsor to help bring it to fruition.  So we need your help.  This event has the potential to be huge.  But there is always the possibility of failure.  But in order to succeed you must be willing to fail.  So here we are.  Asking... no begging for you to help make this a success.  This dream can be a reality.  

So Many Tiers!

Some of the items you can get need some explaining.  The Poster, t-shirt and bracelet are limited edition ODD Con items that are only available to contributors!  No one else will have these!!  Two meet and greets will be scheduled for both Tuatha Dea and Alex Bledsoe.  This is your time to just hang out and get to know how cool these people are or grab a moment to talk about booking them for your venue ;).  you can get a 1 hour photo shoot done whenever you want schedule with dark9 photo by Allison Wallace.  Autograph photos of Tuatha Dea, Autographed copies of Alex's books, even a Tuckerization in his next novel!  Bands like beer... well most of em... how bout access to the off limits hospitality area to sit down and grab a cold one and just be one of them.  Check em out behind the scenes!  You can get all access VIP action that includes reserved front row seating at panels, concerts and most events.  These tiers even include admission price for 2-4 people and can even include your hotel room!  You can even be one of our judges at the Zombie Pin Up Beauty Pageant!  There are so many perks!  and who knows we may even add more!!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute or you don't please help us get the word out.  Share this link.  Tell your friends, family, co-workers.  And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi.  My name is Tesea Dawson, ex-member of Tuatha Dea, still active as a promoter/manager for the band and now currently an event coordinator.  I have toured and lived in the festival scene for the last five years.  During that time I have become extremely familiar with the ins and outs of these types of events.  Back in April of 2015 I coordinated BEF Full Moon & Spring Celebration.  A small and intimate outdoor festival with success, i'm currently involved with coordinating and production of several other small fundraisers and events and am now seeking to take on larger endeavors.  Something I have noticed at these events is that they are targeted to one specific audience.  Well, I'm all about the idea of coexisting.  We are all unique in our own way and most of us are just plain weird.  I think we should celebrate that.  As requested I've set a date for April 2016.  Tentatively April 1-3 at The Hotel Preston in Nashville, TN.  
Being that this is a first time event we need a boost to get it off the ground.  I wanna bring everyone together.  No matter your race, creed, religions, sex, age, sexual orientation or status, I want to create a place we can all come together for one weekend and embrace each others differences.
ODD Con... Original, Diverse, Different.  
Given the world's current state it is extremely important to show the world that we can coexist.  It's time to let go of the stigmas placed on us.  In keeping with that ideal... ODD Con is setting the stage for something larger... A future project called The Humanity Experiment.  A documentary about civil rights and the problems humanity faces today.  It is the hope that it will raise awareness and show the world we need to change.  A wake up call.  
As a contributor to this campaign you will make this idea a reality.  Starting a revolution in the hearts and minds so to speak!  Bringing us all together under one roof for two days of acceptance!  And how will we celebrate our differences?  How bout The Weirdo's Ball featuring internationally touring band Tuatha Dea!  Or show us your favorite game, comic or anime character in the Cosplay Contest!  Into the living dead?  Then get all gored up and enter the Zombie Pin-Up Beauty Pageant!  Wanna just shop?  Check out our insane variety at vendors row.  Music freak?  Stick around for all the live acts.  How bout the Artists Spotlight Gallery for local artists and craftsmen?  We should always show support for local art!  Don't forget about many workshops, presenters and fan Q&A Panels with your favorite band, author or community leaders!  So much is being put into this and with the idea in mind of bringing everyone together!  Lastly, your contribution will go toward bringing awareness to the The Humanity Experiment and hopefully gain support and sponsorship for the project.   What We Need & What You Get
Truth is it's impossible to know the exact amount we will need.  But we want to be able to bring the best to you.  In order to do that we have to secure the location of the venue and take care of our performers and guests who are there to share their time with all of us.  The money you donate will help pay the travel expenses, boarding, feeding and make sure they don't walk away empty handed.  After all they're all artists too and this is how they make their living.  They are giving us a gift of their talents, knowledge and time to be there.  This ensures we can do that.
But you won't give something for nothing... Perks will include everything from ODD Con swag to private meet and greets with your fav band, author or presenter, Autographed photos, free tarot readings and birth charts and at higher levels will also get your tickets and front row seating at concerts and panels!  Just check em all out!
If we don't happen to reach our goal all funds donated will still be put towards the event.  Basically, the more funding we get the bigger the event.  So if we don't reach our goal then the event will just be downsized.  Either way, ODD Con will happen.  If we are lucky enough to reach our goal... well... you never know what will happen!

    Risks & Challenges Being a new event we face many challenges.  One being that there is no funding to begin with.  No previous years income to put towards this years event.  No sponsor to help bring it to fruition.  So we need your help.  This event has the potential to be huge.  But there is always the possibility of failure.  But in order to succeed you must be willing to fail.  So here we are.  Asking... no begging for you to help make this a success.  This dream can be a reality.  

So Many Tiers!Some of the items you can get need some explaining.  The Poster, t-shirt and bracelet are limited edition ODD Con items that are only available to contributors!  No one else will have these!!  Two meet and greets will be scheduled for both Tuatha Dea and Alex Bledsoe.  This is your time to just hang out and get to know how cool these people are or grab a moment to talk about booking them for your venue ;).  you can get a 1 hour photo shoot done whenever you want schedule with dark9 photo by Allison Wallace.  Autograph photos of Tuatha Dea, Autographed copies of Alex's books, even a Tuckerization in his next novel!  Bands like beer... well most of em... how bout access to the off limits hospitality area to sit down and grab a cold one and just be one of them.  Check em out behind the scenes!  You can get all access VIP action that includes reserved front row seating at panels, concerts and most events.  These tiers even include admission price for 2-4 people and can even include your hotel room!  You can even be one of our judges at the Zombie Pin Up Beauty Pageant!  There are so many perks!  and who knows we may even add more!!  
    Other Ways You Can Help Whether you contribute or you don't please help us get the word out.  Share this link.  Tell your friends, family, co-workers.  And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Your Mobile Number is the Key!

UBCard is giving a New Meaning to the Mobile Number; it's your Business Card!

There are over 27 million business cards which are printed daily, that’s 10 billion yearly - and these numbers go for the US alone. 

Around 88% of all business cards gets thrown into the garbage a week after they have been handed out. 

Almost 1000 trees are cut on a daily basis just to make business cards. 


The Simplicity of UBCard!

UBCard is an innovative digital Business Card management platform that uses Mobile Number as the Key; it is a “Set it and forget it” type of application with the following benefits:

UBCard is managed and controlled by your’ mobile number.

To exchange business cards, all you have to do is exchange mobile numbers or your short code and UBCard will exchanges business cards automatically, based on your mobile address book.


When you update your business card, all your contacts receive the updates automatically.


You can simply exchange your business card with all social media and SMS


Support UBCard for and get an early bird download and a free premium for a year.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please support this UBCard financially and in spreading the word.

story:
I have raised four kids and one nephew with almost no child support and on a bartender's pay. We are considered poor but live rich in our hearts.

My oldest is Jr. at U of O on a academic scholarship and my son is a Master at Arms in the Navy. I have a sophomore in high school earning 4.0, playing football, basketball, enrolled in student counsel, and working 25 hours a week washing dishes and babysitting my rambunctious 4 year old.

We are diamonds in the rough fighting poverty through education and hard work.

I bought a run down food cart 4 years ago and have been trickling cash into it ever since. I started Irie Shave & Crave LLC, a mobile shave ice/ decadent dessert food trailer specializing in the event market, to help make ends meet.

I am ready to open in a week but my funds are exhausted. We are I pray for any financial help to help secure events in the near future so my business can stay afloat.

Irie is a green company and we also would love some help to add solar panels for energy independence and a small A/C unit for safety. (It get's HOT in there!)

I am a fantastic, proud mother. I have worked my fingers to the bone to provide for my family, though it was not always enough.

Irie Shave & Crave LLC. is how I plan to rise above poverty and better support my amazing family. I never want another shut off notice, or for my kids to go without the basics, again. Thank you and God bless!

story:
Quick Pitch

WizPay through detailed technological innovation and consumer behavior studies has developed a platform, which helps businesses combine the better of two worlds - Technology and Print Ad's. Our platform enhances an existing print ad with a unique and customized WizPay QR code.

Our journey began a year ago and we have completed the development of the IOS mobile application and have managed to create a sound web presence. The website (www.wizpaystore.com) and the IOS WizPay Application is fully functional. We now intend to raise funds to reach out to our desired audience and let WizPay boost their businesses. 


Product/Service Details

WizPay is first of its kind marketing/retailing solution which allows retailers to merge the advantages of Print Ad's with the reachability of technology. The entire workflow and product information can be explained with help of the image below:



How We're Different

WizPay through its founder's eyes has always looked a few steps ahead of its counterparts. Max realized quickly the changing pattern in the marketing industry and came up with this unique solution of combining the well-targeted print advertisements with QR Code technology. This multiplies the reachability of a business multiple folds.
A proof of this would be the fact that big shot e-commerce companies are shutting down websites and relying on smartphone apps for sales. We at WizPay from day one restricted the product sales from our IOS smartphone application. Research shows that the market is tending towards app development and there are huge requirements.

What We Need & What You Get

An investment in WizPay will allow us to progress further as an entity, first through the development of an Android and Windows application as well as a refinement of our web presence and marketing strategy. We also wish to build a sound operational framework, which can sustain growth and possess the liquidity we need, to pursue future strategic alliances.

WizPay will also benefit your business in many ways: reach out to a more global audience, from Print Ads to marketing emails, or social media...our QR codes and mobile app will allow your business to sell your products further out the doors of your store. Besides that, the 5-year and 10-year membership perks, will enable you to advertise your business for free on the WizPay app, therefore opening your doors to the world. WizPay: Let the World be yours!

Problem/Opportunity

We belong to a marketing era, which is quite uniquely characterized. There has been an obvious and important technological paradigm shift, one, which has given rise to a variety of different marketing portals. Businesses can now use a SEO, websites, blogs and mobile applications to place their ads in hopes of increasing their web presence.

As marketing alternatives increase, WizPay’s founder Maximilien Lejeune felt very
seriously that more consideration should be given towards tools that help translate
marketing dollars into actual sales.This conversion rate has typically been neglected by many businesses and has proven to be costly and detrimental. We believe that marketing dollars spent should yield the maximum number of sales.

Furthermore, with the emergence of new technology comes a pull away from
conventional advertisement such as print. However, print ads are fairly targeted and efficient in their approach. They tend to segment the advertisements based on the demographic that can relate to the brand of product the most. Print ads are still an important form of marketing.

Solution 

WizPay through detailed technological innovation and consumer behavior studies has developed a platform, which helps businesses combine the better of two worlds.Our platform enhances an existing print ad with a unique and customized
WizPay QR code.

Customers can now simply scan the QR codes related to the products they notice on various ads, access the WizPay store, order the item and have their items shipped to them. Customers pay using their PayPal account; the merchant is notified of this sale and processes the delivery of these items as per their operations. We feel that marketing efforts should be result oriented and WizPay helps businesses truly reach out, connect, engage with their clients in hopes of improving the overall sales process.

Traction & Accomplishments

WizPay had an eventful  one-year journey and achieved some significant milestones. These include:

  • Completed the development of the first version of WizPay website and app. Moreover, we have filed a patent for the revolutionary concept of WizPay. The patent is under processing at the moment. Patent Application Number:-14711121
  • We have also successfully created a sound web presence across different platforms including blogger, facebook, Pinterest.
  • We hired industry experts to conduct market research for WizPay, and the results have surpassed our predictions and expectations. The details of the research are attached in the business plan.

We have also successfully created a sound web presence across different platforms including blogger, facebook, Pinterest.
We hired industry experts to conduct market research for WizPay, and the results have surpassed our predictions and expectations. The details of the research are attached in the business plan.

story:
It all started in the fall of 2009 with the idea of having youth cycle from Maine to Florida. Out of that idea, Spoke’n Revolutions Youth Cycling was born, introducing youth to cross country cycling, history and service. From their first cross country tour traveling the Underground Railroad from Mobile, AL to Buffalo, NY to linking M.L. King Historic Site in Atlanta to King Memorial in DC they continue to have astonishing transformation. 

And that’s why on this upcoming July 11th, twelve Spoke’n Revolutions' youth will saddle up to ride 550 miles over a 2-week period as they take the East Coast Greenway through the Gullah Geechee Cultural Heritage Corridor. Designated by Congress in 2006, the Gullah Geechee Cultural Heritage Corridor extends from Wilmington, North Carolina in the north to Jacksonville, Florida in the south. People who identify as Gullah or Geechee represent the many ways that Africans in the Americas have held on to and amalgamated the traditions of Africa with the cultures they encountered both during and after enslavement.

During the daily treks, the team will cycle 40 – 70 miles per day and visit colleges, National Parks and Park Service sites and Gullah Geechee cultural landmarks such as the Penn Center in S.C., a historic educational institution, and the Armstrong community in Florida, a hamlet that has developed a reputation for hosting cycling events.

You see, at Triangle Bikeworks (TBW) we have this wild belief that all youth should have the opportunity to develop physically, socially, and academically to their potential, regardless of their background, resources, or socioeconomic standing. Our mission has always been to use the bicycle as an entry point to engage youth in extraordinary ways. Adding outdoor activities, programs and events that give youth opportunities to learn about themselves and their country they understand that they have the ability to do whatever they set their minds to. 

During these trips the kids make transformations -- from taking pride in their physical accomplishments and making better nutritional choices to a boost of confidence from learning the seldom taught history of the role of Colored troops in the Civil War. During one tour they stood on the very spot at Brices Crossroads where Negro soldiers successfully defended Union troops as they escaped the onslaught of an overwhelming Confederate army led by Major General Nathan Bedford Forrest. They were shown the rise on the horizon that the Federal Army saw as they crested the hills. They were shown the foxholes where the Negro soldiers lay and defended their retreating army.

We want to continue this tradition of learning, empowerment and youth development. To do this, we need your help.

How can you help?

Feeding, housing, equipping, maintaining and transporting our group will cost $10,000 for the two weeks. All proceeds from this campaign (net of IndieGoGo expenses) will go to funding our summer trip. If we are unable to reach our goal we will use the funds to continue the work of getting youth on bikes, active and outdoors

What's in it for you?

In addition to the knowledge that you have made a direct and distinct difference in the lives of a dozen kids, if you donate $100 or more, we will send you an 8" x 10" full-color, framed photograph, signed by each participant in our summer tour as a symbol of our gratitude for your belief in them and their tremendous accomplishment.

Risks & Challenges

The youth are scheduled to depart the morning of July 11 with their cycling friends for Atlanta (the BRAG Dream Team). That’s not a great deal of time but we’ve been able to overcome similar hurdles and more since 2010. That’s why we would like you to act quickly and contribute now before you forget. That would put the wind at our backs and make the ride so much easier.

Can't make a donation right now? You can still help.

Help us get the word out, and use the IndieGoGo tools to make some noize about our campaign, using your social media and email. Help us build excitement, support and funding for the youth of Triangle BikeWorks!

story:
Protect Chaplain Wes’ Religious Rights So He Can Minister to Military Members

U.S. Navy Chaplain Wes Modder has always had a heart for people . . . and a love for America. After 19 years, this beloved and decorated chaplain could lose his career..

In late 2014, a few sailors sought out Chaplain Wes and asked him about his beliefs on faith, family, and sexual conduct. They refused to tolerate Chaplain Wes’ respectful but honest answers—answers based on his traditional biblical views.

So they complained. And a “politically correct” commander relieved Chaplain Wes of his duties and is pushing hard to get him kicked out of the Navy for good!

CHAPLAIN WES MODDER UNDER ATTACK!

Watch Chaplain Wes Modder and his wife Beth share about their painful and discriminatory experience.

If Chaplain Wes is not exonerated by a U.S. Navy legal investigation, he will lose everything. Including . . .

  •  His decorated 19-year career in the U.S. military 
  • The life-changing ministry to service members he greatly loves 
  • His pension . . . which places his ability to provide for his wife and four young children at great risk

Chaplain Wes needs expert legal help to fight for his rights. And sailors need their chaplain back to help them cope with the stresses of defending our country.

Liberty Institute—the nation’s largest non-profit legal firm dedicated solely to defending and restoring our religious liberty—is representing Chaplain Wes at no charge. For every $10,000 we spend on a case, our clients receive $60,000 in pro bono (free) legal time, which is donated by our national network of volunteer litigators.

But we can’t do it alone.

Your donation to Liberty Institute today will help pay for pro bono (free) legal time and help defend the rights of chaplains like Chaplain Wes. Because what happens to Chaplain Wes will set precedent for all military chaplains—and even the religious liberty rights of our service men and women!

So please click on the CONTRIBUTE NOW button to share your donation* today, and thanks for helping protect the religious liberty rights of our military chaplains, who want to offer spiritual care to our nation’s service members!


*Should Chaplain Modder’s case be resolved prior to the application of funds donated, Liberty Institute will apply any remaining funds toward the next pressing legal matter or case on our legal docket.


Thank you for your donation to fund the MILTARY CHAPLAINS’ RELIGIOUS RIGHTS Project to protect religious liberty for chaplains like Chaplain Wes Modder in our nation’s military! To learn more about Liberty Institute’s work to defend and restore religious liberty across our nation through our current cases—and how you can help win the battle for religious freedom in America today—please visit www.LibertyInstitute.org for more information and to read our disclosure statement.
