Liberty Institute—the nation’s largest non-profit legal firm dedicated solely to defending and restoring our religious liberty—is representing Chaplain Wes at no charge. For every $10,000 we spend on a case, our clients receive $60,000 in pro bono (free) legal time, which is donated by our national network of volunteer litigators.
But we can’t do it alone.


Your donation to Liberty Institute today will help pay for
pro bono (free) legal time and help defend the rights of chaplains like Chaplain
Wes. Because what happens to Chaplain Wes will set precedent for all military chaplains—and even the religious
liberty rights of our service men and women!
So please click on
the CONTRIBUTE NOW button to share your donation* today, and
thanks for helping protect the religious liberty rights of our military chaplains,
who want to offer spiritual care to our nation’s service members!


*Should Chaplain Modder’s case be resolved prior to the application of funds donated, Liberty Institute will apply any remaining funds toward the next pressing legal matter or case on our legal docket.

Thank you for your
donation to fund the MILTARY CHAPLAINS’ RELIGIOUS RIGHTS Project to protect
religious liberty for chaplains like Chaplain Wes Modder in our nation’s military!
To learn more about Liberty Institute’s work to defend and restore religious
liberty across our nation through our current cases—and how you can help win
the battle for religious freedom in America today—please visit www.LibertyInstitute.org for more information and to read our disclosure statement.

story:
Users will visit the site or the mobile app and see content that includes short videos with a social message, information about charitable organizations and businesses, or other positive, uplifting news from around the world.

By simply visiting and viewing the content, the users will be supporting these organizations through advertising revenue collected and donated.

                            

                    

We’re a team with a plan: to make the world a better place.  We work outside the realm of politics and nationalities in order to create change on a human level, but we realized we can’t do it on our own. 

So we’ve created the “Philanthropy Network Service,” a platform that will include a web service and mobile application, available for everyone on any device, from simply those who want to help to the heads of charitable organizations and businesses pushing social change, aid and philanthropy. 

As more people join our project and use our platform, sharing their successes and their stories, the desire to help and lend a hand will spread, and together we will be able to realize an international society of likeminded people.



Culture of philanthropy will be created using positive and life-affirming social videos:

- good cauntionary movie

- presentations of charities

- projects and campaigns video reports

- announcements of world’s good news and  events

                                        


                    

 

                         

                        

                         


We believe that in order to develop a culture of philanthropy across the world, we need to change the collective mentality of doom and gloom that hangs over so many.  By creating one platform to bring together those with a heart to help with the organizations and businesses that promote and back positive social movements and charitable projects, we are creating a community of people who are ready to make change.

                                       

For many, charity carries a certain stigma or level of doubt.  You worry about where your money is going, you question the motives of those you’re helping, and in the end decide it’s better to keep your time and money to yourself than to put it in the wrong hands.  In many cases, people simply aren’t aware of the real work these organizations and movements do, or even that they exist!  Our service will work to inform.

The goal of our project is to create a society of people who support each other in philanthropic aims. 

                                    You see someone help, you want to help. 

                                    You catch the charity bug, and it spreads.

                               

                                  

Users will be able to help not only through donations and deed, but also by simply using the platform.
                      Our platform will operate under the idea of “2 minutes to help.”  
 In countries across the world, people spend an average of over 300 minutes in front of a screen daily.  If everyone put just two of these minutes to charitable use, it would have the potential to bring about real positive change.

                                                                         *  Mary Meeker’s 2014 internet trends report

                        

Research shows that it takes 66 days to form a habit.  To make a habit out of charity, our application will include a reminder feature, which the users can set to any time that is convenient for them!  Standing in line for coffee, riding the bus, waiting for your food, you can make a difference anywhere and everywhere!

                        

Users will visit the site or the mobile app and see content that includes short videos with a social message, information about charitable organizations and businesses, or other positive, uplifting news from around the world.

By simply visiting and viewing the content, the users will be supporting these organizations through advertising revenue collected and donated.

                           


                              

With social network sharing features included, the Philanthropy Network Service makes it easy to tell your friends about the good work you’re doing.  We also hope that, with the help of our service, charity can become a habit, an important and necessary part of everyday life.

                            

                                          

 Fostering a habit starts at home, so share it with your family, where every generation can work together to support and spread a growing culture of charity and philanthropy.

                             

                                        

The users decides what to support.  As money is collected, they can choose to what areas of charity they want to send their contributions. 

                           


                                         

All are also welcome to quickly, conveniently, and safely contribute to any projects that they would like to personally support. 

                             


                           

Organizations will be able to announce events, which users will see and can choose to attend or volunteer.  Businesses will be able to advertise their own events as well; a restaurant owner can spread the word about a special night where proceeds go to charitable projects.

                          


                                 

                                * The supervisory board is intended to provide a monitoring role.

A Supervisory Board of invited philanthropists and contributors will help to decide and plan the areas of charity we will work with.

                              

                       


                      

"Social responsibility is an ethical framework which suggests that an entity, be it an organization or individual, has an obligation to act for the benefit of society at large."

                                                

Social responsibility is a duty every individual has to perform so as to maintain a balance among the economy, society and the ecosystems.

 A trade-off may exist between economic development, in the material sense, and the welfare of the society and environment.

Social responsibility means sustaining the equilibrium between the two.

This responsibility can be passive, by avoiding engaging in socially harmful acts, or active, by performing activities that directly advance social goals.

                        


                                 


     

                    

                     

                       

                     


                             

The development of a fully-functional application and all of the factors that go into making it work (testing, running servers, technical support), in addition to the building of a platform of advertisements which will serve as one of the main sources of donation collection, requires a large set of funds. In order to create a worldwide culture of philanthropy, we need to spread the word.  The larger our user base, the more we will be able to help. As the project expands and we develop a complete team, engaging locally in countries around the world, we’re going to need even more support.  This is a project on a global scale, and we need help to make it happen.      



In order to make our project a reality and bring you a simple to use and easy to understand platform, we need to develop a complex set of connections between users, providing them with the information they need regarding local and international charitable opportunities, and to implement a safe and secure method through which users will be able to support projects.



The kind of worldwide change that a platform such as “Philanthropy Network Service” can bring about is the dream of many, our team included, and we want to make this happen together with you.

                         

                                     

                  

                          

                                                     

                         


                            

You can support our project through its crowdfunding efforts here on INDIEGOGO, becoming a part of our team from the very beginning and making your mark on a world-changing project.  For those who contribute, we have a set of perks to sweeten the deal.
Beyond fundraising, we ask anyone who would like to support the project to simply spread the word! Get in touch with us on social media, share our project, tell your friends!

                                          

Our project is based on the idea of people helping people, so lend a hand, and together we can make this a reality!

story:
A while back I was in a tough position financially. I didn't want my son to struggle as well so I asked my parents to take care of him. I was heavily pressured to let them adopt my son, being put under Duress as the law calls it. After 10-15 reminders and added pressure each time I unfortunately gave in and signed away my rights. When signing I was under an emended amount of stress from my parents and my work life. The efforts used by my parents can be considered 'gas lighting techniques'.  I was basically brainwashed by my parents to give up my son to them as they made me feel like an unworthy and incapable parent.

I lived with my parents for 7 months and during that time the adoption process was underway. There were a few situations that took place where it was a misunderstanding, a simple arguments blown out of proportion or being blamed for something I wasn't doing. With these situations came threats of physical harm to me. Feeling threatened by my father I obtained an order of protection, and now, they are keeping my son from me. 

I'm looking for help in raising funds for attorney fees to fight for my son and have him where he belongs, with me. I have a couple of supporters, key players if you will who will be able to speak on my behalf to advise the courts my son is best with me, the only biological parent active in his everyday life.

The time away from my son has been hard and it has been long. I can't imagine what it is doing to my son, and how he feels right now not being able to see me. I want nothing more than to be able to hold him in my arms and tell him how much I love him.

Any help you are able to offer is appreciated. I need $3,000 for the full cost for the attorney and help in performing all duties to appeal the adoption that was finalized and get this reversed. Upon receiving the funds, if able to get him back, I will make a video with him as an update to thank you all for the support you have provided.

Thank you!!!

story:
On April 25, a massive7.8 magnitude earthquake shook and shattered Nepal, both in spirit and in fact. To date, the bulk of the response to this devastating earthquake is focused on providing emergency aid and relief to the most affected communities. The response to this tragedy has been overwhelming. However, the needs of Nepal will not fade as quickly as the headlines, and neither should efforts to help. We believe it is critical to begin addressing the need for long-term sustainable, earthquake-resistant housing for the families that have been left homeless. To date over 500,000 homes have been destroyed and another 300,000 are damaged. The most grievous impact has been to village communities - once picturesque, which have now turned into landscapes of suffering. In the near term, the monsoon season is due to start in June, and families will no longer be able to remain in emergency tents. In an effort to beat the monsoon, affected people are hastily rebuilding and support is needed to ensure they build back safer.

As many of you know, Satish and I have committed to building a life in Nepal. After three and a half years we've given birth to our daughter Zoya and have watched our son Manav be embraced and truly thrive in this lovely country. We feel blessed to call this our home. In addition, we are so grateful that our home is intact and all of our loved ones in this large Joshi family remain safe and sheltered. But several people in our lives, such as our driver Purna's village and our lovely Ramila Didi's village are devastated. As a result, it made most sense for us to focus on sustainable reconstruction for these village communities.

SO many of you have asked how you can help, well this is finally it! WE NEED YOUR HELP! We have collected an initial $10,000 that will provide transitional shelters to see families through the monsoon season. And you can help a family in need rebuild a safe, sustainable village home for as less as $1,500!

Our priority is to initiate an international fundraising campaign to rebuild 50-100 village homes using the most sustainable eco-friendly and earthquake-resistant methods available in Nepal with local materials and local labor. This will be performed in partnership with Nepal-based organizations with expertise in this type of construction such as:

Habitech Nepal

Grassroot Movement in Nepal 

Our goal is to demonstrate the feasibility and affordability of safe, sustainable and eco-friendly homes using local materials for reconstruction. Communities will be involved throughout the process so that we can utilize local knowledge and expertise, and train members from these villages in the reconstruction process. In addition, families will contribute a nominal percentage towards rebuilding their permanent homes to ensure responsibility and pride of ownership. Our hope is that these village projects will provide successful evidence so that larger international donors and the Government of Nepal will continue funding sustainable reconstruction and scale this up to other impacted communities.

We hope you join our effort to Rebuild Nepal!

story:
Amerexx Direct –  Our customer is King


Short Summary:

Every shopper deserves to be looked after when they enter a store.

The old adage “The customer is always right” still stands today and here at Amerexx Direct we have built an entire business on this principle.

You see - we believe that shoppers always come back when they are treated well, and when they are attended to and when their needs are met.

So we decided to launch this Crowdfunding campaign to start and develop our business and expand the model so we can begin to serve our customers well.


At Amerexx Direct our business is electronics.

We will sell every type of electronic device you can imagine, from everyday items through to those for special occasions. In fact we are so proud of our selection, that if you need something that we don’t have tell us and we will stock it and provide it at a great price.


We will run regular promotions offers and discounts, all within our online electronics retail superstore.

Part of service will include an exclusive ‘personal shopping’ function, that remembers your orders and makes predictive suggestions on your return; providing a fully rounded shopping experience.

We want to make sure that the customer is ‘King’ so we deliver all of the key benefits that a customer would expect.


What We Need & What You Get:

All we need is your help and support so that we can raise $10,000. This will allow  us to launch Amerexx Direct, and continue to develop our unique business model and deliver the best customer service of any retailer online.


When you support our crowdfunding campaign you will get:


  • We will give you the customer, access to our unique distribution network that ensures the customer gets the right product for the right price


  • The way we work ensures that the middlemen are all eliminated so that we can provide the best deals at all times.


  • All of our products are offered to you straight from the whole seller or the distributor so we can bring you discounts and special offers on a regular basis.


  • We will maintain a healthy inventory at all times which helps you to get the product or item that you need on time and packaged to your requirements.


  • Our online shopping experience will be designed uniquely in a way to enhance your item selection requirements and make certain that you can search for and get what you want.


  • If there is an electronic product you are confused about or can’t decide whether to buy it or not – No problem! We are there to support you on that as well, simply visit the added information we offer on our website regarding that product or just browse through the many customer reviews we offer on our website which give you feedbacks directly from our users and customers


At Amerexx Direct, our mission is to bring about innovation with excellence in Internet shopping and bring a world of electronic products to our clients – right to their doorstep. Our sellers and buyers are positioned across the globe therefore allowing us to source the products you need and deliver them to you promptly and at a price you will like.


The Impact:

By supporting this campaign and helping us to deliver our unique business model you will be supporting the latest innovation in online shopping and customer service.

Many online retailers seem to have forgotten how to serve customers well. We want to be known for our attention to detail, making all of our customers feel appreciated and giving you the best discounts and offers available.

The ecosystem we create will benefit everyone including all of the stakeholders involved in our business.

We believe in making the online shopping experience one if convenience, precision, and personalized service.

We will continue to work hard to provide variety, the latest electronic devices, equipment and products and provide great offers and discounts at every given opportunity.

Our focal point is our customer and we will do what is necessary to make you happy in every sense of the word!We are more than happy to answer any questions or queries that you may have and are here to serve you and fulfill any and all requirements that you may have, so get in touch with us today.


Risks & Challenges:

In every business there are common risks and challenges such as customer acquisition, customer retention, market competition, social reach and operational functionality.

As a team we have considered all of these aspects very carefully and put preventative along with reactive measures in place.


Customer Acquisition and Retention

At Amerexx Direct, we have a team of experienced professionals, who know and understand the online retail world extremely well, so are prepared for the level of work it takes to acquire new customers, and then keep them coming back to us. We recognize there is a fine balance between customer engagement and harassment and so we will use our intuitive systems and processes to work very smart with customers.


Market Competition:

We understand that the online retail space is saturated, however our research tells us that there are key differentiators which will help us to stand out and be set apart in the customers mind.

Following extensive research and insight into the online retail market place, we found that a large percentage of failing online retailers, do so because they do not have the correct mix within their business model. We have analysed this and come up with a great solution. Nothing or no company is perfect, but we are pretty close. We understand this to be a huge challenge, but we have an exhaustive strategy and so are confident about stepping into the market place.


Social Reach:


With an online business social reach is instrumental in making a difference between success and failure.

Due to our suppliers, sellers and representatives being positioned around the world, we automatically have localized promotion and marketing which adds a great deal of power to our social reach.

Understanding the local needs, language and cultural objectives gives us a huge advantage over many retailers, who do not take this into consideration prior to launch.


Operational Functionality:


Thanks to a highly experienced team, who have worked in the online retail space for many years, we are aware of all of the factors that can present a problem in delivery, shipping, and stocking our business.

We have secured regional contacts around the world to ensure the lowest delivery costs and storage, along with delivery partners.

We also will use industry standard automated back office systems that will allow us to manage and operate effectively online, keeping our customers happy.


Other Ways you can help:


  • We know that not everyone can donate, however we are truly grateful to everyone of you that shares our campaign URL and our customer service message via your social media outlets.

  • Please tell everyone you know about Amerexx Direct and the great offers, discounts and variety of electronic goods we can provide.


  • Remember to check out Amerexx Direct in the future when you are thinking of purchasing an electronic device.


Follow us on social media for regular updates and to see how we’re getting on.  


Our social media accounts will be:

( But not limited to;)

Facebook, Google+, YouTube,  and, Twitter.


Remember to get in touch and tell us your thoughts on our campaign and let us know about any electronic devices, or products you are struggling to find  online. Our email is amerexxdirect@gmail.com.


Thanks for reading our campaign,

& welcome to Amerexx Direct. We hope you will have an enjoyable experience and we look forward to providing you with the best customer service available online.

story:
Hello, we are Best-Stylist, a company created to make an easy connection between professionals, customers, and beauty industry companies.  We seek to be the single source for all your hair and beauty needs.  Whether you’re a customer, a beauty professional or an industry company, our website is just for you!

Our Story

What is Best-Stylist.com? 

Best-Stylist.com is a members based website and mobile app for the hair and beauty industry. It’s a place to showcase the talent and creativity of individual barbers and hairstylists and put them in the driver’s seat of their career.  We utilize an advanced framework that allows beauty professionals and companies to easily update and maintain a profile, where they can upload videos and photos of their actual work. The site will also provide updates on industry news and new products.

I’m Not A Beauty Professional, Is This Site For Me?

Yes, it definitely is. For starters, Best-Stylist.com is totally free to the public. You will be able to view professional profiles and see photos, videos, customer reviews and more. This will give you more information to make the best choice for all your beauty needs.

Best-Stylist Needs Your Support!

We strive to create a uniquely interactive experience by providing more real-time communication through the use of podcasts, webinars, video tutorials and more. We have invested our own time and money into the creation of this new company and need your help to take Best-Stylist.com to the next level.

Funding generated through this campaign with be used as follows:

1. Equipment Acquisition & Maintenance (33% of Funding Request) - It is important to us to provide our audience with the best available graphics and functionality. In order to do so we will purchase the latest design and editing software.

2. Upgrades & Enhancements (27% of funding request) - We strive to provide an excellent site with the most up-to-date interactive opportunities. To facilitate this process we have contracted with K & J Designs. This amount will cover a portion of that agreement.

3. Content Development & Promotion (17% of the funding request) - We wish to provide a variety of content for our readers to view and learn. This amount will supplement some of the cost of creating engaging material and boosting awareness.

4. Patents & Other Protections (13% of funding request) - This is to cover the cost, and associated fees, for preliminary research into Patents, Trademarks and other legal protections.

5. Infrastructure Retention (10% of funding request) - This will provide assistance with fixed costs associated with the website.

Looking To The Future

We aspire to be the single source for all your beauty needs. You won’t have to shop around to find the right products, or rely solely on word of mouth to find the best professionals. We place the power of choice right at your fingertips.

We seek to unlock the potential of beauty professionals, by giving them the freedom to manager their own career, while taking control of their personal marketing and promotions. We provide the tools for professionals to showcase their artistry, skill, and industry knowledge as a living resume. Ultimately their footprint in the industry will be based on their level of engagement on our site.

Stretch Goals

Best-Stylist is committed to helping others achieve positive growth in the hair & beauty industry. We will always look for ways to encourage others. If we are able to raise funding, beyond our initial request, then we will be able to initiate our scholarship & career advancement program.

Scholarship Program – Each year we will provide a scholarship(s) to a select student(s) enrolled in one of our affiliate schools.

Career Advancement Program – Once a year, customers, professionals and companies can suggest an individual in the industry to be eligible for our Career Advancement Award. We will select one individual to receive this monetary benefit to assist with the furtherance of their career.    

____________________________________________________________________________

This Indiegogo campaign was organized and created with the assistance of UCommunicate  http://ucommunicate.org/

story:
About Me (is about you)

Thank you for checking out Impact Social Impact. You can be sure that I'll do everything to make every part of this worth your investment.

For my full background, please check out my LinkedIn profile.

This "About Me" section is really about you.

Making the greatest possible difference to as many people and places in the world became my passion when I was still in elementary school. As I grew up and started my career, I struggled to find the one job, organization, or place where I could do my best work to make the world better.

While working at Habitat for Humanity a few years ago, it dawned on me: The way to make the greatest possible difference in the world is not about what I do for a job or where I work. It's about helping those around me make the difference they want to make.

My personal mission became to educate, equip and empower people to work together to bring to life the promise in the world around them.

In 2013, I left my development job at Habitat for Humanity to work full-time helping individuals and organizations do good better.

This year, the University of Pennsylvania selected me to join 34 other servant leaders from around the world to participate in an 8-month social impact strategy program. This Ivy League program teaches and trains leaders to educate, equip, and empower communities to transform themselves for the better. Sound familiar?

It is a very special honor and privilege to be selected for this program.

More important, I believe this program will greatly enhance my knowledge, skills, and wisdom for those trying to make a greater social impact in their communities.

This campaign truly is about you (and this guy).


What We Need & What You Get

The total cost of participating in the 8-month social impact strategy program is $7,500. Two thirds ($5,000) of that is tuition and the remainder is the cost of meals, room, and travel to and from Philadelphia for two 3-day workshops in June and December. Since the cohort of 35 students is coming from all over the world, most course instruction and interaction takes place online.

The perks are the best part.

For instant gratification, you'll enjoy some perks right along with me as I go through the social impact program. Some examples of the perks you'll enjoy:

  • Every donor will get an "Impact Point" in her or his email inbox each week. These will be fascinating lessons or observations I pick up during that week's course work.
  • Some donors will get invitations to private behind-the-scenes meetings and tours with some of the most forward-thinking social impact leaders and projects in Detroitland.
  • And there will be a big ice cream social, too!


The biggest perk is the one where the social impact training pays off for you. 

Upon completion of the social impact strategy program, I will commit 150 hours of pro bono service to a nonprofit or social impact project you will help choose.

That's not all. Professors and students from the Rochester College School of Business will join me. That's a lot of hands, hearts, and minds making an impact where you believe it needs to happen most.
  • Each donor gets to nominate one nonprofit or social impact idea
  • For every $50 a donor gives to the Impact Social Impact campaign, he or she receives one vote
  • At the end of the campaign, all donors will vote for the nonprofit or social impact project where the Rochester College School of Business and I will devote hundreds of hours in 2016.

That's a perk that keeps on perking!

Risks & Challenges

Even if the crowdfunding campaign falls short, I'm committing to this program--even if it means mowing lawns and washing cars to make it happen. It's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity that I'll regret if I let it slip away.


The biggest challenge besides money is time. As a husband and father and start-up social entrepreneur, time is tight. I'm making some big changes to how I manage time in 2015, starting with the admission that it's not limitless. This is hard for me because I've always wanted to believe that I can do everything. My wife is very good at reminding me of my limits. Now that I'm collaborating with business partners and enjoying the counsel of a business coach and mentors, my expectations and plans are more realistic. Eliminating distractions and pipe dreams from my schedule and listening to the wisdom of those around me is going to make this my best year ever for productivity. That includes the social impact program.

Finally, I'm accountable to you. In addition to the reports I send along the way, you can follow my always-transparent updates on Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and my website.

Any money I raise over the $7,500 fundraising goal will be donated to the nonprofit organization or social impact project that donors choose.

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm just like you. That is, organizations and people ask me for money almost every week. If I had a bottomless wallet, I'd give money to every one of them.

So I understand if this is not the right giving opportunity for you right now.

If you believe in what I'm doing and you want to contribute in other ways, would you please consider one of these options?

  • Book me to share my experience and training in social impact with an audience that you choose.
  • Contribute money another way: Ask your company, house of worship, nonprofit organization, or school to hire me to assess and develop its community engagement program. I offer one-on-one sessions as short at 20 minutes.
  • Share this campaign with your friends and network (use the convenient Indiegogo sharing tools).

A nevem Kovács Pál, dolgozom Egy benzinkútnál jelenleg, de Szeretném, HOGY a Saját főnöke, megvettem AZ ELSŐ kávéautomatákat Egy hónappal ezelőtt, ÉS betette Egy barátja Autómosó ... Imádják, imádom AZ ÖTLET van, Így Itt vagyunk ..

EZ elvitt Újabb 2 Èvre, a hogy mentse Fel Egy másikat, Így, a hogy gyorsítsák Fel a folyamatot szeretnék kérni a segítséget Egy csésze kávét Virtuális that Tolt el ITT, ÉS élvezhetik, amikor Csák Szeretne látogasson el hozzánk ... Így technikailag Csak Előre megvásárolja Egy csésze árusító tökéletesség :)

Lehet MinDig Jönnek ide, ÉS töltse meg a gépen ... de Nem Lesz egy ...

Nem Egy a legjobb kávé automatából Lehet, Frissen őrölt, soha Nem Marad sokáig ... EGY JÓ pohár.

Minden PÉNZT kapott megy EZ cel Csak, ha én dont, Éri meg ITT, HOGY Lesz Közelebb, nagyra értékelik, ÉS AZT fogja állítani, a többit it..in időt.

Tehát ITT, Egy csésze kávét.

story:
Project Details: What do I do?

My name is Ria Rana and I am currently in my third year at the University of Alberta, pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Neuroscience. I am part of a team of student volunteers going to rural Tanzania during summer of 2015 for 11 weeks to promote health awareness and implement health-related projects in the villages of Mlandizi, Kikongo and Mwanabwito. We will be representing the Students’ International Health Association (SIHA), a non-profit, student run volunteer organization that has been operating through the University of Alberta since 1989. 

Every summer, SIHA sends a multidisciplinary team of student volunteers to rural Tanzania for an eleven-week project in which they work alongside local community members to promote health. Current projects include a comprehensive safe water access program in the village of Kikongo, a partnership with a local HIV/AIDS education organization, an emergency transportation system, and a partnership with local health educators in the village of Mwanabwito as well as malaria prevention. Overall, SIHA aims to stimulate or enhance the community’s interest in their own health and development thereby supporting grassroots change that is effective and sustainable for local communities. 

For summer 2015, I am the lead on “Emergency Service Vehicle (ESV)” project in Kikongo, Kibaha district. This project began in 2012 with the goal of providing an ambulance-equivalent vehicle suitable to carry medical patients. Over the past three years, SIHA has successfully dealt with issues like insufficient physical structure, lack of awareness and poor management of the ESV. My tasks involve improving project communication between district and clinical officers of Kibaha; collecting and evaluating data on the vehicle’s success and failures; and developing a comprehensive action plan, in line with the district’s health policies, to overcome challenges regarding sustainability and effectiveness of the project. 

Money Matters: How Can You Help?

SIHA requires each individual team member to fundraise money so we can support our volunteer trip. Your donations:

  • Will go towards supporting living, lodging, and travel expenses (like vaccinations)
  • Will go towards projects that I am very passionate about: emergency service vehicle and subsidized bed net sales
  • PERKS for you: see the perks section on the right side of the page
  • You will also get a tax receipt for your donations, if you provide either your email or mailing address

The Impact: How Will Your Contribution Help?

To me, global citizenship is participating in and finding solutions to issues facing our society today. We are not passive victims of the future; we rather shape it. I would like to live in a future where all people, regardless of their residence, living conditions or culture, have equal and convenient access to human rights and health. 

Through your love, support and donations, many marginalized and under-advantaged communities have the opportunity to access education about good health and disease prevention. At the end of the day, it is really you who is behind their success and growth. 

My Challenges + Your Support = SUCCESS!

I believe that my volunteer work would be a two-way learning street, where I can help deliver education and awareness on topics like maternity health and disease prevention, and the local people can show me how their accessibility to health and education is different Canadian communities. However, as a student who financially supports herself both academically and otherwise, I sometimes find it out of my reach to be a part of a unique experience like this one. 

I hope that through your support and well-wishes, I can further my understanding of global citizenry, as well as experience first-hand the hardships and obstacles rural communities face while accessing education and good health. I hope that my experiences and knowledge in the sector of public health will help me expand my work locally, in Edmonton, and at the university level.

Spread the Word!

If you cannot contribute monetarily, that does not mean you cannot help!

If you like my cause and think that your friends, colleagues, families and frenemies might want to support it, please get the word out and SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!
story_txt:
Project Details: What do I do?

My name
is Ria Rana and I am currently in my third year at the University of
Alberta, pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Neuroscience. I am part of a team of
student volunteers going to rural Tanzania during summer of 2015 for 11 weeks to promote
health awareness and implement health-related projects in the villages of
Mlandizi, Kikongo and Mwanabwito. We will be representing the Students’
International Health Association (SIHA), a non-profit, student run volunteer
organization that has been operating through the University of Alberta since
1989. 

Every summer, SIHA sends a multidisciplinary team of
student volunteers to rural Tanzania for an eleven-week project in which they work
alongside local community members to promote health. Current projects
include a comprehensive safe water access program in the village of Kikongo, a
partnership with a local HIV/AIDS education organization, an emergency
transportation system, and a partnership with local health educators in the
village of Mwanabwito as well as malaria prevention. Overall, SIHA aims to
stimulate or enhance the community’s interest in their own health and
development thereby supporting grassroots change that is effective and
sustainable for local communities. 

For summer 2015, I am the lead on “Emergency
Service Vehicle (ESV)” project in Kikongo, Kibaha district. This project began in
2012 with the goal of providing an ambulance-equivalent vehicle suitable to
carry medical patients. Over the past three years, SIHA has successfully dealt
with issues like insufficient physical structure, lack of awareness and poor
management of the ESV. My tasks involve improving project communication between
district and clinical officers of Kibaha; collecting and evaluating data on the
vehicle’s success and failures; and developing a comprehensive action plan, in
line with the district’s health policies, to overcome challenges regarding
sustainability and effectiveness of the project. 

   Money Matters: How Can You Help? SIHA requires each individual team member to fundraise money so we can support our volunteer trip. Your donations:  Will go towards supporting living, lodging, and travel expenses (like vaccinations) Will go towards projects that I am very passionate about: emergency service vehicle and subsidized bed net sales

their accessibility to health and education is different Canadian communities. However, as a student who financially supports herself both academically and otherwise, I sometimes find it out of my reach to be a part of a unique experience like this one.

If you like my cause and think that your friends, colleagues, families and frenemies might want to support it, please get the word out and SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!

story:
Lithermans Limited Brewing Company is 6 BBL brewery located in Bow, New Hampshire. The goal is to hand-craft unique, artisan ales and lagers to be packaged and sold in NH, at both a tasting room at the brewery and in the finer restaurants and beer stores throughout the state. We started out making music and drinking homebrew and know we make musically inspired beers like our flagship "Simply Red Ale"  a 9% abv Imperial American Red Ale, Pacific-hop forward but never over-bitter. We will also be brewing a variety of other beers like our Belgian style Saison "Tangled up in Bruges" made with seasonally available ingredients, as is traditional in this style.  This one features Munich-roasted oats and our house Saison yeast blend.

By supporting Lithermans Limited, you will enable us to bring unique and uncommon beer styles to the New Hampshire craft beer community.  With over 19 years brewing experience, we have a very clear picture of the beers we want to brew. With 26 years of business-to-business sales, we know how to get it to market and in pint glasses around the state.  We brew bigger. We brew bolder. We even think we brew better. We want you to be a part of it!


Why are we doing this and what do you get in return?

Lithermans Limited Brewing Company is in the homestretch of development.  As we finalize our brew space, we are looking for assistance to help us complete the final stage in opening our brewery. Your contribution will help us purchase a brite tank (for carbonating and finishing the beer), and help us finish the plumbing and electrical work, like adding sinks and additional electrical outlets in our brewery. We are raising $15,000 which will help us complete these two final pieces of our vision, and we can't wait to share our beer with you.

For your donations we have created some great perks - including being a brewer for a day, naming one of our musically inspired beers and hats, pint glasses and t-shirts.

Our Beers



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can help us spread the word about our campaign. Share the link on Facebook and let others know about Lithermans Limited Brewing Company.

Questions?Learn more about our operation, see pictures and updates at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Lithermans-Limit...

story:
Rozana Association for the Development of Architectural heritage is a Palestinian registered not for profit organization, based in Birzeit's old Town that aims to network, consolidate, develop and promote all available cultural, architectural and heritage resources in rural areas of the West Bank to instill a process of development based on advancing rural areas competitive advantage as a potential domestic and international tourist destinations with positive negative impact.

Our campaign intends to raise funds to conduct Birzeit 8th Heritage week that aims to advance Palestinian cultural heritage and identity. The heritage week has become an annual icon in Palestine’s summer cultural activities as it provides a sustainable model about the importance of historic areas in rural Palestine, which upon rehabilitation, can be employed for a sundry of cultural, income generation and job creation activities that foster new-fangled functions for the old houses, attics and architectural spaces. The heritage week promotes a unique diverse experience tailored to valorize the Palestinian national cultural identity and to disseminate concepts and ideas of development among rural communities

Every year the heritage week involves hundreds of young local men and women in the organization as well as in designing and implementation of its different activities, hence, ensuring gender equal opportunities for participation and subsequently accumulation of leadership skills indispensable to generate capacities in the fields of art, culture, economy and event organization.

The heritage week remains a platform that seeks to develop opportunities for exchange with world cultures, expanding, diversifying participation and completing the cultural mosaic. It creates a first-hand encounter with the local community breaking the isolation matrix of control of 47 years of Israeli occupation.

Needless to say, the heritage week has been instrumental in promoting local Palestinian music, theatre and art productions as it has given a priority for limelight.

With kind financial support of contributors, Rozana Association will be able to protect and promote the available and potential Palestinian cultural heritage and intercultural gender-aware dialogue locally, regionally, and internationally consolidating social cohesion within Palestine and cultural exchange with the rest of the world

Rozana Association is in need of 80’000 USD to conduct Birzeit 8th Heritage week. Funds will be used to establish the heritage week administrative team from young men and women mostly from Birzeit town and surrounding villages in cooperation with partner rural CBOs. The administrative committee will monitor and oversee the work of 10 specialized committees who will manage the daily needs of young volunteers (food and beverages), of exhibitions to be displayed, cultural/Folkloric and Artistic events to be conducted, infrastructure and minor rehabilitation works to install the booths, the theaters…etc., the media and promotional materials needed as well as the Souq exhibitions and cinema corner needs. All the expenses will be managed by the Book keeping/finance committee who ensures transparent financial processes and reporting.

The best way to understand a culture is to see its art so you can understand it far better than a language you cannot speak. Imagine how Birzeit Heritage Week will provide a first-hand encounter with an actual Palestinian traditional Wedding and Zaffa that will roam through the Souq full of cultural and handcrafts booths not only of Palestinian culture but also of other nations who come to exhibit their own cultural heritage and goods.

During Birzeit heritage week, every visitor will be able to meet and mingle among Palestinian families and international expat communities who are distributed along several cultural corners watching live how pottery or glass is being made, how carpets are being knit, or to watch a Palestinian dabkeh or music show, or a cultural film at the cinema corner.

Birzeit heritage week is a place for every member of the family, no matter what is his/her age, to find something to enjoy in the midst of a Town that become glowing with cultural activities.

Crafts people at some corners, food making at other corners, children cultural activities at another and cultural booths and arts exhibitions extending along the different allies and spaces of the historic area of Birzeit town.

Attending the Countryside Flower competition is another icon of the Heritage Week, where every Palestinian village sends its young women representatives, dressed in their village traditional dress, to compete on best knowledge of Palestinian culture including traditional music, dance, crafts…etc.

Five summers nights in the beautiful outskirt of rural West Bank (north of Ramallah and Bireh cities) will give a memorable tourist interaction for each of the 40’000 visitors that reach Birzeit heritage week annually.

In case Birzeit Heritage 8th Week does not receive the complete funds needed to conduct it, available funds will be used to build capacities of rural women and youth in 2 rural villages in the West Bank including tourist hospitality skills of 25 women with at least 15 homestays both theoretically and practically, train 25 youth as community guides armed with Community Based Tourism principles and interpretation methods to build community touristic programs and extend network for alternative tourism between the two municipalities/local village councils along Masar Ibrahim and Sufi Trails as explored by Rozana Association

Birzeit Heritage Week devises its uniqueness from a variety of elements. First it employs the rehabilitated old houses and attics in the historic area of Birzeit as a platform for the cultural and cultural heritage activities adding a special ambience that is intertwined with the flagged stones of the Mamluk and Ottoman era houses and attics. This exposes the efforts of protecting the architectural heritage. Secondly, it offers an unmatched diversity of cultural life compacted in one event. Thirdly, it connects and encourages cultural exchange with the international community through the international “Hosh” providing the space for keen countries to commission exchange with the Palestinian local community. Fourth, it promotes the Palestinian cultural identity, creating awareness both locally and internationally. The peak ventures are the role and involvement of the local communities that are considered a key factor in the development process as well as the international exhibitions to strengthen partnerships within the region and worldwide.

The participation of youth, women and the community at large will increase public awareness about the cultural, environmental, historical process, and the potential values and benefits it may produce to galvanize and encourage local production through enhancing traditional customs, food, native dances and ancient handicrafts. The overarching aim is to engage the local communities in a dynamic process, drawing their attention to planning and protection requirements to safeguard the outstanding universal values of indigenous cultural heritage.

During the past 7 Birzeit Heritage Weeks, more than 200’000 people visited the different activities of the heritage weeks giving high exposure and pride to Birzeit community and surrounding villages. Local Palestinian rural population gained revenue at both local and national levels where the sale of their cultural products, traditional food entangled with traditional fashion revealed various integral aspects of Palestinian social identity and instilled life in the alleys and streets of Palestinian marginalized rural areas. Moreover, local rural producers exhibited their production and gained financially as well as management wise from these experiences. The foremost gains were the familiarization of young volunteers with the terminology and procedures of heritage week including the preparation, planning and execution of the events. Women organizations got the required exposure to network locally and regionally to market their products not forgetting the exposure of local and traditional artifacts and products that were enhanced. Palestinian folkloric, music, dance and theater productions were promoted including catering for Children artistic and recreational needs. Exchange with regional and international cultures were highly fostered.

At Birzeit 8th heritage Week, Rozana Association and its local partner CBOs and authorities promise you an unforgettable cultural experience for 5 nights under the summer sky of Palestine where we all take pride in our heritage culture and its exchange for a better word that respects our histories, cultures and traditions.

Birzeit Heritage week is part of a process to reconcile with a broken history; every society heritage constitutes a fundamental factor in plumbing historical and cultural depths whilst it expresses identity and interacts with the social, political and environmental reality.

The major challenge for Birzeit Heritage Week remains the availability of the funds that are necessary to build and then promote the different cultural corners and booths. However, Rozana Association had gained high trust among the national private sector as well among international donor agencies that will hopefully contribute to covering some financial needs.

Rozana Association with its high trust in the local community due to its community-based approaches, several rural communities are to contribute to safeguard the needed activities and participations. People of the world who believe in culture as a tool for positive change in each developed region, impacting positively the lives of marginalized rural communities, mainly women and youth, will extend us a helping hand to achieve our goals in this endeavor.

story:
Twistii - Made in the USA

I invented Twistii in 2003 out of a business card, a rubber band and a pencil.

  • I made my first real prototype in 2004
  • The first Twistii was actually used on my horse's mane!
  • I have never given up on the idea of making the first Made in the USA updo hair styling tool, and my friends & family have never given up on me either!

I want to go audition for Shark Tank and show the Sharks that I have what it takes to continue my journey towards providing women (and men!) with a hair accessory that works!

What I Need & What You Get

I have spent years perfecting the design all the while having to fend off a big hair accessory company from ripping off my Twistiis and making them in China.

And to make matters more challenging, we had a fire in our building and now have to deal with being displaced and a huge cleanup challenge due to this tragedy.

  • All my clothing is severely smoke damaged
  • I had been saving funds to pay my patent fees of $1,500 that now has to go towards living expenses since Red Cross only pays for 3 days of temporary housing
  • Travel money so I can go to the Shark Tank audition
  • I'm hoping to get enough extra to buy some more Twistii samples from my manufacturer in the USA in different colors.

The Impact

I have spent my entire life fighting for bringing back Made in the USA:

  • By getting on Shark Tank, I will inspire other inventors and designers to continue to have their products prototyped and manufactured in the USA
  • I am continuing to never give up on America and I never will stop trying
  • I might stumble, and fall but I am determined to make this happen

Risks & Challenges

If you have ever had an idea for a product or invention, you know how hard it is to even get people to listen much less help you!

  • By getting to Shark Tank, I will inspire others to keep reaching for the stars!
  • Yes, making Twistii in the USA costs me 25% more but it is high quality and I will make the price as low as possible and still be able to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even $1 helps:

  • Somehow, my family and I have survived and we will continue to be frugal
  • I do have a mold for the Twistii and just need funds to make more Twistiis!
Visit the website at www.TwistiiHair.com

story:
Short Summary

HMS M.33 is a unique survivor. Launched in May 1915 this vessel is the sole remaining British veteran of that year’s bloody Gallipoli Campaign, and also of the Russian Civil War which followed. Only three British warships from the First World War still exist and HMS M.33 will be the only one open to the public on August 6th, in time for the Gallipoli centenary.

In order to avoid such an important ship to be forgotten, a project dedicated in bringing M33 to life in under way. The main objectives are to conserve and repair, so that this amazing vessel can be appreciated and understood by future generations.

The ship will be made physically and intellectually accessible. New interpretation and activities will engage people of all ages and backgrounds with M33’s history, the stories of the men who served on board, and the history of Gallipoli – one of the key campaigns of the Great War.


What We Need

We are planning to raise the symbolic amount of £19,150 - 1915 being the year HMS M.33 was built and launched. This represents just under 10% of the remaining amount, £250,000 to be raised by the Museum for the completion of the fundraising campaign.

The pledge will contribute to the restoration work and creating the amazing M33 interactive experience which will take you in time to the WW1 reality and connect you will the stories of the past. 


What You Get

·  £5 x 100 - E-Certificate acknowledging your donation

·  £10 x 40 - Social media shout-out (specially designed graphic) plus an e-Certificate

·  £25 x 110 - Entry tickets to M33 (single attraction tickets) plus an e-Certificate

·  £100 x 50 - Unique limited-edition specially designed postcard of M33 by a Portsmouth-based photographer and entry tickets to M33 plus an e-Certificate

·  £500 x 4 (each perk for two people) - Exclusive preview of the Gallipoli Exhibition with a curator talk and entry tickets to M33 (adult all attraction ticket)

·  £1000 x 3 (each perk for two people) - Private tour of M33 with a curator after the ship has been opened to the public and exclusive preview of the Gallipoli Exhibition with a talk. Refreshments available.

·  £3000 x 2 (each perk for two people) - VIP Private behind the scene tour of the M33 with a dedicated curator and exclusive preview of the Gallipoli Exhibition with a talk. Refreshments available.

Most importantly though, you have the unique opportunity to contribute to saving a fantastic piece of our naval heritage that will be open to visitors for many, many years. HMS M.33 is a little ship with a big history and the beauty of this campaign is that you don’t need to contribute large amounts to ensure she is safe for the future.


The Impact

‘Commemorating Gallipoli – the HMS M.33 Project’

HMS M.33 was designed as a ‘Monitor’ of 568 tons, a ship with a shallow draft allowing it to get close-in to shore and fire at targets on land. The small ship carried two powerful and oversize 6” guns, but was a basic metal box lacking in comforts. The 72 officers and men who sailed for the Gallipoli Campaign were crammed inside and away from home for over 3 years.

The National Museum of the Royal Navy (NMRN) and Hampshire County Council (HCC) have worked as partners to develop the £2.4m project to conserve, restore and interpret M33 to the public in time for her centenary.  With a grant of £1.8m from the Heritage Lottery Fund (HLF) the ship will be made physically and intellectually open to all for the first time. The warship sits in No.1 Dock alongside HMS Victory in Portsmouth Historic Dockyard, and uniquely visitors will start with a 6 metre descent into the bottom of the dock before stepping aboard. New interpretation and activities will bring alive HMS M.33’s history, the stories of the men who served on board, and the bloody history of the Gallipoli Campaign. The Campaign claimed over 100,000 lives of personnel from all round the world, and the ship will be a focus for national commemorations when she opens in August this year.

‘Commemorating Gallipoli – the HMS M.33 Project’ is part of the NMRN’s wider ‘Great War At Sea 1914 – 1918’ programme to mark the Royal Navy’s First World War. It will be accompanied by the special exhibition, ‘Gallipoli: Myth and Memory’ opening in March 2015.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!

Share our indiegogo page on your social media, and tell your friends and family about our project.

There is a unique opportunity for volunteers to get involved in all areas of the project, from Conservation, Exhibition and Interpretation Research to Learning and Outreach.

To get involved or find out more about the opportunities we have available contact our Volunteer Coordinator, Alice Roberts or call 023 9272 7591.


Thank You!
story_txt:
Short Summary 

HMS M.33 is a unique survivor. Launched in May 1915
this vessel is the sole remaining British veteran of that year’s bloody
Gallipoli Campaign, and also of the Russian Civil War which followed. Only
three British warships from the First World War still exist and HMS M.33 will
be the only one open to the public on August 6th, in time for the Gallipoli
centenary.
In order to avoid such an important ship to be
forgotten, a project dedicated in bringing M33 to life in under way. The main
objectives are to conserve and repair, so that this amazing vessel can be
appreciated and understood by future generations.
The ship will be made physically and intellectually
accessible. New interpretation and activities will engage people of all ages
and backgrounds with M33’s history, the stories of the men who served on board,
and the history of Gallipoli – one of the key campaigns of the Great War.

What We Need
 

We are planning to raise the symbolic amount of
£19,150 - 1915 being the year HMS M.33 was built and launched. This represents
just under 10% of the remaining amount, £250,000 to be raised by the Museum for
the completion of the fundraising campaign.
The pledge will contribute to the restoration work
and creating the amazing M33 interactive experience which will take you in time
to the WW1 reality and connect you will the stories of the past. 


What You Get



· 
£5 x 100 - E-Certificate acknowledging your
donation
· 
£10 x 40 - Social media shout-out (specially
designed graphic) plus an e-Certificate
· 
£25 x 110 - Entry tickets to M33 (single attraction
tickets) plus an e-Certificate
· 
£100 x 50 - Unique limited-edition specially
designed postcard of M33 by a Portsmouth-based photographer and entry tickets
to M33 plus an e-Certificate
· 
£500 x 4 (each perk for two people) - Exclusive
preview of the Gallipoli Exhibition with a curator talk and entry tickets to
M33 (adult all attraction ticket)
· 
£1000 x 3 (each perk for two people) - Private tour
of M33 with a curator after the ship has been opened to the public and
exclusive preview of the Gallipoli Exhibition with a talk. Refreshments
available.
· 
£3000 x 2 (each perk for two people) - VIP Private
behind the scene tour of the M33 with a dedicated curator and exclusive
preview of the Gallipoli Exhibition with a talk. Refreshments available.

opportunity to contribute to saving a fantastic piece of our naval heritage

story:
Short Summary

- Many of you will have met a lovely gentleman on Clapham called Stan Hook

-Stan was a real gentleman & one of the friendliest people many of had ever met

-He was a massive dog lover and loved to meet all of our pet dogs in the park

-Stan knew many of our dogs by name & loved to greet them

-Stan loved all animals and would regularly bring bread to feed the birds on Clapham Common

Sadly Stan was found dead in his flat in January 2015

- There has been a huge local outpouring of love and affection following the news of Stan's death

-Many people have expressed a wish to contribute toward the purchase of a bench bearing a memorial plaque in memory of Stan - which will be placed at the bandstand on Clapham Common

-Stan loved nothing more than chatting with dog owners, greeting their dogs and watching the world go by - while sitting on one of the benches at the bandstand on Clapham Common

-Please help us reach our target of £1300 to buy a bench in memory of the most loving, kind, caring and generous gentleman that was the late Mr Stan Hook

story:
Hi! My name is Olivia Friedman.

I am a teacher at the Ida Crown Jewish Academy. Since we are a community, I think it would be great for us to acknowledge life-changing events in our community members' lives by providing them with a little something. (This means: faculty, administration, office staff, maintenance crew, cafeteria staff...if you work here, you're part of our crew!) Cynthia Levin used to do this and I would like to take over her role in creating and running The Sunshine Fund here at our school.

What We Need 

We need each member of the ICJA community (faculty/ staff and so forth) to donate so that we can collect funds to purchase items/ gift certificates/ a Yom Limmud to acknowledge:

  • The birth of a staff member's child
  • The bar or bat mitzvah of a staff member's child
  • The passing of a staff member's immediate family member
  • An engagement or wedding in the immediate family
  • Get well soon in the event of an operation or other life event 
We suggest that you donate $10 to this goal. (Obviously, you can donate more or less! Any amount helps and shows your fellow ICJA members that you are thinking of them.) Any money which is not used this year will be saved up and added to The Sunshine Fund to be used in future years. 

What You Get/ The Impact

It's important for the Ida Crown community to care about one another. This is a great way to ensure that you and your life event are acknowledged, to celebrate each person's joy and to share in each other's sorrow. One year you will be on the receiving end of the Sunshine Fund and another year you will be the giver...the wheel keeps on turning! :) 

Thank you for your help!

story:
2015 will mark the 10th Anniversary of the Central Missouri Renaissance Festival and we are excited about the continued building and renovation of our permanent home Boster Castle.  The Festival moved out to its current location in 2008 and while some structures have stood the test of time our Kitchen Area has not.

The Central Mo Renaissance Festival Kitchen Remodel will help us with one of our largest issues—a better food vending area with the promise of more seating for patrons.  Until a few years ago our small little Faire only needed a few tables for guests, and we were able to adequately accommodate.  But over the past 2 years we have witnessed an explosion in attendance and the kitchen area has not been up to the task.

Our plan calls for a sub floor of gravel to go in so we can build a pallet and plywood floor for workers to stand on.  We will build a dividing wall between cooks and servers with counters and cabinets to facilitate the process.  The roof line will overhang the front of the structure by 4 feet giving patrons cover from the elements.  This plan is budgeted at $1500.00 for the cost of materials since we will be doing the work ourselves.  Any money raised that exceeds the base cost of the remodel will go into an extension of the project.  Guttering along the front will funnel along downspouts into rain barrels that will collect water for shrubs and flowers.  Just to the right of the current kitchen area will be another gravel pad for the Cooker/Smoker to sit on and a wall separating the cooking from the guests.  We will follow that project with additional picnic benches and the construction of a hand washing station.

story:
Hello world,

Dungeon Mason is a small game development team in South Korea. Our team consists of mobile/social game veterans from Gameloft, Crytek, Unity, etc.

We want to create a social gambling game which is way more casual than poker, and has some unit collecting factor while not ruining the balance of gambling game play which is determined by luck. 

So here is what we came up with.

King’s Legion is 3D mobile social gambling game packed with beautiful fantasy units. This game takes some elements from social gambling since you can bet your gold against other players, but it also takes some elements from trading card game for letting you collect and use your own units in the battle(Just 1 unit a game).


The rule is simple. Every player will get 4 units from the common unit deck just like poker game. After that, you can draw 1 unit from your own unit deck or just choose to get it from the common deck if you are out of units. After betting, the battle starts. A unit which has higher number will win and stand on the ground. A player who has the most units standing at the end will win the game and take all the gold and one of other players’ units which come from their own unit deck.


Common unit deck consists of 4 different races (Demon, Rage, Human, Nature) and each races has 15 units that has damage varies from 1 to 15. When you make a poker hand with your unit damage numbers, your units will get extra damage boost and it will be highly useful in winning the battle and game. 



Up to 4 players around the world can join one game room and fight for gold and honor. Weekly rewarding league system will fuel up your weak motivation and there are also ton of missions to accomplish during the game play.





We are almost at the last stage of production and we really need some help from backers around the world to go further from here. Can you help us to go beyond this horizon? A brand new game is dawning by your help.



What We Need to get there

We need at least 5,000 USD to finalize our last stage of production and open this game to Apple Appstore and Google Play Store all over the world.

We are also planning to expand this game's boundary to Facebook web game, PC, Mac platform. Users from any devices can join one game and play real-time battle.

Your help will be the important contribution for us delivering our game and success.


Perks for the backers

We will personally send a mail to all backers about how to get these perks before our game service starts.

Beholder's Perk

First battle vault space unlock 

Originally, you start with 5 unit space. If you unlock 5 more, you can bring 10 units to your battle.

Gold Unit Pack x 2

You can use this item to gain 3 of high damage units. You can also get some special unit out of this item.


Knight's Perk

First and Second vault spaces unlock

Originally, you start with 5 unit space. If you unlock 10 more, you can bring 10 units to your battle and have 5 additional spaces for more units you can collect.

Gold Unit Pack x 5

You can use this item to gain 3 of high damage units. You can also get some special unit out of this item.


Warrior's Perk

First and Second and Third vault spaces unlock

Originally, you start with 5 unit space. If you unlock 10 more, you can bring 10 units to your battle and have 10 additional spaces for more units you can collect.

Gold Unit Pack x 10

You can use this item to gain 3 of high damage units. You can also get some special unit out of this item.


Mage's Perk

All vaults unlock

You get total 30 unit spaces in your vault.

Gold Unit Pack x 10

You can use this item to gain 3 of high damage units. You can also get some special unit out of this item.

Paladin Unit

Units that has special ability of removing extra damages.

Only 100 units exist in the game. You can have this.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our game so far, and you are not able to help financially, you can also help us by spreading the words about King's Legion. More people means more fun in this game. Say it out loud!!

story:
There are so many popular places in the world to visit. Georgia, undeservedly is not one of them. They are such a lovely people with so many historical buildings, breathtaking ancient places and million things to see.

Please help this project and donate £12 (or more)
(approx 18.50 USD) and then you'll receive
my 2000 High Quality photos with my Eternal Gratitude :)

If you can't afford to donate then please share  this page on social media. It costs nothing, but might I will find a helping hand through your Facebook or Twitter post :) Thank you so much for your help :)

The goal of this project is that I'd like to bring that small and warm-hearted country into your room. My name is Peter Provics and I'm a Hungarian backpacker from Manchester (UK). In this June I'd like to go to Georgia and show you as many amazing places as it possible and take 2000 High Quality photos in those two weeks. Basically, I'd like to introduce Georgian people and their life, their towns and villages, and most importantly their beautiful country.

What's in it for you?

...well, I hope 2000 High Quality photos for only £12 (18.50 USD)
is not too bad... :)

Okay, now seriously. Please, have a look at the perks, There are many surprises for you. Not only the photos, there are photo albums, LIMITED EDITION albums, you would recieve handwritten postcards from Georgia and you can follow this journey online. Most importantly, you can get the access to download 2000 High Quality photos about Georgia (or you can receive them on DVDs too), including all the names of the places I'll visit and you can read about towns, villages, historical buildings, mountains, local programmes, food and also you can get tips for your potential journey, including museums, guesthouses, hotels and restaurants.

I'll ship worldwide.

All of the pictures will be free for use for everyone who helps this tour and you'll be able to use them on any public platform as well, because this project is not about me, is about Georgia :)

I will need local help to reach my goal and I'm lucky that I've found an experienced Georgian guide called Maiko Papunashvili. She knows everything that we need for this project and with her help we can discover the most important places in Georgia, like Tbilisi, Kutaisi, Vardzia, Gori, Akhalcixe, Mtskheta, Batumi and also the Black Sea and the Caucasus.

I know that I won't revolutionize the tourism there, so it might be just a little step for Georgians, but every little step counts and maybe in the future a few more tourists might just like to spend a holiday there.

The route. If I could reach this amount then I can visit all the planned places. If my budget was lower, then I'll need to cut some stops off, for example I might not make it  to the Black Sea and Batumi or might have to skip Vardzia...

The full route is: Kutaisi, Tbilisi, Mtskheta, many places in Kakheti like Tsinandali, or Sighnaghi and then I'd like to see David Gareja, the Georgian Orthodox monastery complex. I'll spend the next day in Kazbegi to visit the Gergeti Trinity Church (see the picture of the top of the page). On the second week I'll go to the west. First of all I'll stop at Vardzia and then Akhaltsikhe, and hopefully I can get to Uplistsikhe and Gori as well. On the last days of these two weeks hopefully I'll have the budget to reach the Black Sea and I can stay a bit at Batumi.

The Cave City of Vardzia


Budget:
- Flight tickets: Manchester-Tbilisi, Tbilisi Manchester £300
- Transport (marsrutka, bus, train, public transport, car rental) £500
- Accommodation (guesthouses, hostels, hotels) £500
- Insurance, entry fees, food £300
- Commission for Indiegogo, credit cards, Paypal, etc  £300
- Cost of rewards, delivery cost £600
