story:
Dance Soul Motion: Wellness Beyond Fitness

Dance Soul Motion, owner Dominique Mastrototoro and her staff are ready to go BIG: are you ready to help?

Hi! My name is Dominique Mastrototoro.  I have been teaching movement based fitness for 15 years, starting with a love of dance at age 3.  By the time I was 16, I was teaching, dancing, and looking for ways to incorporate the joy of movement into everyday life: I started dreaming about owning a studio of my own.  

I continued to study dance, as well as public relations, at Boston University.  During this time I discovered yoga and began to deepen my appreciation for the connection between the soul and the body in motion. In 2010, I became a 200-hr Registered Yoga Teacher through Yoga Works. Following my training I continued to work in fitness, managing various yoga studios and gyms in Boston, and expanding my skills by earning certifications and licenses in Pilates, Barre, Zumba and TRX.  

With the knowledge of my teachings, both academic and fitness based, and the support of my family and friends I was ready to make my dream a reality and open a fitness studio; I continue to love what I do and look forward to the opportunity to grow my dream.

“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.”  ~Walt Disney 

What We Need & What You Get

I have set a goal of $50,000 to cover a down-payment and renovation costs.

Dance Soul Motion opened in April of 2013 and experienced immediate success with an incredible amount of excitement and support from the local community.  The success has been so great that the studio needs your help! The goal of $50,000 would go directly towards the costs of purchasing a building and any renovations that may be needed. The promise to current students is that the studio will not move more than 10 miles! Fitting in classes can be hard, the goal continues to be making it a stress-free part of your day!

  • No More Shared Parking: Parking can get tight at our current location; you shouldn’t need to leave yourself open to stress and chance when you come to class; a primary goal is obtaining a location with plenty of parking.
  • More Class Options: With more than one room classes can be offered multiple times a week. An expanded schedule means more barre for your buck (yoga, Pilates and Zumba too!). 
  • Childcare: Dance Soul Motion will provide childcare that goes beyond markers and crayons. The studio will offer an active child-watch that will keep your child just as engaged and active as you.
  • Children’s Classes: Dance Soul Motion currently offers kids and family yoga over holiday breaks and vacations; more space means more chances to offer these classes, and others, on a regular basis and in tandem to the adult classes.

If 100 people purchase our 6-month, campaign specific pass we will reach our goal!

The top perk you will get from this campaign: a better studio to help you be the best version of yourself. Of course, there is much more! There are campaign specific perks, such as 6-months of unlimited classes for just $500. All passes purchased through the campaign will be activated starting with your first visit at the new location.

Any and all funds raised will go directly towards finding and opening a new location.

The Impact

Expansion from the inside out, transforming workouts and lives!

Dominique and all of the instructors at Dance Soul Motion want to continue to provide you with top-notch classes in a safe and comfortable environment. The current space can hold a class capacity of up to 20 students and many classes are consistently near that tipping point. Additionally, there is much more to offer the growing community, this includes non-fitness based workshops such as nutrition, stress-reduction and overall well-being. Dance Soul Motion’s community is starting to blossom: let’s help it flourish!

Since opening, Dance Soul Motion has raised nearly $5,000 in cash and goods for charitable organizations. This time I’m asking that you invest in the future of our studio and your journey with us! 

Risks & Challenges

Starting a new workout is hard, sometimes painful, but the rewards outweigh the risk. We hope you see the same in our goal and overall expansion.

With a degree in Public Relations, a passion and training in fitness and a long career in the service industry I know that the needs of the client come first and the need of many comes before the needs of a few. Armed with this knowledge and the suggestions I’ve received over the 2+ years in the current location I am prepared to open a new space.

All perks will be honored, regardless of the outcome of this campaign, starting in April 2016 (sooner if the campaign is successful and a new location is secured).

I will take the advice of our clients, the knowledge of our instructors and my vision for the future of Dance Soul Motion into consideration as I work to grow our community. The biggest challenge is rooted in the basis of this campaign: having our own space where we can operate independently of any other establishments. This includes, and as mentioned before, more parking, more studio spaces and childcare. It will also allow more regulated temperatures and proper air-flow/ventilation for a fitness facility.

Other Ways You Can Help

Wellness isn’t just working-out, and helping isn’t just donating

Maybe you don’t live near Dance Soul Motion or simply don’t have the means to donate. There are other ways you can help and I would appreciate it if you could take a moment of your time (which is just as valuable as a donation) and share this campaign. Mention it at your next family function, office party or start shouting it on the streets on your next walk/run. Put a sign on your dog (or cat). Whatever it takes! 

There are some easy share tools right from this campaign: share to your heart’s desire!
story_txt:

Dance Soul Motion, owner Dominique Mastrototoro and her staff are ready to go BIG: are you ready to help?

story:
FreshMinistries, fresh food, fresh opportunities

We are excited about bringing aquaponics farming to Jacksonville's urban core! Our state-of-the-art farm will: 1) build community in the neighborhood we serve;   2) grow fresh affordable produce for and within a core-city "food desert" community; 3) make a healthier nutrition-rich food resource easily accessible to our low-income neighbors; 4) train and assist unemployed individuals and core-city entrepreneurs in starting urban farms and related agribusinesses; 5) increase self-sufficiency and business success of urban farming families through business incubation programs, micro-loans and mentoring of new agribusinesses by aquaponics and agribusiness specialists. 

Aquaponics is a cost-effective, earth-friendly, low-water way to grow healthy fruits, vegetables and fish in an urban environment. The system does not require soil and can be built on a parking lot or small backyard, uses 5% of the water required for traditional farming and yields 10 times the amount of produce per square foot than soil-based farming. It is the perfect urban farm system!

Our goal is to teach core-city residents to own, manage and market their own produce and become self-sufficient urban aquaponics farm entrepreneurs, improve community health, provide healthy foods so children are well-fed and prepared to learn, and fight obesity with our core-city neighbors. 

How soilless aquaponics farms work:

•Seedlings are planted in soilless grow medium and placed into holes on rafts

•Plant roots are exposed to nutrient-rich water created by fish effluent, which acts as a natural fertilizer

•Plant roots naturally filter nutrient-rich water so that it may safely return to fish tanks

FreshMinistries, a 501(c)3 based in Jacksonville, Florida, has a 25-year track record of successful outreach, job training and support for entrepreneurs. This new aquaponics training center, to be built at our Weaver Center for Community Outreach, will be part of the successful LifePoint Career Institute, where we currently provide free job training in the hospitality and health fields to unemployed individuals. Through this new project, we will help families create their own aquaponic gardens, provide healthy produce in what is now a food desert, and raise crops to support FreshMinistries outreach programs in Jacksonville and around the world. 

What We Need 

The start-up cost to create this aquaponics agribusiness is approximately $130,000. We hope crowd-funding donors will contribute at least half. All contributions are tax-deductible. We will be marketing produce raised and expect the enterprise to be self-supporting within the first year. Every donation helps. Won't you be part of bringing this project to a community in need?

Why FreshMinistries?

FreshMinistries has created job training programs and supported small business in Jacksonville for decades. We have also launched on-going education programs around the world. We are dedicated to promoting healthy families and helping individuals and communities realize their full potential. This project will serve as a model for agribusiness initiatives in such impoverished areas of the world as Haiti and Africa.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about this project and share this on social media!
  • Take a look at our Web site, www.freshministries.org, to explore opportunities to volunteer and support other FreshMinistries initiatives.

story:
Short Summary / Кратко Резюме

My name is Presiyan, I am founder and co-owner of a small baking company “Baker Brothers”. I come from Bulgaria - a small country in the Balkans with ancient culture and great traditions. I have started my career more than 6 years ago when I found my love for bread. My thirst for learning, exploration and development of  my skills and knowledge of bread making, have led me to meet great master bakers in France, Austria, South Korea and Sweden as well as some short visits in few other countries.

In 2013 I have opened a fermentation and artisan bread making school which shortly gain popularity and became the only such school in Bulgaria.

In 2014 we opened a small microbakery to establish our name and experiment with recipes and innovation. We continued the school and teach the people our ways.

Our aim is to open a bakery where we can do each and every part of the bread making process-from grounding the flour in stone mills to baking the hand-made bread in a professional deck oven.

We are aware this is a huge investment and we are working hard to collect all we need for it.

We will be thankful if you choose to support us during this process.

Здравейте, казвам се Пресиян от „Братя Хлебари” и съм хлебар и мелничар от малката държава България на Балканския полуoстров в южна Европа. Макар и малко, ние сме горди и смели хора, които независимо от трудностите се борят докрай за това, в което вярват. Така започна и моята кариера като хлебар преди повече от 5 години - с молби да чиракувам и с тежък труд при различни хлебари. Времето ми показа моя път. Последваха стажове в чужбина – Франция, Австрия, Южна Корея, Швеция и кратки визити в други държави. Срещите с хлебари на различни места по света ме обогатяват като хлебар и ми помагат да разбера колко важно е възраждането на занаятите.

Сега дойде времето в България и на Балканите да се надигне една нова вълна, едно ново време, една промяна от красив характер. Наричаме я кулинарна балканска революция, но и еволюция. Аз като хлебар се интересувам от мястото на хлебарството в нея. Защо революция и еволюция - защото дава импулс за нещо ново и донякъде забравено старо, но в същото време иновативно и  ориентирано към бъдещето.

През изминалата 2014 година създадохме скромна експериментална Хлебарница с  малкото пари, които имахме. Продължихме да развиваме стартиралото през 2013 Училище по Хлебарство и Ферментации с идеята да учим хората на занаятчийските подходи в хлебарството.

Следващият логичен етап от нашето развитие е да направим голяма хлебарница, където спокойно да обучаваме ученици да се потапят в света на живите ферментации и древни похвати, за да отварят нови хлебарници и в други  градове и села. Това вярваме, е начина да се възродят Балканите и да станат едно много по-добро място за живеене. За да осъществим тази наша мечта и да продължим да творим и да вървим напред, водейки вълната на промяна, имаме нужда от помощта Ви – на Вас, всички наши приятели, фенове и хора, съпричастни към Делото ни.

Обръщаме се към Вас с призива да станете част от нашата Мисия и ЗАЕДНО да станем свидетели на красивите плодове на нашия отдаден труд.

What We Need & What You Get / 

От какво имаме нужда &  Какво получавате

We need a big space, professional equipment, commercial part and a stone mill. All this in one bakery in Sofia. We already found a location we fell inlove with. We applied for a bank loan and save all the money we earn with our current work. Since we need quite a big investment we started this indiegogo project, to reach for our fans or people interested in what we do.

We will buy a big austrian stone mill, to freshly mill at least 50% of our daily flour. 

One or two french deck ovens from Bongard company. One spiral mixer, one diving arm mixer and several refrigerators. Several wooden tables for dividing, resting and shaping the dough.
A wooden style commercial part for customers and visitors to enjoy sandwiches, coffee, enzyme tea, fermented sodas, honey wine and much more. 
There has to be 4 toilets - 2 for customers and 2 for our team.

Small garden infront of the bakery to bring harmony to everyone and everything.

A good ventilation system and so on.

Everything more that we recieve, gain or so on will be used for the baking school to upgrade with wood, ovens, personal equipment for each future student and uniforms. All spent money will be shown as pictures or videos, and all we do will be documented. 

Имаме нужда от голямо пространство, професионално оборудване, търговска част и каменна мелница. Всичко това в една хлебарница в София. Вече намерихме мястото, в което се влюбихме. Кандидатствахме за банков заем и спестяваме всички пари, които изкарваме с работата си към момента. Тъй като имаме нужда от много голяма инвестиция стартирахме този indiegogoпроект, да достигнем до всички наши фенове и хора заинтригувани от това, което правим.

Ще закупим голяма австрийска каменна мелница, за да мелим прясно поне 50% от дневното ни брашно.

Една или две френски подови пещи на фирма Бонгард. Един спирален миксер, един миксер с падаща ръка и няколко хладилника. Няколко дървени плотове и маси за сечене, преоформяне, почивка и оформяне на тестото.

Дървен шкаф за последна ферментация.

Търговска част в дървен стил за да могат нашите клиенти и гости да се наслаждават на сандвичи, кафе, ензимен чай, ферментирали сокове, медовина и още много...

Трябва да има четири тоалетни – две за гости и две за екипа.

Малка градинка пред Хлебарницата за да донесе хармония на всеки и всичко.

Добра вентилационна система.

Всичко отгоре, което съберем, получим и прочие, ще бъде използвано за училището по Хлебарство да се преоборудва с пещи, дървени плотове и мебели, униформи и персонално оборудване за всеки бъдещ ученик.

Всички похарчени пари ще бъдат показани със снимки или видео, и всичко ще бъде подробно документирано.

What you get for investing in us? / Какво ще получите за инвестицията си към нас?

1.  5 евро – Thank you on our official facebook page. / Благодарности  на Братята изписани на фейсбука ни.

2.  10 eвро – Become our Angel on our facebook page and official website. Your name will be seen as long as we operate. / Стани Ангелъ на Братя Хлебари, ще бъде изписано на фейсбука ни и на официалния ни сайт. Всички ще ги виждат винаги докато съществува дейността ни.

3.  20 евро – Special Handmade Bread, packed with a handwritten note from us and Angel of Baker Brothers. / Специален Хляб от нас, ръчно опакован с малка бележка благодарности разписана на ръка от двамата Братя. Както и Ангелъ на „Братя Хлебари”.

4.  30 евро – Signiture Mug with our logo. To enjoy hot beverages and so on. + Thank you. / Чаша с логото на Братя Хлебари. Да се наслаждавате на топли напитки. + Благодарности.

5.  50 евро – Special Handmade Bread(#3) + Signiture Mug(#4) + Thank you / Специален Хляб(№3) + Чаша(№4) + Благодарности.

6.  80 евро – Branded T-shirt with our logo and the bread revolution + Thank you / Брандирана тениска с логото на Братя Хлебари и хлебната революция + Благодарности.

7.  100 евро – Participation in 2 day classes "Weekend in the world of Sourdough" in Sofia, Bulgaria. + Thank you / Участие в двудневен курс „Уикенд в света на Кваса” в София + Благодарности

8.  100 евро – Branded Apron with our logo and the bread revolution. + Thank you / Престилка с логото на Братя Хлебари и хлебната революция + Благодарности

9.  150 евро – Bread subscription for 3 months and 4 bread per week. For abroad  you can choose freshly milled flour or dried breads with herbs same ammount. + Thank you / Хлебен Абонамент за 4 хляба седмично с продължителност 3 месеца.За чужбина избор между прясно смляно брашно от нас или изсушени хлебчета с подправки. + Благодарности.

10.  500 евро – One or Two days (8-10 hours) course for you and your company, office, friends or relatives up to 5 people. + Branded T-shirt for all the participants up to 5 people. + Thank You. / Еднодневен или Двудневен курс за Вас и вашата компания, фирма, приятели или роднини до 5 души + Тениски с лого за всеки участник до 5 души + Благодарности

*We can`t handle the fees for delivery of any reward and perk.They will be on your behalf.
*Ние не можем да поемем разходи по изпращането на нито една награда. Разходите са за Ваша сметка.

*For perk #10 if its abroad, the transport expenses should be paied by your side.

*За награда №10 ако е в чужбина, транспортните разходи се поемат от Ваша страна.

If we don`t reach the required funding, all the collected finance will help us make the Bakery anyway. Because we believe its time to light the Bread revolution has come!

Ако не достигнем набелязанати средства, събраното финансиране въпреки всичко ще ни помогне да направим Хлебарницата макар и по-трудно. Защото вярваме, че времето да разпалим Хлебната рЕволюция е дошло!

The Impact / Въздействието

Our mission to revive all the artisan crafts tied to bread baking - milling, pottery, wood carving and so on will contribute to a whole change in the economic situation in our homeland and the Balkans as a whole.

It will contribute to a change in the way people think and bring back long forgotten and lost life and moral values from before the industrialization.

Also it will contribute for revival of the farming as local and smallscale. We work strongly with small farms and if we can only local and all our students who we teach our methods will do the same. This we believe will revive all the regions of Bulgaria and the Balkans.

Educating our customers and the people of every detail around real Bread, flour and all other products of our Craft will clear the market of all those that misuse the trust customers give us and put high prices on low quality products. From this the people will win the most.

The continuation of "The school of Bread Baking and Fermentation" into a new chapter will helps us extend our teachings for the children and educate a new generation of creators and idealists, that will dream and work for a better and more beautiful world.

Мисията ни да възраждаме занаятите обвързани с хлебарството – мелничарство, грънчарство, дърводелство и прочие ще допринесе за една цялостна промяна на икономическото състояние на Родината ни и Балканите като цяло.

Ще допринесе още за една промяна в начина на мислене на хората и връщане на част от забравените и изгубени житейски и морални ценности от преди необмислената индустриализация.

Също така ще доведем до съживяване на фермерството като локално и дребно такова. Работим силно с малки ферми по възможност само локално и всеки един наш ученик работещ по нашите методи и обучен от нас ще направи същото. Това вярваме постепенно ще съживи регионите в България, а от там и Балканите.

Обучаването на клиентите и информирането на хората за всеки един детайл от истинския Хляб, брашно и всякакви други продукти на труда ни, постепенно ще изчисти пазара от всички, които злоупотребяват с доверието на купувача и продават каквото и да било на високи цени. От това най-много ще спечелят обикновените хора.

Продължавате на „Училището по Хлебарство и Ферментации” на един нов етап ще ни помогне да разгърнем дейността си и към децата и да възпитаме едно ново поколение творци и идеалисти, които да работят за един по-красив и съвършен свят.


Risks & Challenges / Рискове & Препятствия

Risks when we open:

1.To not fill our production capacity soon enough and to have a lack of clients in the first three months.

Solution - That`s why we put the rent and expenses for the first three months into the investment so we should worry about it.

2.To have difficulty finding the right people for our team fast enough.

Solution - for more than 2 yeras we teach students in "The School for Bread Baking and Fermentation" and this makes it much easier to choose and hire people for our team.

3.The risk that our product might not be seen on the market from the rivalry products.

Solution - For more than one year we are on the market and we build our name as unique artisans with a lot of perspective and new approach. People recognize us and we have a lot of customers, that we just have to increase. 

Рисковете при отварянето са:

1.  Да не изпълним достатъчно бързо капацитета за производство и да има недостиг от клиенти в първите 3 месеца

Решение – затова сме сложили наемите за първите 3 месеца в инвестицията за да не се налага да се тревожим за това още в самото начало.

2.  Да не успеем достатъчно бързо да намерим добри помощници за Хлебарницата като персонал.

Решение – от почти 2 години обучаваме ученици в „Училището по Хлебарство” и така подготвихме предварително някой наши кадри, което улеснява много подбора ни на помощници.

3.  Риск продукта ни да не бъде отличен на пазара заради подобни конкурентни продукти.

Решение – вече една година се налагаме на пазара като уникални занаятчии с много перспективи и нови подходи. Хората ни разпознават и имаме изграден клиентски поток, който просто трябва да увеличаваме.

Other Ways You Can Help / 

Други начини да ни помогнете

The strongest way to support us other than financial investment is to share about our Dream.

Share with relatives, friends and their friends.

Share at coffee, at restaurant or anywhere else. The more people hear about this, the faster the change will come.

The more people look for knowledge the more artisans will shine with their work towards knowledge, the future and the people.

And in all this is exactly the essence of the bread and food rEvolution, that we are part of...

Sincerely yours,

Presiyan and Teodor of Baker Brothers, Sofia, Bulgaria.

Най-силният начин освен финансова инвестиция към нас е да споделяте за Делото ни.

Споделяйте на приятели, на познати и на техните познати.

Споделяйте на кафе, на ресторант и където и да било. Колкото повече хора чуят и разберат толкова по-бързо ще се случва промяната.

Колкото повече хора започнат да търсят знанието толкова по-силно ще изпъкнат истинските занаятчии работещи за занаята, бъдещето и обикновените хора.

А точно в това се крие същността на хлебната и кулинарна рЕволюция, от която ние сме част...

Съ Уважение, 

Пресиянъ и Теодоръ отъ Братя Хлебари, София, България.
story_txt:
Short Summary / Кратко Резюме
 
My name is Presiyan, I
am founder and co-owner of a small baking company “Baker Brothers”. I come from
Bulgaria - a small country in the Balkans with ancient culture and great
traditions. I have started my career more than 6 years ago when I found my love
for bread. My thirst for learning, exploration and development of  my skills and knowledge of bread making, have
led me to meet great master bakers in France, Austria, South Korea and Sweden
as well as some short visits in few other countries.
In 2013 I have opened a
fermentation and artisan bread making school which shortly gain popularity and
became the only such school in Bulgaria.
In 2014 we opened a small microbakery to establish our name and experiment with recipes and innovation. We continued the school and teach the people our ways.
Our aim is to open a
bakery where we can do each and every part of the bread making process-from
grounding the flour in stone mills to baking the hand-made bread in a
professional deck oven.
We are aware this is a
huge investment and we are working hard to collect all we need for it.
We will be thankful if
you choose to support us during this process.

Здравейте, казвам се
Пресиян от „Братя Хлебари” и съм хлебар и мелничар от малката държава България
на Балканския полуoстров в южна Европа. Макар и малко, ние сме горди и смели
хора, които независимо от трудностите се борят докрай за това, в което вярват.
Така започна и моята кариера като хлебар преди повече от 5 години - с молби да
чиракувам и с тежък труд при различни хлебари. Времето ми показа моя път.
Последваха стажове в чужбина – Франция, Австрия, Южна Корея, Швеция и кратки
визити в други държави. Срещите
с хлебари на различни места по света ме обогатяват като хлебар и ми помагат да
разбера колко важно е възраждането на занаятите. 
Сега дойде времето в
България и на Балканите да се надигне една нова вълна, едно ново време, една
промяна от красив
характер. Наричаме я кулинарна балканска революция,
но и еволюция. Аз като хлебар се интересувам от мястото на хлебарството в нея. Защо
революция и еволюция - защото дава импулс за нещо ново и донякъде забравено старо, но в
същото време иновативно и  ориентирано към бъдещето. 
През изминалата 2014
година създадохме скромна експериментална Хлебарница с  малкото пари, които имахме. Продължихме да развиваме стартиралото през
2013 Училище по Хлебарство и Ферментации с идеята да учим хората на
занаятчийските подходи в хлебарството. 
Следващият логичен етап
от нашето развитие е да направим голяма хлебарница, където спокойно да
обучаваме ученици да се потапят в света на живите ферментации и древни похвати,
за да отварят нови хлебарници и в други  градове
и села. Това вярваме, е начина да се възродят Балканите и да станат едно много
по-добро място за живеене. За
да осъществим тази наша мечта и да продължим да творим и да вървим напред,
водейки вълната на промяна, имаме нужда от помощта Ви – на Вас, всички наши приятели,
фенове и хора, съпричастни към Делото ни. 
Обръщаме се към Вас с
призива да станете част от нашата Мисия и ЗАЕДНО да станем свидетели на
красивите плодове на нашия отдаден труд.   What We Need & What You Get / 
От какво имаме нужда &  Какво получавате 
We need a big space, professional
equipment, commercial part and a stone mill. All this in one bakery in Sofia. We already found a location we fell inlove with. We applied for a bank loan and save all the money we earn with our current work. Since we need quite a big investment we started this indiegogo project, to reach for our fans or people interested in what we do.
We will buy a big austrian stone mill, to freshly mill at least 50% of our daily flour. 
One or two french deck ovens from Bongard company. One spiral mixer, one diving arm mixer and several refrigerators. Several wooden tables for dividing, resting and shaping the dough.A wooden style commercial part for customers and visitors to enjoy sandwiches, coffee, enzyme tea, fermented sodas, honey wine and much more. There has to be 4 toilets - 2 for customers and 2 for our team.
Small garden infront of the bakery to bring harmony to everyone and everything.
A good ventilation system and so on.
Everything more that we recieve, gain or so on will be used for the baking school to upgrade with wood, ovens, personal equipment for each future student and uniforms. All spent money will be shown as pictures or videos, and all we do will be documented. 
Имаме нужда от голямо пространство, професионално
оборудване, търговска част и каменна мелница. Всичко това в една хлебарница в
София. Вече намерихме мястото, в което се влюбихме. Кандидатствахме за банков
заем и спестяваме всички пари, които изкарваме с работата си към момента. Тъй
като имаме нужда от много голяма инвестиция стартирахме този indiegogoпроект,
да достигнем до всички наши фенове и хора заинтригувани от това, което правим.
Ще закупим голяма австрийска каменна мелница, за да мелим
прясно поне 50% от дневното ни брашно.
Една или две френски подови пещи на фирма Бонгард. Един
спирален миксер, един миксер с падаща ръка и няколко хладилника. Няколко
дървени плотове и маси за сечене, преоформяне, почивка и оформяне на тестото.
Дървен шкаф за последна ферментация.
Търговска част в дървен стил за да могат нашите клиенти и
гости да се наслаждават на сандвичи, кафе, ензимен чай, ферментирали сокове,
медовина и още много...
Трябва да има четири тоалетни – две за гости и две за екипа.
Малка градинка пред Хлебарницата за да донесе хармония на всеки
и всичко.
Добра вентилационна система.
Всичко отгоре, което съберем, получим и прочие, ще бъде
използвано за училището по Хлебарство да се преоборудва с пещи, дървени плотове
и мебели, униформи и персонално оборудване за всеки бъдещ ученик.
Всички похарчени пари ще бъдат показани със снимки или
видео, и всичко ще бъде подробно документирано.

What you get for investing in us? / Какво ще получите за инвестицията
си към нас?
1. 
5
евро – Thank you on our official facebook page. / Благодарности  на Братята изписани
на фейсбука ни.
2. 
10
eвро
– Become our Angel on our facebook page and official website. Your name will be seen as long as we operate. / Стани Ангелъ на Братя Хлебари, ще бъде изписано на фейсбука ни и на
официалния ни сайт. Всички ще ги виждат винаги докато съществува дейността ни.
3. 
20
евро – Special Handmade Bread, packed with a handwritten note from us and Angel of Baker Brothers. / Специален Хляб от нас, ръчно опакован с малка бележка благодарности
разписана на ръка от двамата Братя. Както и Ангелъ на „Братя Хлебари”.
4. 
30
евро – Signiture Mug with our logo. To enjoy hot beverages and so on. + Thank you. / Чаша с логото на Братя Хлебари. Да се наслаждавате на топли напитки. +
Благодарности.
5. 
50
евро – Special Handmade Bread(#3) + Signiture Mug(#4) + Thank you / Специален Хляб(№3) + Чаша(№4) + Благодарности.
6. 
80
евро – Branded T-shirt with our logo and the bread revolution + Thank you / Брандирана тениска с логото на Братя Хлебари и хлебната революция +
Благодарности.
7. 
100
евро – Participation in 2 day classes "Weekend in the world of Sourdough" in Sofia, Bulgaria. + Thank you / Участие в двудневен курс „Уикенд в света на Кваса” в София +
Благодарности
8. 
100
евро – Branded Apron with our logo and the bread revolution. + Thank you / Престилка с логото на Братя Хлебари и хлебната революция + Благодарности
9. 
150
евро – Bread subscription for 3 months and 4 bread per week. For abroad  you can choose freshly milled flour or dried breads with herbs same ammount. + Thank you / Хлебен Абонамент за 4 хляба седмично с продължителност 3 месеца.За
чужбина избор между прясно смляно брашно от нас или изсушени хлебчета с
подправки. + Благодарности. 
10.  500 евро – One or Two days (8-10 hours) course for you and your company, office, friends or relatives up to 5 people. + Branded T-shirt for all the participants up to 5 people. + Thank You. / Еднодневен или Двудневен
курс за Вас и вашата компания, фирма, приятели или роднини до 5 души + Тениски
с лого за всеки участник до 5 души + Благодарности
*We can`t handle the fees for delivery of any reward and perk.They will be on your behalf.*Ние не можем да
поемем разходи по изпращането на нито една награда. Разходите са за Ваша
сметка.
*For perk #10 if its abroad, the transport expenses should be paied by your side.
*За награда №10
ако е в чужбина, транспортните разходи се поемат от Ваша страна.
If we don`t reach the required funding, all the collected finance will help us make the Bakery anyway. Because we believe its time to light the Bread revolution has come!
Ако не достигнем
набелязанати средства, събраното финансиране въпреки всичко ще ни помогне да
направим Хлебарницата макар и по-трудно. Защото вярваме, че времето да разпалим
Хлебната рЕволюция е дошло!

The Impact / Въздействието 
Our mission to revive all the artisan crafts tied to bread baking - milling, pottery, wood carving and so on will contribute to a whole change in the economic situation in our homeland and the Balkans as a whole.
It will contribute to a change in the way people think and bring back long forgotten and lost life and moral values from before the industrialization.
Also it will contribute for revival of the farming as local and smallscale. We work strongly with small farms and if we can only local and all our students who we teach our methods will do the same. This we believe will revive all the regions of Bulgaria and the Balkans.
Educating our customers and the people of every detail around real Bread, flour and all other products of our Craft will clear the market of all those that misuse the trust customers give us and put high prices on low quality products. From this the people will win the most.
The continuation of "The school of Bread Baking and Fermentation" into a new chapter will helps us extend our teachings for the children and educate a new generation of creators and idealists, that will dream and work for a better and more beautiful world.

story:
Short Summary

  • Ryan O'Rourke is the Founder and Roastmaster of Ironclad Coffee Roasters.  He is passionate about specialty coffee, and the heightened standards brought about what has been called the "third wave" movement (ask Ryan more about what that entails if you'd like to know!). 
  • When you come onboard as one of our backers, you are making it possible for us to make the challenging transition from life on the mission field to our new lives back home in the USA.  As you might imagine, several years spent on the mission field do not place one in the most financially advantageous position.  :-)  **This is why we need your help!**

  • This crowdfunding campaign is an essential piece of our plan to establish Ironclad Coffee Roasters and get it to where it needs to be without accruing massive amounts of debt.  Quite simply, if we cannot secure the funds needed, this roastery cannot be established.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We will need to raise a minimum of $25,000 through this crowdfunding campaign.  We have already invested our own capital in the business and will continue to do so as things move along, but we need backers.
  • If we exceed the $25,000 minimum, this would enable us to meet some "stretch goals." This would mean room for a more aggressive marketing budget and other items that will give us a leg-up as the roastery gets rolling.
  • A reliable commercial coffee roaster with a 12-15 kg. capacity will run in the range of $15,000 - $20,000 ... and that's if we can find a pre-owned one!  Other essentials for start-up will be building the ventilation system, weighing scales, storage containers, packaging supplies, our initial green (raw) coffee purchase, membership in SCAA (Specialty Coffee Association of America), business cards / brochures, CRM (Customer Retention Management) software, website creation, and an initial marketing budget.
  • We are offering some exciting and fun perks in appreciation for your support of our dream.   All the perk levels feature something (or many somethings) of high quality that you can share with those you love.  We've done our best to be as generous as possible without defeating the purpose of raising the necessary start-up capital.  See the "perks" section to the right for all the details.

  • We have chosen the "flexible" funding model.  This means even if we do not reach our entire goal, we still come away with what we're able to raise.  Of course, we hope we are able to raise the full amount, because that's what we need!

The Impact

  • "Honest coffee."  That's our company tagline.  We want to make a difference in our community, not only by supplying coffee lovers with the best possible coffee experience, but by donating a portion of our profits to worthy charitable causes in our community.  So, when you help us get this roastery up and running, you also help us "share the love" by giving something back to those in need.  
  • Our experience on the mission field has given us valuable experience in how best to help meet the needs of people who genuinely lack some of life's essentials.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you're not in a position to back us financially right now, you can lend us a hand by creating some "buzz" amongst your own social contacts.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools right on this page to spread the word to your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter, etc.  Please, also, share this with your friends and family who may like to contribute to our campaign but may not be active online.
  • Finally, please sign up for our newsletter to keep up with the latest on what's happening as we build Ironclad Coffee Roasters.
Thank you so very much for your consideration!
story_txt:

Ryan O'Rourke is the Founder and Roastmaster of Ironclad Coffee Roasters.  He is passionate about specialty coffee, and the heightened standards brought about what has been called the "third wave" movement (ask Ryan more about what that entails if you'd like to know!). 


When you come onboard as one of our backers, you are making it possible for us to make the challenging transition from life on the mission field to our new lives back home in the USA.  As you might imagine, several years spent on the mission field do not place one in the most financially advantageous position.  :-)  **This is why we need your help!**



 This crowdfunding campaign is an essential piece of our plan to establish Ironclad Coffee Roasters and get it to where it needs to be without accruing massive amounts of debt.  Quite simply, if we cannot secure the funds needed, this roastery cannot be established.

We have chosen the "flexible" funding model.  This means even if we do not reach our entire goal, we still come away with what we're able to raise.  Of course, we hope we are able to raise the full amount, because that's what we need!    The Impact  
"Honest coffee."  That's our company tagline.  We want to make a difference in our community, not only by supplying coffee lovers with the best possible coffee experience, but by donating a portion of our profits to worthy charitable causes in our community.  So, when you help us get this roastery up and running, you also help us "share the love" by giving something back to those in need.  

 Our experience on the mission field has given us valuable experience in how best to help meet the needs of people who genuinely lack some of life's essentials.  


    Other Ways You Can Help 
Even if you're not in a position to back us financially right now, you can lend us a hand by creating some "buzz" amongst your own social contacts.

Finally, please sign up for our newsletter to keep up with the latest on what's happening as we build Ironclad Coffee Roasters.Thank you so very much for your consideration!

story:
In December 2014, 26 men were arrested and tortured after a raid on a Cairo bathhouse under the "accusation" of homosexuality. The case received much media and international attention mainly for the participation of an Egyptian TV presenter, Mona Iraqi, in the crackdown.  Various detainees reported being tortured and humiliated in custody, with some reporting rape and sexual assault. They were later acquitted and released but this still came at a very high price. Irrespective of wether these men belong to the LGBTIQ community or not, or if they engage in same-sex relations; the accusation and the consequent detention were enough to destroy their lives in a country where homosexuality is constantly persecuted. Social stigma, discrimination, and an immense emotional stress let alone the trauma of the human rights violations they suffered.

In February 2015, one of the released men tried to burn himself to death. 

Today he lays in the hospital between life and death. The costs for the medical attention he urgently needs largely exceeds the economical possibilities of his family. 

“I work in a restaurant” he told Al-Watan newspaper. “I’m harassed constantly in my workplace by the words of the people and the looks in their eyes.” He said that since his acquittal his fearful family controlled his movements and tried to keep him from leaving the house, that one of his brothers insisted on accompanying him everywhere he went, and that he had “no freedom.” As a result, he set himself on fire.

“I am very tired,” he said. He has been confined in one of Cairo’s largest public hospitals since his suicide attempt, and he complained of neglect and mistreatment. Tarek el-Awady, one of the defense lawyers who is now pressing a lawsuit against journalist Mona Iraqi, said the man’s sufferings were due to “the narrowness of the society’s point of view.”

The internationally recognized grassroots network OpAntiSH, Operation Antisexual Harassment and Assault, have decided to contribute by issuing this call and committing to delivering the money to his family. 

Please help by sharing this call for donations, and please donate whatever you can. This is a matter of life or death, you action can make a big difference. 

Let's not lose yet another life to homophobia. 

For further information on the arrest please check this report

To read more about his situation and what happened please check here

story:
Short Summary

The concentration of farms in the Springvale Farm Belt is like no other place in Maine. Within a two-mile radius can be found farmers who raise sheep, beef cattle, apples, mushrooms, berries, vegetables, hops, timber and Christmas trees. They also bottle hard cider and produce maple syrup.

This half-mile trail would branch off the Springvale Rail Trail and make it possible to walk to a half dozen different farms. The finished trail would become part of the annual Springvale Farm Walk. It would also become part of the Sanford trail system open year round.

How it grew

This project grew out of the successful Springvale Farm Walk, which was launched  on Open Farm Day 2014.  Farmers opened their gates and let people walk through to ten farms. This year, Hazen Carpenter, one of the farmers, has pledged to allow a permanent trail across his property if we raise the money to build the trail.  This campaign is a challenge to match his generosity. If we raise the money, he will grant a permanent recreation easement allowing access forever.

You can see it

You can visit the site of the trail before it gets built as part of Springvale Farm Walk July 26, 2015.  And when it's finished you can walk on it as part of Springvale Farm Walk 2016. For details of the walk visit www.sanfordtrails.org

This trail would be unique in Maine. Your donation will help showcase a growing agricultural destination. It will also help make Sanford's trail network  by far the best in the state of Maine!

Contributors

What We Need & What You Get 

  • We need $30,000 to build this half-mile section of trail. We have set a modest fundraising goal of $6,000, which would cover the 20 percent "local match" to apply for a Recreational Trail Program grant in the fall of 2015. We won't need to apply for a grant if we reach the $30,000 mark with fundraising.
  • The money would allow us to purchase stone and crushed gravel and to hire a contractor. Using an excavator, bulldozer, trucks,  grader and compactor, the contractor would truck in material then shape and grade a trail bed 10 feet wide.
  • If you contribute $10 you would receive e-mail updates and photos on the progress of trail construction, culminating in an invitation to attend the trail dedication ceremony. If you contribute $25, you would receive those perks and you would be invited to a group photo shoot with other contributors, Hazen Carpenter and other members of the Trail Committee. If you contribute $100, you would receive those perks and a poster-size trail map suitable for framing. If you contribute $250, your name would be listed as a sponsor on a trailhead marker as well as you would receive the e-mail updates, photos and photo shoot invitation.

The Impact

  • Once built, the trail would be possible to walk from the Springvale Rail Trail to Blanchard Road and Sunset Road. Six farms are either on the trail or a short distance away: Carpenter Farm, Rivard Farm, Noon Family Sheep Farm, Farm, Mousam Valley Mushroom, Blueberry Bend and Rock Island Hop Farm. 
  • The trail would be open year round to non-motorized use. In the winter it would also be open to snowmobile use. 
  • You can count on the Sanford Trails Committee to get it done. We have 15 years experience in trail development.

Risks & Challenges

  • Building this trail is ambitious because so much stone and gravel is needed to provide a dry base for the trail through very wet ground.
  • To help defray costs, we have already arranged to accept clean fill from Sanford Public Works road reconstruction project.
  • If we fall short in our fundraising goals, we can use the money we have raised as the "local match" to apply for a state Recreational Trails Program grant. We have a very good track record in obtaining grant funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help:

  • Tell your friends
  • Share this on Facebook
  • Make some noise!

story:
Please join me on my journey to compete for Miss Ohio United States 2015! I am so humbled and grateful that you've taken the consideration of helping me achieve my dream. I am very excited to be working in my community as Miss Dayton Ohio United States 2015, but I have my eye on the state title for several reasons including: I would like to bring more awareness to my platform (suicide prevention), I would be able to accomplish more professional and personal goals, and this would open the door for me to pursue many new opportunities.

I still need a few things before I will be ready for the pageant and funds will go towards my evening gown, the specified clothes for each portion of the pageant, the hotel expenses, travel costs, food for the weekend, all pageant fees, and all expenses related to competing for Miss Ohio United States 2015.

In 2015, I will be working through my platform (which is a non-profit that I am currently founding) that aims to bring character building among students. My vision is to partner with Miss Ohio United States 2015 to speak in schools about bullying and character development with the underlying goal of suicide prevention. I know I am most certainly tired of turning on the news to find out that, unfortunately, another young person has taken their life. Please join me in getting the word out to students across Ohio that there is hope and let's help our students and communities build character to achieve a life-lasting impact.

Besides my platform, I also am looking to make more achievements in 2015. Through this pageant, I will have many opportunities in politics, fashion, and leadership. I will be using all contributions towards the pageant entry fee, travel, hotel, wardrobe, and all fees associated with Miss Ohio United States 2015.

I am so appreciative for your belief in me and contribution! I can assure you that I will work hard and give it my best. I consider this a job and you have my word that I will be going to work every single day.

XOXO

Keilah Jude

www.KeilahJude.com

story:
Help my godfather come to my Baptism

Hello everyone ! 

My name is Kenzo, I’m 9, and I decided last year to receive baptism. 

This big event will take place in Toulouse area, in south west of France, on April 5th 2015

I’m very excited about it !!

I choose my godmother and my godfather, and I really love both of them.

The big sadness I feel is due to the fact that my godfather now leaves in Australie. He still didn’t get a job, and he can’t pay his plane ticket to come.

I’m really really sad, because he’s my uncle, my best friend, and my godfather. He was supposed to be with me to help me receive my Baptism, but now it’s just not possible for him to come :(

We both of us would really appreciate a little help from anyone around the world, to be able to enjoy together this very big event in my religious life.

Even a 1$ contribution would be appreciated, because it would be one grain of sand that would help us making the best beach of the world.

Many thanks in advance for having read this :)

Kenzo

story:
History
Simply Colors Paint Stores is the culmination of 80 years of family history in the painting industry.  My grandfather Walter "Walt" Williams and my father Fred Williams worked tirelessly for many years building what's now known as Vintage Coatings into one of Georgia's premier paint contracting companies.  In 2001, I accepted the responsibility of carrying on the legacy and by fulfilling our dream of providing contractors and homeowners a complete experience by opening community based paint stores.  Connecting through service, commitment, and expertise is our motto and here at Simply Colors Paint Stores we stand to deliver on our promise.


What We Need & What You Get
  • Our goal is to raise $75,000 which will allow Simply Colors Paint Stores to launch our 1st neighborhood paint store.  
  • Funding for this project will go towards purchasing a fluid management system, inventory, staffing and cash management software.
  • The funding will also allow us to develop a mobile app which will allow our customers to pre-order their purchases and to monitor their accounts on a daily basis.
  • We are signed up to utilize the flexible funding program to provide us with the ability to open our doors even in the event that we do not reach our goal.
  • Our perks include a Certificate of Appreciation, Founder's Plaque, T-shirts, Aprons, and Name your Paint Feature (Free Paint), Free Tickets to a concert or event of your choice.

 


The Impact

  • The days of going to your local paint store and being treated like family have been replaced by all-in-one big box retailers with employees who don't have the expertise needed to turn your idea into a reality.
  • Simply Colors Paint Stores will provide not only the expertise but the experience of working with associates who have over 80 years of know how in the painting industry. 
  • We will bring property owners, contractors, and anyone with a vision together along with our team to create the ultimate masterpiece.
  • Your contribution is the stepping stone to providing an opportunity for our customers to take their ideas and turn them into a colorful masterpiece.
  • Each staff member will be encouraged to volunteer a minimum of 20 service hours within the community each month and Simply Colors Paint Stores will have a coordinator devoted to working with community leaders to seek opportunities where we can be of service
  • In addition to utilizing sustainable practices and to decrease the worlds carbon footprint, we have partnered with Global Paint for Charity who will allow our customers to recycle their left over paint.
  • As a 4th generation painting contractor customer service has been a priority since day one.  Our expertise as a consumer allows us to be the ultimate concierge of paint products and sundries. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't contribute? No worries! Share our story and invite your friends and family to partake in the launch of Atlanta's hidden treasure!
  • You can spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools, follow us on Twitter and like our Facebook page!

story:
Thank you for spending your time to read my story.


I am a young lawyer residing in Athens. I am not from a so-called beneficial family and have always tried to surpass any difficulties regarding my profession, especially now that austerity is a major problem in Greece.


My dream is and has always been to be a member of a law firm where everyone has its role, team work is a primary concern,  is well organised and is open to facilitate any person from any part of the world, no matter where she / he is, as long as our help is requested. Such a law firm can well be described as innovative in Greece, since the majority of lawyers are sole players.


As there are already quite big obstacles to overcome, be they to find a suitable place, have the right people to co-operate, the lack of a starting capital is holding me back. I have found the perfect spot but we cannot move to it.


Thus, I would be really happy if you could share my dream and help me finally materialise it.


Thanks anyway!

story:
Help us to provide life saving support in rural Romania!

We are a Romanian non-profit organization that provides search and rescue
services in the rural areas of Romania/Moldova. The organization consists
of skilled volunteers and experienced professionals, which put their free
time and money in serving the ones in need.

SARS Romania provided their services in case of natural- and other
disasters like the heavy floods in Moldova (2010), forest fires, mountain
rescue, collapsed buildings etc. Unfortunately the financial situation in
Romania doesn't allow for large investments to support life saving
projects, as government funding is virtually non-existent. Therefore we
bring in our own capital to provide as much help when we can, where we
can.

So why do we need help?

We are supported by a lot of experienced personnel from all kinds of fields
(doctors, search dog trainers, military personnel, mountaineers, etc)
though we can't afford the purchase of a vehicle that is capable of
handling the rural roads of the Romanian Carpathians, Retezat and other hard
to reach locations. We are in desperate need of a vehicle which can get a
search team into a hit area as soon as possible, as in cases of mud slides
and avalanches - all seconds count! In the 6 years that we are active we
already invested all of our personal capital in the purchase of life
saving first aid equipment, stretchers, climbing and diving
equipment. As much as it hurts our pride, we are forced to call upon the
public to make sure we can continue what we are doing.

How are we going to do it?

The plan is to raise €10.000,- to purchase and maintain a 2nd hand pick-up
truck. We won't invest in a new vehicle as the depreciation of a new
pick-up would be a giant waste of resources. Instead we choose to invest
it in maintaining, fueling and repairing a rugged (and proven) Toyota
Hilux. The parts are easily to come by, which can be tricky with newer
models and it provides sufficient space to transport supplies and possible
casualties. The pick-up will be fitted with first aid equipment (including
a stretcher, neck braces etc), urban search and rescue (USAR) gear, diving
equipment and climbing gear. All it would take for us to reach that goal is for 100 people donate €100 each.

If we can't raise enough funds to purchase a reliable vehicle, the money
will be invested in medical supplies and additional search and rescue
gear. Please lend us a helping hand by sharing this on social media,
forums, hospital boards and military bases.

We appreciate every penny and will make sure it comes to good use. With
your help we'll be able to fill the needs in the rural areas, where people
are still dying every week because help is simply too late. If you are not
able to spare some money, please feel free to support us by sharing this
on social media or by providing medical supplies (bandaging material,
first aid kits, foldable splints, used stretchers etc), rescue gear or
other things that can support our group.

Vă mulțumim pentru ajutor!
story_txt:
Help us to provide life saving support in rural Romania!We are a Romanian non-profit organization that provides search and rescue
services in the rural areas of Romania/Moldova. The organization consists
of skilled volunteers and experienced professionals, which put their free
time and money in serving the ones in need.

SARS Romania provided their services in case of natural- and other
disasters like the heavy floods in Moldova (2010), forest fires, mountain
rescue, collapsed buildings etc. Unfortunately the financial situation in
Romania doesn't allow for large investments to support life saving
projects, as government funding is virtually non-existent. Therefore we
bring in our own capital to provide as much help when we can, where we
can.

So why do we need help?

We are supported by a lot of experienced personnel from all kinds of fields
(doctors, search dog trainers, military personnel, mountaineers, etc)
though we can't afford the purchase of a vehicle that is capable of
handling the rural roads of the Romanian Carpathians, Retezat and other hard
to reach locations. We are in desperate need of a vehicle which can get a
search team into a hit area as soon as possible, as in cases of mud slides
and avalanches - all seconds count! In the 6 years that we are active we
already invested all of our personal capital in the purchase of life
saving first aid equipment, stretchers, climbing and diving
equipment. As much as it hurts our pride, we are forced to call upon the
public to make sure we can continue what we are doing.

How are we going to do it?

The plan is to raise €10.000,- to purchase and maintain a 2nd hand pick-up
truck. We won't invest in a new vehicle as the depreciation of a new
pick-up would be a giant waste of resources. Instead we choose to invest
it in maintaining, fueling and repairing a rugged (and proven) Toyota
Hilux. The parts are easily to come by, which can be tricky with newer
models and it provides sufficient space to transport supplies and possible
casualties. The pick-up will be fitted with first aid equipment (including
a stretcher, neck braces etc), urban search and rescue (USAR) gear, diving
equipment and climbing gear. All it would take for us to reach that goal is for 100 people donate €100 each.

If we can't raise enough funds to purchase a reliable vehicle, the money
will be invested in medical supplies and additional search and rescue
gear. Please lend us a helping hand by sharing this on social media,
forums, hospital boards and military bases.

We appreciate every penny and will make sure it comes to good use. With
your help we'll be able to fill the needs in the rural areas, where people
are still dying every week because help is simply too late. If you are not
able to spare some money, please feel free to support us by sharing this
on social media or by providing medical supplies (bandaging material,
first aid kits, foldable splints, used stretchers etc), rescue gear or
other things that can support our group.Vă mulțumim pentru ajutor!

story:
Summary

Unity Farm, in Moshav Yishi, is a small (but growing) Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) farm supplying locally grown produce to approximately thirty families.

We are building a sustainable agricultural presence in the land of Israel and doing so in accordance with halacha. In keeping with the laws of shmita, all of our produce is grown in indoor enclosures . However, keeping the laws of shmita is not without its hardships. Being a farmer is never easy and farming during the shmita year is much more difficult than any other year. Growing inside of the enclosures puts our crops at constant risk of high temperatures, harmful insects, viruses, and fungus. On more than one occasion this has resulted in crop loss. Nevertheless we're forging ahead and doing a great job. But due to the difficulties involved, we turn to our friends and fans for the financial support needed to help us make it through this shmitah year. 

Despite limited production due to its being the shmitah year, the farm must continue to pay rent, water, and labor costs. We need $20,000 to get us through the year. Your support will keep us afloat during for the remainder of the shmitah year, thereby allowing you to have a portion in our farm and a role in building a sustainable and halachic agricultural presence in the Holy Land. 

Thank you for your support and encouragement. And may your participation in the laws of shmita and the building of the Holy Land build your families with everything good in ruchius and gashmius. 

Sincerely, 

Binyamin Klempner

P.S. In addition to being a letter of appeal, please consider this correspondence as a being an open invitation to our farm on your next visit is Israel. For questions or to schedule a visit please call me at 212-444-9052. 


What You Get

Donate any amount, whether large or small, and we will begin each day at the farm by mentioning your name in a special prayer for your health and success. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name is Keith Janis and I'm a traditional Lakota living on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation of South Dakota. I am employed as a motivational speaker for the Re-Member Organization --a volunteer organization working to improve the living conditions and lives of the Lakota People. I can be found in the staff directory at this url.  http://www.re-member.org/

 I'm a dedicated Father, Grandfather, Husband and Co-founder of the Green Party. I've also been active in the peace, social and environmental movements for many decades and have travelled extensively promoting social and world change speaking at many schools and Universities across the country.

I also served for a number of years as Chairman of the Head Start Policy Council here in SD. Currently I am the President of the Our Lady of Sorrows Church Council.

The cover photo is of Santana Janis, a 12 yrs old girl that committed suicide on Feb. 4th 2015. As the family was preparing for her services there were two other children being buried in other areas of the Reservation. The week this beautiful child ended her own life there were eight suicides across the Lakota tribal homeland.

 Extreme poverty and 80-90% unemployment renders communities where hopelessness and despair, broken family structures, crime and violence, domestic and child abuse and neglect are permeating.

The incorporation of the United States has had extremely negative consequences on the Lakota people. There's nothing worse than being removed from ones rich culture and traditions then being made to feel like you have absolutely no contribution to the very society that your lands and resources helped create.

In our legally authorized Treaty lands, a territory that is defined in an agreement between the United States and the Lakota people (the 1868 Treaty of Ft. Laramie) we are still on the receiving end of racial hate and intolerance. This is affecting our children that often say "what's the point of living?" No one likes us! In this third millennium when life itself is imperiled our children feel like they are being denied a loving and positive future because of so much hatred. http://aje.io/bpss

The horrible consequences and statistics are staggering. Each year just on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation alone, twenty to thirty children end their lives. Every year there are over five-hundred reported threats with as high as 350 attempts.

 In a ten-year period that's 2-300 suicides (mostly little girls), 5,000 reported threats, and 3,500 attempts that require hospitalization and intervention! These statistics should be unacceptable.

Each year for the past six-years our family has taken in twenty to thirty young girls at risk and nurtured them with unconditional love at a summer math camp we host. We have seen the internal wounds reflecting through the eyes of many we have tried to help.

Santana Janis pictured above is one of the little girls we grew to love over the years and her death has had a profound impact on my children and family. It is in her memory that this campaign/project of love to build and staff the "Santana House" is being launched. Together, we can all share in a part of this vitally important task to save Lakota Children's lives.

At a recent conference held on the reservation, our community came together to discuss ways to help curb and eliminate this problem. The need for safe places like the Santana House was one of several actions that came out of the conference. But we cannot do this alone without your generouse help and contribution.

Jodi Williams the 10th Woman to receive the Nobel Peace Prize in 1997 for her work through her campaign--International Campaign to Ban Landmines has endorsed the Santana House. Jodi who is also a friend that travelled to the Stronghold with me a couple years ago, is also the Chair of "The Nobel Women's Initiative. This is Jodi pictured holding hands with the Dalai Lama.

  The Santana House will be a safe house and serve as a extended family for children that need that additional support, unconditional love and guidance. We hope to offer a fitness room, basketball and tennis court, playground and swimming pool all on site.The facility will also serve as a culturally appropriate community-based tribal resource and invaluable addition to our  child-safety-net where this type of resource is lacking..


Through your generous support and donation to this tremendous undertaking we can begin to rebuild the shattered lives of children facing an uphill climb and sow the seeds of love and hope,

and restore faith that their young lives have meaning. Thank you so much for your time and generosity. 


Respectfully yours in Faith and Hope

Mr. Keith Janis

inila4wakan@hotmail.com

story:
The Sweet Pea Farm has been committed to finding ways to be sustainable, organic, educational, innovative, community minded, globally minded and committed to our future generation.

At The Sweet Pea Farm, we have been growing raspberries and blackberries for the last three years.  It has been a “learn by doing” and “home schooling” atmosphere and we have been successful in producing, in our opinion, the most delicious raspberries on earth using organic practices.  We sell fresh fruit at farmer’s markets, local grocery stores and our farm stand.  Our “Jammin’ Jean’s” raspberry jam has been a market success at the many trade shows we have attended and at farmer’s markets.  This past year, the farm expanded to add 88 egg laying hens, fresh chicken and pork for farm sustainability and for sale in the community.

Project description:Coffee in California has been successfully grown California coast for about four to six years at Good Land Organics and a hand full of farms from San Diego to Morro Bay.  Coffee is typically grown in tropical regions yet it is successful in our temperate climate, which achieves a higher quality bean due to a longer maturation time. With our unique micro-climate and mild temperatures, we have an ideal setting.  We will be experimenting with alternative growing methods in the form of trellising, to achieve the highest quality and yield while using organic pr

Our product targets the concerned, socially conscious, and discriminating consumer who wants the highest quality in the products they buy. On the basis of preliminary market findings, we find that there is a strong market potential in the U.S. and globally for California Coffee. Customers are willing to pay premium prices for coffee with the highest cupping qualities.  At present, coffee grown in California has cupping ratings of between 80 and 94 out of a possible highest rating of 100.

Our project will be in collaboration with the UC Davis Farm Extension for specialty crops and Good Land Organics, the pioneer in California grown coffee.  Professor Mark Gaskell, UC Davis Farm Advisor and Jay Ruskey, owner of Good Land Organics are assisting us with field planning and preparation.  Our vision is to grow coffee on a trellis system dispersed with passion fruit and other specialty fruits to create the highest yield and profitability of both coffee and the other fruits in the minimum amount of space with water efficiency.

story:
Background:

Promless for the Homeless is the result of a couple high school seniors who asked themselves “Am I really going to remember my Prom night in 5 years?” This question turned into an idea, the idea blossomed into a vision. That vision is what you’re reading right now. Prom is supposed to be filled with glamor and opulence to create that special night. Why not share your special night with Seattle's homeless community and provide them with a memory that will last forever?

What is Promless for the Homeless?

Promless for the Homeless is an event meant to replicate as real a prom night as possible for the women of Hope Place women’s shelter. The core of the event will consist of: 

A) Fancy three course dinner 

B) Entertainment and music 

C) Raffle, games, and goodie bags

 On the night of June 13th, volunteers will be going to Hope Place in Seattle to decorate, set up, cook, and serve the women and children there. Various parts of the Newport High School community will be coming together on to make this special night possible. Ranging from the school orchestra to provide entertainment, our culinary class to provide food, and the Honor Society to staff volunteers. 

Why go Promless?

The goal of this event is to restore some dignity to the homeless in the greater Seattle area. Many of the residents probably haven’t had a nice meal served to them in years. As the saying goes “beggars can’t be choosers”, but what if for one night they weren’t beggars. What if they were guests at a deluxe 4 star restaurant? We want them to feel special, loved, cared, and valued as a human being. Hopefully this memory will last both the homeless, and the volunteers for a lifetime.

How can I help?

The total cost of providing a nice three course meal for 90 women, feeding 50 children, as well as making gifts and goodie bags for them will cost about $2500-$3000 dollars. The meals will cost about 10 dollars per adult, and 8 dollars per child. That along with goodie bags, boutonnieres, and setting up a carnival for the children will vary depending on what we can make ourselves. If we exceed our goal of $3000, that money will go directly to Union Gospel Mission for their operations all across Washington.
