story:
A team of brave people from Energy of Life Company, together with residents of local eco settlement, are organizing an expedition to the taiga, and will deliver to your table wholesome and fresh pine nuts within a period of two weeks after the nuts have been shelled.
With your support we will make FRESH AND HEALING SIBERIAN PINE NUTS TO BE YOUR LOCAL FOOD!

 

Siberian pine nuts are completely organic and wild harvested.  They contain no GMOs and come from trees that have not been grafted.  Pine nuts are 100% natural and pure, and may be called the King of Super Foods.

Siberian pine nuts are the most valuable product of all known products obtained from various plants.  On average, any product—whether nuts, fruits, seeds, root vegetables, or berries—takes from three to five months to ripen, and ripening does not occur during the winter.  Pine nuts ripen over a period of two years, and are a much more valuable product for human health.

Pine nuts may completely replace any product, but there is no single product that can replace pine nuts.

Pine nuts have long been used in various cuisines of the world; they are held in high regard for their unique taste and medicinal properties.  With an amazing slightly sweet taste containing hints of milk, pine nuts have been used both in main dishes and desserts.  The nuts have always been a delicacy and a much sought-after ingredient at the tables of nobles and kings.  Modern science has studied the chemical composition of pine nuts and explained their usefulness.

Pine nuts are the absolute record-holders for containing the most vitamins.  For example, in one hundred grams of nuts there are forty-eight recommended daily doses of high-quality vitamin B2; so, to make up a deficiency of this vitamin, you only need to eat two grams of pine nuts a day.  One hundred grams of pine nuts also contain twenty-two recommended daily doses of natural vitamin B1, and forty percent of the recommended daily dose of organic folic acid and vitamin PP.


With regard to minerals, pine nuts are no less amazing.  Two hundred grams of pine nuts contain the recommended daily dose of magnesium.  These nuts are also rich in potassium, phosphorus, and copper.

The protein content of pine nuts is much richer than chicken, pork or ham.  Pine nuts also contain all amino acids, including the essential amino acids, as well as those that are important for children, such as arginine and histidine.  The balanced protein of pine nuts is so close to the protein compounds of human tissue that 99% of this protein is capable of being assimilated by the body.

Siberian pine nuts are a concentrated source of vitamins E and P.  Vitamin E is a powerful antioxidant, capable of neutralizing the oxidizing processes in the body.  As a result of its action, the level of blood cholesterol is lowered, and the body is rejuvenated.

Pine nuts contain much more vitamin E than other popular products, such as olive oil, wheat germ oil, or coconut oil.  Group E vitamins, or tocopherols, are very important and essential for ensuring full transmission of genetic material.  Translated from the Greek, tocopheral means “I bear offspring.”


The most important and significant factor in pine nuts is their content of up to 70% of valuable fats of plant origin of all three types: saturated, monosaturated, and polyunsaturated, including a high quantity of the rarest, and therefore the most valuable fatty acid, Omega-3.  Omega-3 and Omega-6 are contained in pine nuts in an ideal proportion, practically 1:1

Popular scientific literature also points out that the quality of pine growing in Northern areas is much higher than those in the South. Back in 1792 academician P. S. Pallas wrote that the Siberian pine nuts rejuvenate man's power. They also bring back youthfulness, stimulate the immune system considerably, increasing the physical body's resistance against many diseases. World history knows a great number of historical phenomena directly or indirectly connected with pine. Here is one of them. A half literate countryman, Gregory Rasputin, from a remote Siberian village, was from the region where Siberian pine grows. He came to Moscow in 1907 when he was already 50 years of age. He startled the royal family, where he was heartily welcomed, because of his prophecies; He was sexually involved with many distinguished ladies. Those who were trying to kill him were shocked by the fact that having been hit by many bullets, he was still alive. His vitality was amazing. The secret was that he had been brought up in the region where pine grows and he had been fed on pine nuts. The journalists of that period summarized his endurance: “At 50 years of age, he could start an orgy at noon, continuing his drunken ordeals till 4 a. m. After erotic involvement and drinking heavily he went right to church for morning services where he prayed till 8 a.m. After returning home, he drank a lot of tea as if nothing had happened before, Grishka received visitors till 2 p.m. Then accompanied by a group of ladies, he went to a Russian bathhouse with a steamer and then went directly to a suburban restaurant. There he repeated the previous night's performance. No ordinary man could possibly stand up to that kind of routine”. Today, the several times world and Olympic champion in wrestling Alexander Karelin, is also a Siberian, again from the region where Siberian pine grows. The strong man has eaten pine nuts all his life.

What we want to do.


A team of brave people from Energy of Life Company, together with residents of local eco settlement, are organizing an expedition to the taiga, and will deliver, to your table, wholesome and fresh pine nuts within a period of two weeks after the nuts have been shelled.

We collect pine cones that have fallen to the ground by themselves, which ensures a harvest of only ripened cones.

We take the entire cone out of the forest.  Nuts in their cones can be kept for up to three years without any loss of quality.

In the warehouse, we use commercial refrigerators, which ensure the preservation of all the nutritional substances in the pine nut.

After the nuts have been shelled, they are immediately vacuum-packed, which protects the pine nuts from the oxidizing effect of the surrounding air.  In addition, the packaging we use does not contain chlorine.

We do not wait until we have processed all the nuts, but ship out pine nuts in small batches to warehouses in America, Canada, and Germany.

Our warehouses are equipped with commercial freezers, which ensure the maximum preservation of the pine nuts.

Pine nuts are shipped from Russia to America only by airline over the course of two days and only in thermally insulated containers.

Mail delivery of orders is by expedited service.

No more than two weeks goes by from the instant we shell the cones until the time you receive the wholesome pine nuts!  And in these two weeks the nuts are refrigerated.

After you receive your pine nuts, they must be kept in a refrigerator.  For longer storage, the nuts must be placed in a freezer, where they can be kept for up to twelve months without any loss of quality.

Why we come up with this idea

We are big fans of pine nuts, for extensive period of time we try to find fresh Siberian pine nuts in stores. We go through different health food stores in every states which we visit by occasion, we search all internet sites including eBay and Amazon, the best which we found was Italian pine nuts, all other was from China (the main difference between Siberian, Chinese and Italian pine nuts you can find below in FAQ).  All of them were far away from Siberian nuts by the quality, taste and health effect.

We start to think on an idea how to bring healthy Siberian pine nuts to USA.  Our team strongly believe that the residents of greatest country of the world, should have the best products from all over the world, including Siberian pine nuts.
We decide that healing Siberian pine nut will be our team contribution to the bright future of our great country.  

Our team try to cooperate with grocery and organic stores chains.

During the last year our administrators contacted various grocery chain stores to offer fresh pine nuts coming directly from Siberia for realization. However, we received the same reply from the stores: “Chinese suppliers offer cheaper pine nuts”. All our reasoning about low quality and non-fresh pine nuts which might be even dangerous for consumption was dismissed on the ground of unmerciful thesis: “The customers are interested in cheap price first of all, as cheaper as better. The quality is not that important.”

We will never agree with such statement. We believe that every person wants to consume only high quality products and obtain health benefits from them. We’ve decided to address directly to the consumers and offer high quality, fresh Siberian pine nuts.

Our team developed a plan that can radically change the situation.

However, we need your financial support in order to implement a unique and highly productive distribution system – direct marketing of Siberian pine nuts in North America.

All initial financing will be applied to organizing the expedition in Siberian taiga and processing machinery acquisition, including:

-  Off-road vehicle with extra low pressure tires for carrying pine nuts out of taiga which will not damage topsoil (unfortunately there are not roads inside taiga forests)

-  Shelling machinery for pine cones and pine nuts

-  Packing machinery for packaging the pine nuts into vacuum bags

-  Additional commercial freezers

Also substantial financing is required for air transportation of pine nuts to North America.

We've already accomplished much:

-  We rented ecologically pure section of taiga for harvesting pine nuts.

-  We received a special license which allows to export pine nuts outside of Russia.

-  We developed a unique system of direct marketing which allows delivering pine nuts directly to our customers within 2 weeks from the pine nut processing. 

We apply procedures that protect the forest; our technologies for processing pine nuts are the best in the world; the delivery system we have developed is one of the fastest and most sophisticated; our direct-marketing technology excludes a chain of middle-men, which makes it possible to offer you the best price.

We are making an agreement with American company SIBERIAN PINES - a leading distributor of pine products in North America - to be our guarantor and selling agent.

SIBERIAN PINES company has been operating in North America since 2003 and has refrigerated warehouses in Detroit, MI, USA; Toronto, ON, Canada; Dusseldorf, Germany. SIBERIAN PINES delivers all orders through major postal companies such as USPS, UPS and Canada Post using expedited service. All orders are insured.

SIBERIAN PINES is a well known company with good reputation. You can check company website Pinenutoil.org and/or social page at Facebook (about 8000 followers) to eliminate all your concerns.

All orders will be delivered or money back guarantee.

We need your support to make fresh and healing Siberian Pine Nuts to be locally available food!

You will enjoy all the health benefits from Siberian pine nuts—the King of super foods—as local Siberians have been doing for a millennium.


What else can you do?

Please help to spread the word about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo tools, Facebook and Twitter to let your friends, colleagues, communities and others know about the Siberian Pines mission. Every person we reach can make a difference and help to make Siberian Pine Nuts to be a local food to everybody.

Thank you all! 

From the Energy of Life team

NOT JUST ABOUT THE BOTTOM LINE

Energy of Life is a for-profit company, but we also want to incorporate a positive impact on society. We will contribute ten percent of our profits to global ringing cedars movement and eco settlements.


As we grow, we intend to cooperate with residents of eco settlements in Siberia to grow production of wild harvested, organic pine nuts which will create new jobs. We believe when people will have stable job in eco settlement, it will make much easier to move to eco settlement and help protect Siberian pines.

Also we work on preservation and restoring the population of Siberian Pines.

The value of Siberian Pine is noted in the ancient scriptures and contemporary scientific works. To our opinion, it was the most beautifully said about the pine by a resident of Siberia named Anastasia:

God created the pine to store cosmic energy…
Pines live to be five hundred and fifty years old. Day and night their millions of needles catch and store the whole spectrum of bright energy. During the period of the pine’s life all the celestial bodies pass above them, reflecting this bright energy.

 Siberian pine is in need for protection. With your financial support, the team of Energy of Life Company, together with residents of local Eco settlements will be able to plant 5000 seedlings of Siberian pine.


Thank you all! 

Frequently asked questions (FAQ):

Q: Who are they? Are they reliable?

We have dedicated a lot of time and effort to study and organise direct marketing system for Siberian pine nuts. We really want to make Siberian pine nuts your local food. We have a clear plan, are making good progress and will continue to do so.

We are making an agreement with American company SIBERIAN PINES - a leading distributor of pine products in North America - to be our guarantor and selling agent.

SIBERIAN PINES company has been operating in North America since 2003 and has refrigerated warehouses in Detroit, MI, USA; Toronto, ON, Canada; Dusseldorf, Germany. SIBERIAN PINES delivers all orders through major postal companies such as USPS, UPS and Canada Post using expedited service. All orders are insured.

SIBERIAN PINES is a well known company with good reputation. You can check company website Pinenutoil.org and/or social page at Facebook (about 8000 followers) to eliminate all your concerns.

All orders will be delivered or money back guarantee.

If you have any concerns or questions we would be happy to answer you in person.

Q: What will the funds raised be spent on?

We rent 8000 acres of Siberian taiga where we can gather the pine nuts, we have warehouse where we will process and pack pine nuts. However, our production capacities are not enough to maintain stable business. We need additional funds to acquire new and more powerful machinery for processing and carrying out pine nuts from the taiga.

We will spend the funds on making the very highest quality pine nuts and delivery to you.

Q: When I should expect my Siberian pine nuts?

First butch of packed pine nuts we expect to receive in our US warehouse between beginning of December 2015 and end of January 2016 depending on harvest availability and volume of orders. Orders will be sent on the first-buy-first-sent basis.

Q: What about Chinese pine nuts? I saw them in local food store.

Pine nuts must be fresh to benefit the body. But what is going on today? Before they reach a satisfied purchaser in the United States or Canada, pine nuts pass through many middlemen over the course of 16 to 19 months.

As soon as the nuts are extracted from the cone, they begin to lose their medicinal qualities. So, to make the harvesting of the nuts easier, the cones are shelled right in the forest, and only the nuts are brought out. The harvesting takes approximately three to four months. Then the nuts are taken to the base, where hundreds of tons of nuts are accumulated for export to China; this process takes another three to four months. Then the nuts are loaded onto rail cars and moved through Russia and China to the maritime regions of China; this procedure takes from one and a half to two months. To minimize expenses during the process of harvesting and transport, the nuts are stored under awnings in bags or in a pile, and so the nuts are subject to mold, the so-called "blue mold." Naturally, the nuts continue to lose their medicinal properties. One train can contain up to five hundred tons of pine nuts; each year more than twenty thousand tons of pine nuts are exported from Russia to China.

Then the processing of the pine nuts begins. It takes up to five months to process a large quantity of nuts. Afterwards, the nuts are loaded into ship containers and travel to North America, which usually takes two months. But this is not yet all: once in the warehouse, the nuts are distributed to stores and delivered in trucks, which takes another month. How much time passes before you see nuts on the shelves? No one knows, but let's add one more month for the rotation of stock in the stores. In this case, there is no point in even mentioning the storage temperature or even vacuum packaging—here this would be of no help whatsoever. The instant the shell was removed from the nut, the oxidation of the fats in the nuts begins; these processes accelerate at the high temperatures—up to plus 50 degree Celsius—found in the closed, unventilated containers on the deck of a ship exposed to direct sunlight.

So, 19 months goes by! From the day the nuts are found in the forest to the day you buy them in a store: A year and a half! Any type of freshness is out of the question.

And now, pay particular attention! If you thought that the nuts on store shelves being a year and a half old was the biggest problem, you couldn't be more wrong.

In order to increase their profit from the processing of pine nuts, Chinese producers initially extract the oil from the nuts using a chemical means that does not disturb/destroy the structure of the nut. This is done to derive the greatest profit, because pine nut oil is worth more than 80 dollars a kilogram on the market. So, they have already made money from the oil, and they are now making money from the nuts; here is the Chinese "miracle."

This is how it happens:

Obtaining the oil using extraction. The extraction method of removing oil is the most economical and ensures the maximum yield of the raw oil.

Sunflower seeds, pine nuts, cotton seeds, linen seeds, peanuts and others are processed in the same way.

The basis of the extraction process is the ability of vegetable oils to dissolve in organic solvents. In China and other countries, extractive brand Abenzine and petroleum distillates are used as solvents to extract oil from the raw plant materials. Extractive benzines belong to the aliphatic hydrocarbons, and are a mixture of saturated, unsaturated, and a small quantity of aromatic hydrocarbons. They have a boiling point of 63–95ºC. Benzines that contain aromatic hydrocarbons are good at dissolving not only oil, but also fatty substances (phospholipids, pigments, waxes), which degrade the quality of the oil. Then the nuts are dried, washed, and again dried for the purposes of later sale.

Any dietitian will tell you that products like these should not be consumed: they are hazardous to your health.

Here are few facts:

In 2006, in Moscow, for the first time in the centuries-old history of Russia, a large number of cases of food poisoning from pine nuts was recorded.

After a careful investigation, it was revealed that the pine nuts had been brought from China after processing.

That same year, the Russian government placed a ban on the import of pine nuts onto the territory of Russia. Thus, Russians discovered just what "pine mouth" was.

Many people suffer from this problem in the United States; here is an excerpt from an official FDA web-sitehttp://www.fda.gov/Food/RecallsOutbreaksEmergencies/SafetyAlertsAdvisories/ucm247099.htm:

In the past year FDA has received a number of consumer complaints regarding a bitter metallic taste associated with pine nuts. This taste, known as "pine mouth," typically begins 12 to 48 hours after consuming pine nuts, and lasts on average between a few days and two weeks. It is exacerbated by consumption of any other food during this period and significantly decreases appetite and enjoyment of food.

In addition, anyone interested can familiarize themselves with the problem by typing pine mouth into any search engine.

Another problem is the corruption associated with the export of the nuts from Russia to China. Pursuant to Russian legislation, a special licence must be obtained to export nuts outside of Russia. According to official statistics, licences were issued in 2014-2015 for the export of only 100 tons of nuts, including the licence issued to our company. But according to the statistics kept by human rights organizations, including the World Wildlife Federation, more than twenty thousand tons of pine nuts were exported from Russia to China!

If you ask any pine nut harvester in Siberia, where the pine nuts are sold, you will be told that they are sold to China without any licences. This is possible because of certain people who, for a bribe, are prepared to transport any quantity of nuts across the border.

Because of corruption and production technologies that are hazardous to health, which the people processing the nuts fail to mention. Russian companies, including ours, do not even have a chance to deliver quality products when faced with the lowered prices and unscrupulous competition of Chinese producers.

Q: What about Italian pine nuts?

Italian pine nuts, off course, much better then Chinese ones, but they cannot be considered organic and wild harvested because they are grooving in artificial plantations in Italy and as any cultivated plant goes through fertilisation proses.

Also back in 1792 Academician P. S. Pallas has told us that the healing qualities of pine increase as one moves closer to the border of forest tundra. This means that the Siberian one is more powerful.

Other problem is freshness of Italian pine nuts, in any case it will take several month before you buy them in local store.

The main problem with Italian pine nuts, that they are grafted on fast growing, nutless pine tree. You can find many warnings from different sources about danger of grafted plants.
story_txt:
A team of brave people from Energy of Life Company, together with residents of local eco settlement,
are organizing an expedition to the taiga, and will deliver to your
table wholesome and fresh pine nuts within a period of two weeks after the nuts
have been shelled.
With your support we will make FRESH AND HEALING SIBERIAN PINE NUTS
TO BE YOUR LOCAL FOOD! 

Siberian pine nuts are completely organic and wild
harvested.  They contain no GMOs and come
from trees that have not been grafted. 
Pine nuts are 100% natural and pure, and may be called the King of Super
Foods.
Siberian pine nuts are the most
valuable product of all known products obtained from various plants.  On average, any product—whether nuts, fruits,
seeds, root vegetables, or berries—takes from three to five months to ripen,
and ripening does not occur during the winter. 
Pine nuts ripen over a period of two years, and are a much more valuable
product for human health.
Pine nuts may completely replace
any product, but there is no single product that can replace pine nuts.
Pine nuts have long been used in various cuisines of the
world; they are held in high regard for their unique taste and medicinal
properties.  With an amazing slightly
sweet taste containing hints of milk, pine nuts have been used both in main
dishes and desserts.  The nuts have
always been a delicacy and a much sought-after ingredient at the tables of
nobles and kings.  Modern science has
studied the chemical composition of pine nuts and explained their usefulness.
Pine nuts are the absolute
record-holders for containing the most vitamins.  For example, in one hundred grams of nuts
there are forty-eight recommended daily doses of high-quality vitamin B2; so,
to make up a deficiency of this vitamin, you only need to eat two grams of pine
nuts a day.  One hundred grams of pine
nuts also contain twenty-two recommended daily doses of natural vitamin B1, and
forty percent of the recommended daily dose of organic folic acid and vitamin PP.
With regard to minerals, pine nuts
are no less amazing.  Two hundred grams
of pine nuts contain the recommended daily dose of magnesium.  These nuts are also rich in potassium,
phosphorus, and copper.
The protein content of pine nuts
is much richer than chicken, pork or ham. 
Pine nuts also contain all amino acids, including the essential amino
acids, as well as those that are important for children, such as arginine and
histidine.  The balanced protein of pine
nuts is so close to the protein compounds of human tissue that 99% of this
protein is capable of being assimilated by the body.
Siberian pine nuts are a concentrated source of vitamins E
and P.  Vitamin E is a powerful
antioxidant, capable of neutralizing the oxidizing processes in the body.  As a result of its action, the level of blood
cholesterol is lowered, and the body is rejuvenated.
Pine nuts contain much more vitamin E than other popular
products, such as olive oil, wheat germ oil, or coconut oil.  Group E vitamins, or tocopherols, are very
important and essential for ensuring full transmission of genetic
material.  Translated from the Greek,
tocopheral means “I bear offspring.”
The most important and significant factor in pine nuts is
their content of up to 70% of valuable fats of plant origin of all three types:
saturated, monosaturated, and polyunsaturated, including a high quantity of the
rarest, and therefore the most valuable fatty acid, Omega-3.  Omega-3 and Omega-6 are contained in pine
nuts in an ideal proportion, practically 1:1
Popular scientific literature also points out that the
quality of pine growing in Northern areas is much higher than those in the
South. Back in 1792 academician P. S. Pallas wrote that the Siberian pine nuts
rejuvenate man's power. They also bring back youthfulness, stimulate the immune
system considerably, increasing the physical body's resistance against many
diseases. World history knows a great number of historical phenomena directly
or indirectly connected with pine. Here is one of them. A half literate
countryman, Gregory Rasputin, from a remote Siberian village, was from the
region where Siberian pine grows. He came to Moscow in 1907 when he was already
50 years of age. He startled the royal family, where he was heartily welcomed,
because of his prophecies; He was sexually involved with many distinguished
ladies. Those who were trying to kill him were shocked by the fact that having
been hit by many bullets, he was still alive. His vitality was amazing. The
secret was that he had been brought up in the region where pine grows and he
had been fed on pine nuts. The journalists of that period summarized his
endurance: “At 50 years of age, he could start an orgy at noon, continuing his
drunken ordeals till 4 a. m. After erotic involvement and drinking heavily he
went right to church for morning services where he prayed till 8 a.m. After
returning home, he drank a lot of tea as if nothing had happened before,
Grishka received visitors till 2 p.m. Then accompanied by a group of ladies, he
went to a Russian bathhouse with a steamer and then went directly to a suburban
restaurant. There he repeated the previous night's performance. No ordinary man
could possibly stand up to that kind of routine”. Today, the several times
world and Olympic champion in wrestling Alexander Karelin, is also a Siberian,
again from the region where Siberian pine grows. The strong man has eaten pine
nuts all his life.
What we want to do.
A team of brave people from Energy of Life Company, together with
residents of local eco settlement, are organizing an expedition to the
taiga, and will deliver, to your table, wholesome and fresh pine nuts within a
period of two weeks after the nuts have been shelled.
We collect pine cones that have
fallen to the ground by themselves, which ensures a harvest of only ripened
cones.
We take the entire cone out of the
forest.  Nuts in their cones can be kept
for up to three years without any loss of quality.
In the warehouse, we use commercial refrigerators, which
ensure the preservation of all the nutritional substances in the pine nut.
After the nuts have been shelled, they are immediately
vacuum-packed, which protects the pine nuts from the oxidizing effect of the
surrounding air.  In addition, the
packaging we use does not contain chlorine.
We do not wait until we have
processed all the nuts, but ship out pine nuts in small batches to warehouses
in America, Canada, and Germany.
Our warehouses are equipped with commercial freezers, which
ensure the maximum preservation of the pine nuts.
Pine nuts are shipped from Russia to America only by airline
over the course of two days and only in thermally insulated containers.
Mail delivery of orders is by expedited service.
No more than two weeks goes by
from the instant we shell the cones until the time you receive the wholesome
pine nuts!  And in these two weeks the
nuts are refrigerated.
After you receive your pine nuts, they must be kept in a
refrigerator.  For longer storage, the
nuts must be placed in a freezer, where they can be kept for up to twelve
months without any loss of quality.
Why we come up with
this idea

We are big fans of pine nuts, for extensive period of time we try to find fresh
Siberian pine nuts in stores. We go through different health food stores in every
states which we visit by occasion, we search all internet sites including eBay
and Amazon, the best which we found was Italian pine nuts, all other was from
China (the main difference between Siberian, Chinese and Italian pine nuts you
can find below in FAQ).  All of
them were far away from Siberian nuts by the quality, taste and health effect.

We start to think on an idea how to bring healthy Siberian pine nuts to USA.  Our team strongly believe that the residents
of greatest country of the world, should have the best products from all over
the world, including Siberian pine nuts. 
We decide that healing Siberian pine nut will be our team contribution to the bright
future of our great country.  

Our team try to cooperate with grocery and organic stores chains.
During the
last year our administrators contacted various grocery chain stores to offer

We will never agree with such statement. We believe
that every person wants to consume only high quality products and obtain health

offer high quality, fresh Siberian pine nuts. 

Our
team developed a plan that can radically change the situation.
However, we need your financial support in order to
implement a unique and highly productive distribution system – direct marketing
of Siberian pine nuts in North America.
All initial financing will be applied to organizing
the expedition in Siberian taiga and processing machinery acquisition,
including:
- 
Off-road
vehicle with extra low pressure tires for carrying pine nuts out of taiga which
will not damage topsoil (unfortunately there are not roads inside taiga
forests)
- 
Shelling
machinery for pine cones and pine nuts
- 
Packing
machinery for packaging the pine nuts into vacuum bags
- 
Additional
commercial freezers
Also substantial financing is required for air
transportation of pine nuts to North America.

- 
We rented
ecologically pure section of taiga for harvesting pine nuts.
- 
We received a
special license which allows to export pine nuts outside of Russia.
- 
We developed a
unique system of direct marketing which allows delivering pine nuts directly to
our customers within 2 weeks from the pine nut processing.

Another problem is the corruption associated with the export of the nuts from Russia to China. Pursuant to Russian legislation, a special licence must be obtained to export nuts outside of Russia. According to official statistics, licences were issued in 2014-2015 for the export of only 100 tons of nuts, including the licence issued to our company. But according to the statistics kept by human rights organizations, including the World Wildlife Federation, more than twenty thousand tons of pine nuts were exported from Russia to China!
If you ask any pine nut harvester in Siberia, where the pine nuts are sold, you will be told that they are sold to China without any licences. This is possible because of certain people who, for a bribe, are prepared to transport any quantity of nuts across the border.
Because of corruption and production technologies that are hazardous to health, which the people processing the nuts fail to mention. Russian companies, including ours, do not even have a chance to deliver quality products when faced with the lowered prices and unscrupulous competition of Chinese producers.
Q: What about Italian pine nuts?
Italian pine nuts, off course, much better then Chinese ones, but they cannot be considered organic and wild harvested because they are grooving in artificial plantations in Italy and as any cultivated plant goes through fertilisation proses.
Also back in 1792 Academician P. S. Pallas has told us that the healing qualities of pine increase as one moves closer to the border of forest tundra. This means that the Siberian one is more powerful.
Other problem is freshness of Italian pine nuts, in any case it will take several month before you buy them in local store.
The main problem with Italian pine nuts, that they are grafted on fast growing, nutless pine tree. You can find many warnings from different sources about danger of grafted plants.

story:
OUR STORY

In 2002, Elissa started a NY-style pizza stand in Sandpoint, ID. Although it had the great potential of being a successful business, she wanted to get back into education, and so closed Romeo's Pizza for good in 2004. That summer, she fell in love with Steven, and he fell in love with her (and her pizza!) Over the next eleven years, they worked together with "at risk" teenagers and young adults (five years out of their own home), specializing in life skills. Meal times were always a place to come together, debrief the day, and share great food. Pizza night was especially popular! Although this business also had the great potential of being successful, we never recovered from the financial crisis of 2008 and so, with much dismay, decided to dissolve our transition program in 2013. Pondering "what's next?", Steven came up with the idea of running a mobile wood fired pizza business...the seeds were being planted.

Away from Sandpoint for seven years, we moved back in July of 2015. Every day we would run into various people around town who would continuously ask Elissa if she was going to make pizza again. With so much support from such an awesome community, Elissa began to warm up to Steven's idea. Then one night, after watching the movie "Chef" (about a family who works together in a mobile food truck), Elissa turned to Steven and said, "That looks like fun! Let's do it!" And so we went to Denver for three days of wood fired pizza university (thank you "Fire Within") and drove home with our new pizza trailer! 

For six months, we worked out many kinks through all the elements of North Idaho selling pies to the 1st through 8th grade students at the Sandpoint Waldorf School as a fundraiser for the 8th grade class trip. We opened full time in June at a mobile food court and traveled around A LOT to various events all around town. The result? Many happy locals and tourists, from Sandpoint lifers to grandparents visiting from Spain, enjoying that Olde World flavor, gathering around our fire, and walking away with full bellies and many smiles.

Why is Mandala Pizza going to be successful?

Recently we received our highest compliment: "I feel like I just stepped off the bus in Sicily! This pizza tastes exactly like it does there. You've nailed it!" We are the only chefs in town that offer wood fired, Napolitana-style, and mobile pizza. We import our flour, tomatoes, prosciutto, and Parmesan from Italy. All of our pies are made fresh on the spot, and are free of GMO's, hormones, antibiotics, nitrates, and pesticides. We support local farmers. But, what really makes our pizza taste oh so good is the amount of love and good intentions we infuse into our food.

The word "mandala" means "round" in Sanskrit, but on a deeper level means"offering". So, we make and serve "round offerings" with the intention that they benefit all living beings. Our long term goal is to donate a portion of our profits to help underprivileged Nepali students go to school. How awesome is that? Thank you for considering an offering to us so that we may continue to make offerings to others!

Where will the money go and what are the risks?

All the funds raised will go towards paying off the cost of our mobile, wood-fired pizza trailer. Yes, it is one spendy trailer, but the quality cannot be surpassed. The oven frames are made in Italy, designed specifically to be mobile, and then shipped to Fort Collins, CO to be finished and custom mounted on the trailer of your choice. We went for the deluxe version so that we could travel to any event and be completely self-contained. Our trailer has ample storage space under the oven, a space to dolly on and off our prep table with refrigeration, and a triple sink. We can hook up to power and water or run off of our generator. After operating this trailer for the past year, we can honestly say that we are 100% satisfied with our choice!

The risk of all businesses is that they will fail. Of course, as human beings, this thought has gone through our brains too, but after seeing how great of a summer we had (and nearly every other person asking us, "Where's your restaurant?"), there's not a doubt in our minds that we will be successful. When the going gets tough, Steven always says, "Work hard. Stay in agreement. Keep going. Don't stop!" 

Why should you fund this campaign?

With every dough ball we roll in our hands, we deliberately create the intention that our pizza is made for the benefit of all living beings. A wise wizard once said, "The world at its worst needs us at our best." With your kind and generous support, whether financially or passing this campaign on via social media (please do!), we will continue to do what we do best- making the world a better place, one pizza at a time.

story:
Unemployment and Crime is crippling South Africa and the rest of the continent...

Youth unemployment often exceeds 80% among poor communities in South Africa, this making the lure of crime incredibly high. Often it is the responsibility of the youth to look after their direct and indirect family, yet there are few jobs, and certainly even fewer which can pay enough to allow families to support themselves. This means that even tough who are punished for committing crimes often resort back to crime as it is the only sustainable way they see to make money.

BrothersForAll to save the day!!!

While the government may have failed the people of South Africa, BrothersForAll have stepped up to fill the void. They are a small nonprofit organisation making big waves in the community of Langa and around South Africa. 
Started and run by Sihle Tshabalala the organisation seeks to change lives by teaching programming and web design skills to anyone who walks into their centre, and to a select group of prisoners at a few prisons in the Western Cape. 
The only way to reduce crime and the reoffending rate is through education, and only by educating those people will the correct, real world applicable skills will they be able to help themselves and help each other out of the situations they find themselves in. (www.brothersforall.org)

How do I fit in

I am an embedded software engineer who has fallen in love with everyone at the BrothersForAll centre. I have a passion for programming and technology and I am a firm believer in teaching a man to fish!

The learners and mentors at the BrothersForAll centre are the most passionate people I have ever met, They spend every conceivable hour there every day, some working tirelessly from 8am - 10pm, 7 days a week to learn and teach each other about programming and life, it is truly inspiring. 

I have taken it upon myself to raise funds and awareness for BrothersForAll so they may continue to change lives, and so they do not need to worry about where the next slice of funds will come from. To do this I have chosen to climb Kilimanjaro!!! 

I am all booked and paid up to hike from 25 September until 2 October 2015, and will be tackling the mountain via the Machame route! :)

Why Kilimanjaro?

Kilimanjaro is the highest freestanding mountain in the World, and is one of Africa's greatest mountaineering challenges! While I climb to raise the BrothersForAll flag from the top of Africa, I will know that men and woman are heard at work at the BrothersForAll to tackle one of Africa's biggest socio-economic challenges! (the lack of education and the huge need for job creation)

What We Need & What You Get

While the Brothers For All project has a few loyal supporters and sponsors, they are still coming off short. Some of the challenges Brothers For All are still facing are:

  • They cannot get have fixed line internet to their centre and thus have to rely on 3G and wireless, which is incredibly expensive.
  • They do not have enough laptops for all the students, often 2 or 3 students are sharing a single computer.
  • They travel to and from prisons at their own cost, and this limits the contact time with prisoners which in turn limits the effectiveness of the program.
  • Their rent is expensive, and their centre is fairly small and growing rapidly, so they will likely need a new place soon. Additional funds could help them expand.
The money raised through this fundraiser will be donated to BrothersForAll, to help them grow and extend their reach across South Africa and the World!!!
In return for your support I offer to you some amazing thank you gifts, but the real joy comes from knowing how many lives you have changed!! :)

The Impact

BrothersForAll is the one of the first projects driven by a community to teach prisoners skills which really matter in the 21st century. The entire system is based on peer to peer learning, and whereby the top community students visit prions and teach prisoners, and every student is made completely responsible for their own learning. All students are encouraged to share knowledge, and brain storm ideas and just have fun. 

Furthermore, Sihle (The founder of BrothersForAll), dreams of spreading the BrothersForAll concept internationally, and has already been in discussions with many people from around the world for starting up chapters in Europe, USA and other African countries. The funding raised here can help Sihle and Brothers For All grow into one of the most successful peer based educational initiatives in the World. 

The BrothersForAll project not only creates jobs for the future, but helps bridge the digital divide that leaves impoverished communities to fend for themselves. By empowering the people in these communities we will start to see the communities joining together to solve their own problems using technology. This is already in action, where prisoners in the Brothers For All program have shown interest in building a more automated prisoner management system, to help prisons better check prisoners in and out.

You can find and follow the KilimajaroForAll event on facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/KilimanjaroForAll 

For more information on Brothers For All and the visionaries behind it, see:

http://www.brothersforall.org/

http://leadsa.co.za/?p=21689

http://www.destinyconnect.com/2015/04/08/on-mans-journey-from-child-genius-to-convict-to-community-uplifter/

http://www.htxt.co.za/2015/03/26/can-teaching-sa-prisoners-to-code-reduce-the-number-of-repeat-offenders/

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2015/04/10/prison-reform-international-examples_n_6995132.html

http://ventureburn.com/2015/04/brothers/

http://finweek.com/2015/05/07/entrepreneur-discovering-the-code-to-unlock-opportunities/ 

Risks & Challenges

Climbing Kilimanjaro is not without risks and obstacles, but with proper preparation I can keep them low.

The biggest risk I face is not getting to the summit. Kilimanjaro has a 40% success rate and altitude sickness is the greatest threat. But to prevent this I will take the necessary training and acclimatisation measures, and I will be in the hands of some well experienced guides.

If I do suffer from altitude sickness, and cannot summit, I will do get one of my fellow hikers to fulfil my promises and raise the flag at the summit!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially then please spread the word about Brothers For All. Let people know we are out there making a real difference to real lives. And spread the word about this campaign.

Additionally you could donate old laptops to Brothers For All as they are always in need of more computers. If you wish to do this please contact Sihle, or me to organise the best way to get it to Brothers For All.

story:
The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website

Buying Local Just Got a Whole Lot Easier!

The Mobile App and Website (the only local business driven app) provides a dynamic, searchable, mapping platform for users to effortlessly locate unique, independently owned coffeehouses and micro-roasters across the United States. Coffeehouses and micro-roasters are popping up all over America begging to be discovered!

            


The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website offers a nationwide map displaying the location information of coffeehouses, cafes and micro-rosters. This not only provides retailers with local visibility but with national visibility as well. Additionally, consumers can easily find these independent businesses and ultimately support the local economies they live in and visit.

Let's give local business a fighting chance by significantly improving the interface of The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website!


Why Local

The Specialty Coffee Association of America (SCAA) reports that there are over 29,300 independent coffeehouse retailers in the US.

Corporate chains continue to infiltrate communities defacing the character of US towns with cookie-cutter layouts and corporate culture. This may sound dramatic, but it is important to be aware of the fact that mom-n-pops are being pushed out every day. Our app helps local economies thrive by making local business easier to find wherever you are.


Why Coffee and Coffeehouses

Our founder, Lisa McIntyre, has personally visited hundreds of locally-owned and operated coffeehouses and micro-roasters and has had many one-on-one discussions with the owners and managers. She learned that these entrepreneurs tend to be more involved in their own local communities. They participate in community happenings, often provide the venue for community gatherings and are always conscious of how they can and do give back. Coffeehouses truly are a pinnacle of their communities.

Lisa also discovered that the owners express their unique interests and passions inside and out of the hand crafted environments they’ve built. This offers a unique experience for every customer. Here are just a few examples of some of the creativity and passion that breathes in these local businesses:

  • A fabulous coffeehouse in Dubois, WY displays a wall of fallen soldiers from the region,
  • A coffeehouse in Denver, CO changes your oil while you relax over a cappuccino.
  • A coffeehouse and laundromat in Portland, OR provides state-of-the-art washers and dryers amid artistic strings of found socks.

Brick and mortar coffeehouses, cafes and roasters bring people together, however the coffee itself is also central to American culture. We wake up to our cup of coffee each morning. Coffee is part of every office meeting and social gathering. It also expresses itself (with the help of java-obsessed people) creatively when growing, harvesting, roasting and preparing the perfect cup.

The Impact: The Local Coffeehouse Guide Benefits Local Business

The App and Website level the playing field, Little Shop vs. National Chain, by acting as a marketing department (so to speak) for the independently owned business members in the directory. This is facilitated by providing them with free listings in the directory as well as custom tailored robust marketing tools that will significantly increase their online and mobile visibility in their surrounding areas and nationally.  Their listings alone, combined with the multi-platform national marketing of the app and website will allow these small businesses to compete more effectively as a community of small businesses against corporate chains. This level of visibility and exposure would typically be unattainable for most small businesses to achieve on their own.

Photo taken inside a local coffeehouse in Denver, Colorado.

A FREE claimed listing provides a retail location with the following on both the mobile app and website:

  • A map marker that automatically geo-locates the user.
  • A listing that displays their information; address with a link to directions from the user's current location, a link to the retailer's desired URL, a photo of their location and a place to share their story or a brief description of their location.
  • We highly encourage our retailers to share their personal story in order to really connect with people even before they walk through the door. This feature truly separates us from the rest.

The additional tools we offer our members are push notes to app users in their area, searchable defining characteristics (gluten free, patio, drive-thru, etc), animated map markers to draw extra attention to their location, and much more.

In early 2016 we will be offering three levels of paid membership which include the claimed listing specifications (above) complimented with the additional tools (i.e. push notes, categories, and animated markers). Also in early 2016 we will be offering all of our tools a la carte to members as well. To learn more about our membership programs and the tools for retailers, please visit our membership page.

Retailer Criteria for Inclusion in the Directory:

In order for a local coffeehouse, cafe or micro-roaster to be represented in our directory they must meet the following criteria:
  • Location must be locally-owned, independent businesses. No corporate chains or franchises are eligible.
  • All locations must serve espresso drinks as a primary product offering or be a small batch roaster.
  • The business has 10 or less locations in the US.
  • Locations must be in the United States.

The Local Coffeehouse Guide Benefits Coffee Drinkers

According to USA Today (4/9/13), 83% of adults in the US drink some kind of coffee daily and the National Coffee Association reports that 34% of adults drink specialty coffees daily.

We currently have over 16,000 coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters in the directory and more are added everyday. The app is a user-friendly tool for consumers to find the independent specialty shops nearby - anywhere in the US from the palm of their hand.

The app locates the consumer then provides an on-map display and list of all the coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters nearest them. It's perfect for travelers exploring a new town or for local residents interested in pursuing a new local experience in their own communities.

Photo from a filmed interview with one of the owners of Kaladi Bros. Coffee in Denver, 2013

Early Achievements

The Local Coffeehouse Guide App & Website has gained a significant following on social media. On both Facebook & Twitter, the App and Website have been very well received by coffee retailers and coffee lovers alike. The independent coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters are pleased with the increased visibility they’ve gained thus far. Coffee lovers, travelers, home office professionals and students have been thrilled to have a reliable, easy and interactive way to support the local economies they live in and visit.

The following milestones have been achieved:

Phase One – Creation of a Business Model

  • Market Research
  • Product Development
  • Corporate Culture
  • Business Plan
  • Legal Representation
  • Accounting Representation

Phase Two – Mobile App Development:

  • Structure, layout, functionality and basic design.
  • Implementation, customization and successful beta of a mobile responsive map directory for both Android and iOS.
  • Submission and acceptance to iTunes (Apple) and Google Play Store.

Phase Three – Website Development:

  • Structure, layout, functionality and basic design.
  • Implementation, customization and successful beta of a desktop map directory.
  • Implementation, customization and successful beta of a membership interface for retailers (coffeehouses, cafes & micro-roasters) to access and manage their individual listings.

Phase Four - API Bridge Build:

  • Development and implementation of an API bridge connecting the app, the website and the membership platform with a customer relations management system (CRM).

Phase Five - New/Improved Mobile Responsive Map:

  • Customization, functionality, design and successful beta of a new/improved map releasing January of 2016.

Details: The current map in the app is very limited for users and retailers additionally it does not display on Droid devices correctly. After months of research and testing - we've finally found the map that will work with both Android and iOS. The new map will provide users with the ability to search for coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters by radius, by characteristics (i.e. Wi-Fi, bookstore, live music etc.) and searchable by business name nationwide. Additionally, the new map will provide retailers with a multitude of tools that will help them reach the residents and visitors of their area directly, effectively and timely.

Phase Six - Monetization:

  • Retailer membership package development and pricing
  • Creation of third party sponsorship, partnering and advertising
  • Development of promotional items for retailers and for The Local Coffeehouse Guide (i.e. coffee mugs, buttons, post cards, etc.)

Final Stages

The final stages required to complete the build of The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website need more than what our bootstrapping budget can provide. We are thrilled with the headway we've made thus far but we have a few more hurtles to overcome. The following are the remaining steps that need to be taken in order to get The Local Coffeehouse Guide up and running to its fullest potential:

  • Native App Build iOS and Android: The platform we currently use to house the mobile app is extremely limited for monetization, conversion tracking, advertising and marketing. Therefore, it is crucial for the success of the app that we begin a native build immediately before the business outgrows the current platform.
  • E-Commerce for the App: Development and implementation of a store for users to purchase The Local Coffeehouse Guide promotional items. (Postcards, coffee mugs, micro-roast coffee club, etc.)
  • E-Commerce for the Website: Development and implementation of an online store for retailer’s only (outside of membership packages) offering marketing tools and promotional items.
  • Website Overhaul: Acquisition of a professional web development team to streamline the website with special attention to retailer membership, e-commerce, content, general design and SEO maximization.
  • Advertising & Marketing: Acquisition of agency representation for on-going regional and national campaigns.

Fundraising

The Local Coffeehouse Guide App & Website will allocate the raised funds as follows:

  • Native App Build for iOS and Android: $40,000
  • E-Commerce for App & Website: $3,000
  • Website Overhaul: $5,000
  • Advertising & Marketing: $52,000
This fundraising campaign will take The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website to the next level, serving and supporting local economies nationwide. 

Founder - Lisa McIntyre

The Local Coffeehouse Guide is the brainchild of Lisa McIntyre. Her passion for local gathering places began as a child in her grandparent's bakery. For thirty years, Ray & Lottie Filer were devoted to their business and the (then) small community of Glendale, Arizona. They worked 15 hours a day to provide handmade breads, pastries and wedding cakes to their neighbors and friends. They lived in the 1 bedroom apartment above their bakery for many years until they could afford a house separate from the business. These small family businesses are part of America's economic and cultural history. Lisa sees these "mom-and-pops" as a central part of our future as well, as we seek reprieve from corporate "sameness" and relish neighborhood gathering places.

Lisa is a mother, an adventurer, an angler, a writer and entrepreneur who loves to travel and explore the back roads of America. She is a minimalist and currently "lives small" in the Mile High City of Denver, Colorado USA, the world headquarters of The Local Coffeehouse Guide.

Coffeehouses are essential gathering places in each community across the map. These little spots give locals an intimate place to share art, conversation, and music; to hold fundraising events, to play board games, to study and to work. 

While on her travels, Lisa discovered that finding these local spots was a huge challenge, even when asking locals where to go. She came up with the idea of The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website to make all of them easy to locate, right from the palm of your hand.

Lisa has devoted countless hours over the past several years to developing the App and Website, and worked many part-time and full-time jobs to bootstrap the launch of The Local Coffeehouse Guide. Now, however, it's time to play big.


Co-Founder - Guinivere Stevenson

In September of 2013, Guinivere joined Lisa as a contributing partner of The Local Coffeehouse Guide. Since then she has worked alongside Lisa in the development of a sustainable business model catering to independent, locally owned coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters throughout the United States. Together they have worked tirelessly to create, build and fund The Local Coffeehouse Guide App to its present state.

Guinivere Stevenson began her career in marketing/advertising in 1997 with advertising sales in newspaper, radio and magazine. In 1998 Guinivere was invited to sit on the Marketing Board of the Steamboat Springs Chamber of Commerce, the governing body of the Summer Advertising Campaigns of the town of Steamboat Springs, Colorado. Additionally, throughout '97-'05 Guinivere was contracted/employed for the role of Marketing Director of a non-profit health organization, a retail cooperative, a coal mine training and consulting business, and a historic Denver nightclub.

In 2005, Guinivere began her journey in film-making; in 2007 she returned to college to get her Bachelors in Fine Arts with an emphasis in Film Writing and Direction at the University of Colorado Denver. Since 2005, she has produced/directed a number of short narrative films, two documentaries (both short and feature length), a web series, a music video and roughly one hundred promotional, educational and commercial videos. She also owns and operates ArchedBrow Productions, a production company in Denver, Colorado that specializes in commercial/corporate videos for broadcast and online streaming.


Everyone Can Help

There are many ways to support The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and keeping independent businesses strong:

  • Download the app! Apple/iTunes or Droid/Google Play
  • Select a Perk from the right column that suits you; contribute a certain dollar amount and receive a special gift from us and our deep gratitude.
  • Use the Indiegogo social media tools to share this chance to support local business with your friends and colleagues.
  • Tell your favorite coffeehouse about the app and website & encourage them to become a member. You can also add your favorite spot to our directory in the app - just click on the update list button on the landing page!
  • Become one of our community bloggers: share your coffeehouse experiences with The Local Coffeehouse Guide community.

Thank you for supporting local business.

Buying local just got a whole lot easier!
story_txt:
The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website 
Buying Local Just Got a Whole Lot Easier!
The Mobile App and Website (the only local business driven app) provides a dynamic, searchable, mapping platform for users to effortlessly locate unique, independently owned coffeehouses and micro-roasters across the United States. Coffeehouses and micro-roasters are popping up all over America begging to be discovered! 

             

The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website offers a nationwide map displaying the location information of coffeehouses, cafes and micro-rosters. This not only provides retailers with local visibility but with national visibility as well. Additionally, consumers can easily find these independent businesses and ultimately support the local economies they live in and visit. Let's give local business a fighting chance by significantly improving the interface of The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website!

Why Local

The Specialty Coffee Association of America (SCAA) reports that there are over 29,300 independent coffeehouse retailers in the US.Corporate chains continue to infiltrate communities defacing the character of US towns with cookie-cutter layouts and corporate culture. This may sound dramatic, but it is important to be aware of the fact that mom-n-pops are being pushed out every day. Our app helps local economies thrive by making local business easier to find wherever you are.

Why Coffee and Coffeehouses
Our founder, Lisa McIntyre, has personally visited hundreds of 
locally-owned and operated coffeehouses and micro-roasters and has had 
many one-on-one discussions with the owners and managers. She learned 
that these entrepreneurs tend to be more involved in their own 
local communities. They participate in community happenings, often 
provide the venue for community gatherings and are always conscious of 
how they can and do give back. Coffeehouses truly are a pinnacle of 
their communities.

Lisa also discovered that the owners express their unique interests and 
passions inside and out of the hand crafted environments they’ve built. 
This offers a unique experience for every customer. Here are just a few 
examples of some of the creativity and passion that breathes in these 
local businesses: 
A fabulous coffeehouse in Dubois, WY displays a wall of fallen soldiers from the region,

A coffeehouse in Denver, CO changes your oil while you relax over a cappuccino. 

A coffeehouse and laundromat in Portland, OR provides state-of-the-art washers and dryers amid artistic strings of found socks. 

Brick and mortar coffeehouses, cafes and roasters bring people 
together, however the coffee itself is also central to American culture. 
We wake 
up to our cup of coffee each morning. Coffee is part of every office 
meeting and social gathering. It also expresses itself (with the help of
 java-obsessed people) creatively when growing, harvesting, roasting and
preparing the perfect cup. 
The Impact: The Local Coffeehouse Guide Benefits Local Business


The App and Website level the
playing field, Little Shop vs. National Chain, by acting as a marketing
department (so to speak) for the independently owned business members in the
directory. This is facilitated by providing them with free listings in the
directory as well as custom tailored robust marketing tools that will
significantly increase their online and mobile visibility in their surrounding
areas and nationally.  Their listings alone, combined with the multi-platform
national marketing of the app and website will allow these small businesses to
compete more effectively as a community of small businesses against corporate
chains. This level of visibility and exposure would typically be unattainable
for most small businesses to achieve on their own.

Photo taken inside a local coffeehouse in Denver, Colorado.

A FREE claimed listing provides a
retail location with the following on both the mobile app and website:

A map marker that automatically geo-locates the user.
A listing that displays their information; address
     with a link to directions from the user's current location, a link to the
     retailer's desired URL, a photo of their location and a place to share
     their story or a brief description of their location.
We highly encourage our retailers to share their
     personal story in order to really connect with people even before they
     walk through the door. This feature truly separates us from the rest.

The additional tools we offer our
members are push notes to app users in their area, searchable defining
characteristics (gluten free, patio, drive-thru, etc), animated map markers to
draw extra attention to their location, and much more. 
In early 2016 we will be offering
three levels of paid membership which include the claimed listing
specifications (above) complimented with the additional tools (i.e. push notes,
categories, and animated markers). Also in early 2016 we will be offering all
of our tools a la carte to members as well. To learn more about our membership
programs and the tools for retailers, please visit our membership page. 


Retailer Criteria for Inclusion in the Directory:


In order for a local coffeehouse, cafe or micro-roaster to be 
represented in our directory they must meet the following criteria:


Location must be locally-owned, independent businesses. No corporate chains or franchises are eligible.

All locations must serve espresso drinks as a primary product offering or be a small batch roaster.


The business has 10 or less locations in the US.
Locations must be in the United States.



The Local Coffeehouse Guide Benefits Coffee Drinkers

According to USA Today (4/9/13), 83% of adults in the US drink some kind of coffee daily and the National Coffee Association reports that 34% of adults drink specialty coffees daily.

We currently have over 16,000
coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters in the directory and more are added
everyday. The app is a user-friendly tool for consumers to find the independent
specialty shops nearby - anywhere in the US from the palm of their hand.
The app locates the consumer then
provides an on-map display and list of all the coffeehouses, cafes and
micro-roasters nearest them. It's perfect for travelers exploring a new town or
for local residents interested in pursuing a new local experience in their own
communities.


Photo from a filmed interview with one of the owners of Kaladi Bros. Coffee in Denver, 2013
Early Achievements


The Local Coffeehouse Guide App
& Website has gained a significant following on social media. On both Facebook
& Twitter, the App and Website have been very well received by coffee retailers and coffee
lovers alike. The independent coffeehouses, cafes and micro-roasters are
pleased with the increased visibility they’ve gained thus far. Coffee lovers,
travelers, home office professionals and students have been thrilled to have a
reliable, easy and interactive way to support the local economies they live in
and visit.
The following milestones have been achieved:
Phase One – Creation of a Business
Model

Market Research
Product Development
Corporate Culture
Business Plan
Legal Representation
Accounting Representation

Phase Two – Mobile App Development:

Structure, layout, functionality and basic design. 
Implementation, customization and successful beta of a
     mobile responsive map directory for both Android and iOS.
Submission and acceptance to iTunes (Apple) and Google
     Play Store. 

Phase Three – Website Development:

Structure, layout, functionality and basic design.
Implementation, customization and successful beta of a
     desktop map directory.
Implementation, customization and successful beta of a
     membership interface for retailers (coffeehouses, cafes &
     micro-roasters) to access and manage their individual listings.

Phase Four - API Bridge Build:
Development and implementation of an API bridge
     connecting the app, the website and the membership platform with a
     customer relations management system (CRM).
Phase Five - New/Improved Mobile Responsive Map: 
Customization, functionality, design and successful
     beta of a new/improved map releasing January of 2016. 
Details: The
current map in the app is very limited for users and retailers additionally it
does not display on Droid devices correctly. After months of research and
testing - we've finally found the map that will work with both Android and iOS.
The new map will provide users with the ability to search for coffeehouses,
cafes and micro-roasters by radius, by characteristics (i.e. Wi-Fi, bookstore, live
music etc.) and searchable by business name nationwide. Additionally, the new
map will provide retailers with a multitude of tools that will help them reach
the residents and visitors of their area directly, effectively and timely.
Phase Six - Monetization:

Retailer membership package development and pricing
Creation of third party sponsorship, partnering and
     advertising
Development of promotional items for retailers and for
     The Local Coffeehouse Guide (i.e. coffee mugs, buttons, post cards, etc.)

Final Stages

The final stages required to complete the build of The Local
Coffeehouse Guide App and Website need more than what our bootstrapping budget
can provide. We are thrilled with the headway we've made thus far but we have a
few more hurtles to overcome. The following are the remaining steps that need
to be taken in order to get The Local Coffeehouse Guide up and running to its
fullest potential:

Native App Build iOS and Android: The platform we
     currently use to house the mobile app is extremely limited for
     monetization, conversion tracking, advertising and marketing. Therefore,
     it is crucial for the success of the app that we begin a native build
     immediately before the business outgrows the current platform.
E-Commerce for the App: Development and implementation
     of a store for users to
     purchase The Local Coffeehouse Guide promotional items. (Postcards, coffee
     mugs, micro-roast coffee club, etc.)
E-Commerce for the Website: Development and
     implementation of an online store for retailer’s
     only (outside of membership packages) offering marketing tools and
     promotional items. 
Website Overhaul: Acquisition of a professional web
     development team to streamline the website with special attention to
     retailer membership, e-commerce, content, general design and SEO
     maximization.
Advertising & Marketing: Acquisition of agency
     representation for on-going regional and national campaigns.

Fundraising
The Local Coffeehouse Guide App
& Website will allocate the raised funds as follows:

Native App Build for iOS and Android: $40,000
E-Commerce for App & Website: $3,000
Website Overhaul: $5,000
Advertising & Marketing: $52,000


This fundraising campaign will take
The Local Coffeehouse Guide App and Website to the next level, serving and
supporting local economies nationwide.

They lived in the 1 bedroom apartment above their bakery for many years until they could afford a house separate from the business. Lisa sees these "mom-and-pops" as a central part of our future as well, as we seek reprieve from corporate "sameness" and relish neighborhood gathering places.

Guinivere Stevenson began her career in marketing/advertising in 1997 with advertising sales in newspaper, radio and magazine. story:
** This campaign is in support of: New Brunswick Coalition for Transparency and Ethics **

We are ready to fight for YOU!

The primary and initial goal for this campaign in it's first year will be to develop a user-friendly website which includes a RTI or Request To Information database.
This will allow anyone who has previously completed and received a RTI to submit the document within the database to be searched by other members looking for supporting documents or perhaps even the very single thing that was uploaded.

This benefits all of us due to costs and time in filing and potentially not even receiving a RTI from government.

We are asking you to support this very important endeavor to increase transparency and ethics by adding an accessible method to cooperate with others who are fighting for the same causes.


The monies raised will be used for:
1. Website design and hosting.
2. Creation of a RTI ( Right To Information ) Database.
3. Various advertising needs - flyers, posters etc. 
4. Costs to hold a 'Rally to Restore the Province!'

All funds raised and spent will be declared in a transparent and open fashion on our website for full accountability and transparency.

//

Nous sommes prêts à combattre pour VOUS!

L'objectif principal et initial pour cette campagne dans sa première année sera de développer un site Web convivial qui comprend une RTI ou appel à la base de l'information.

Cela permettra à tous ceux qui ont déjà terminé et a reçu un RTI de soumettre le document au sein de la base de données pour être fouillé par les autres membres à la recherche de documents ou peut-être même la chose très simple qui a été téléchargé à l'appui.

Cela profite à nous tous en raison de coûts et de temps pour le dépôt et peut-être même pas recevoir un RTI du gouvernement.

Nous vous demandons de soutenir ce très important effort pour accroître la transparence et l'éthique en ajoutant une méthode accessible à coopérer avec les autres qui se battent pour les mêmes causes.

Les fonds recueillis seront utilisés pour:

1. Conception et hébergement du site.
2. Création d'un RTI (droit à l'information) Base de données.
3. Divers besoins de publicité - dépliants, affiches, etc.
4. Coûts de tenir un «Rassemblement pour reconstituer la province!

Tous les fonds recueillis et dépensés seront déclarés d'une manière transparente et ouverte sur notre site pour la pleine responsabilité et la transparence.
